Review Text:
The BEST! Ohhhhhh YES! The BEST among the few BEST; EVER! ?EXCEPTIONAL! 'A' Grade across the board. âœ…
Thank you Singapore Airlines for excellence!?
Still the best of the best. Great food, in-flight entertainment, cabin crew and comfort.
Good!

Travelled London to Singapore on a 380. SIA have a very different view of PE to other airlines. Note their use of 'privilege' and 'priority' in their advertising. PE is simply the front of economy with a flimsy partition between them. They offer a good seat with good features including an exceptional screen and headphones.  Drinks and all other service is with economy; its just you get served first. I have noticed a distinct deterioration in SIA food over the last decade or so, and this flight was no exception. A privilege is to book a special meal. Good idea because the in-flight offerings were not much. However, while plentiful the food was bland and not that well prepared. Wine was served in the smallest glasses I have ever seen on any airline. It was a tasting at best. Further, there was no choice - other than red or white - and the quality was modest. For some reason, the coffee/tea cups were also small. SIA charge plenty for PE, but did not deliver that much. Overall, based on this trip I think Cathay and BA are better value for money and Qantas offers a far better service for about the same cost.  I might take SIA again, but only if I could find no other option.

Bed was reasonably comfortable. Food was awful. Mocha/coffee was dreadful. Cabin crew were attentive. Pilots were great, very vocal and could be easily understood. Flight was mostly smooth and comfortable. Bathroom was kept clean. Pleasant flight but food needs an improvement.

We really love travelling on Singapore Airlines . The staff were excellent , especially Helena, Cai, Philip and Manhas. They were so helpful and friendly. The food was delicious and the drinks great. The seats were comfortable and roomy for economy. Singapore airport is one of our favorite airports in the world, love the orchids and the butterfly enclosure, a very beautiful airport.
Perth to Tokyo and Osaka to Perth via Singapore.  Had not flown Singapore Airlines for many years and was very impressed.  Nice touch to have a choice of Japanese Meal from Osaka to Singapore.

I wasnt expecting this from an airline with whom i travelled the most. Flew premium economy class and to my surpirise wasnt even close to what they advertised. Seriously not happy would never recommend

Perth Singapore London return. A passenger was using an IPad while aircraft was taxiing so I alerted a cabin staff member who told me it was no longer required not to use electronic equipment during take off and Landing. I pointed out that the fasten seatbelt sign also alerted passengers not to use such equipment. I also took a look at the Safety Information card which also stated the equipment should not be used. I also noted that during the serving of meals the cabin staff did not request that seats be returned to their upright position to enable the passenger behind to be able to comfortably eat their meal. The entertainment system was stop go indicating that the server could not deliver the video without stopping to catch up constantly. The pillow provided had a nasty stain on it and finally, the underside of the toilet seat was covered in long term grime, very unpleasant. Look forward to your response.

EDITORS COMMENT:  Electronic devices can be used in flight mode on many aircraft now. The rules for this will vary between airlines and indeed aircraft but definitely it is ok on Singapore Airlines - provided it is in flight mode.  It is nice when the cabin crew ask passengers to put their seats up at meal times and generally the airline do do that. The airline needs to upgrade the entertainment on some older aircraft definitely and as for the toilet  - you can't really control what other passengers have left behind on a long haul flight.

Travelled on a round trip  from Singapore to LA  From take off to touch down,  experience was generally good. However,  am impress with the efficient service I received from  FA Judy, During my return flight  on  SQ 11 from LA to Sin on 20/2 /17, I was supposed to receive products bought at DFS, LAX at the boading gate but  for some reason  the same never reach me as promised. I seek assistance from the crew,  and was attended by Ms Judy who was so professional and helpful  assuring me that she had sent an email to DFS to find a solution to my problem. Judy was so efficient and helpful throughout the handling of the case and  was able ot provide a personal touch and exude warmth and understanding as well as  communicating updates regularly to me until the aircraft made a layover at Narita,Tokyo. At Narita, I was approached by the ground staff  Yuri who continue to update me with the latest status and she too exercise  patient and responsive to my request.
Kudos Singapore Airline, for having a great team who are committed to excellent customer service and one that makes customer feel respected and valued. Judy and Yuri"s dedication to a client's problem is commendable.

Flew Sydney - Singapore- Paris in premium economy. Great seats, extra space very comfortable, food choices great & service as usual, tops. Have now flown with SIA over 15 times and always experienced top quality service & attention . This was our first Premium Economy flights & they were well worth the additional cost, Our return flight in January resulted in an upgrade to Business class for the Singapore -Sydney sector....wow....now we are spoilt ....planning another trip for December 2017...what do we do now !!!
Fucking singapore airlines doesnt care about passengers duty free products,  they always delay in timings, no good service, rude behaviour with passengers i wish nobody should prefer this airlines.

Singapore to Hongkong, First week of March.!
The flight was neat and tidy, quite big. Inflight entertainment was good. I don't have enough choices with Breakfast but good though. The Cabin crew must have good training on how to treat passengers, showing an unhappy face all the time that attending flights is the only duty and not serving for passengers. You can feel comfort during travel except the unhappy airhostess!!

Flew PER-SIN 18/9 and SIN-PER 25/9. Both flights were great with attentive crew. PER-SIN was on a new A350.  Having been the last few trips on Scoot and Jetstar, it was nice to enjoy a full service airline. Lunch consisted of beef rendang with a delicious Maggie Beer ice cream for dessert. IFE system takes a little bit effort to get full use of it.  Sometimes it only offered limited options for music and TV depending on your previous choice.  SIN - PER was on Boeing 787.  We took advantage of early checkin at Jewel Changi so we could have time to explore Jewel. Captain was awesome with giving updates during the flight.  Even though both flights had great crews, I felt on this flight, crew were just a bit more efficient.  Meal was a very delicious chicken in oyster sauce with a Singaporean local brand ice-cream for dessert. I had looked forward to watching part 2 to a series on the IFE that I had watched on my flight the week before but unfortunately could not find on this plane so maybe the IFE varies slightly on different planes.

Having flown with Singapore Airlines over the years and really enjoying their service, our last flight with them was rather disappointing as well as frustrating. Their meals were very average. I had the fish on the return flight and left half of it. My wife was the first to use the toilet and she said it smelt when she went in. Toilet floors were wet with, presumably urine, throughout the flight. They seem to have cut back on the number of flight stewards used to service passengers and the cabin to what they once had. Because our connecting flight was delayed by over an hour, we almost missed our flight for the home leg. Though delays happen of course, there was a lack of communication to passengers about what was happening. Due to the delayed flight our baggage didnâ€™t arrive with our flight. Again, these things happen, but SIâ€™s ground support contractors did not have a record of one of our pieces of luggage. It was a nightmare trying to communicate with the baggage contractors to find out what had happened to our missing luggage.
Singapore-Yangon-Singapore

Recently travelled Perth/Singapore/Paris and then London/Singapore/Perth. The 777s were looking a bit tired but the 380 was good. In the 777 I sat in the aisle seat (centre row) which had reduced foot space so watch out for that one. The entertainment system has a reasonable choice of things to watch but you can't see them all from the beginning. This needs upgrading. Service was very good. The vegetarian meals were average and the non-vege food wasn't much better. All up though, they were okay but will probably try another airline next time.

Overall a good airline but whoever decided that touch screens were a good idea was not thinking straight that day. Who on earth would you put a device on the back of a head rest that is tapped and pressed to operate!! I traveled from Melbourne to London with the back of my head receiving a sporadic tapping from the passenger behind. If you want to feel what it's like just get the person sitting next to you as you are reading this to rest their iphone against the back of your head while they write a text message. Now imagine that for hours on end. That's what it is line in these daft seats.

The Good:
- Flight crew is always friendly, helpful and always seeks to cater to your needs
- Food on the flight is great (though I've noticed Book the Cook options to be limited)

The Bad:
- The SQ JFK check-in process (even for business class) is one of the most chaotic and frustrating experiences I've had. It can take up to 30 minutes being in line (for a Business class passenger) & I've encountered a check-in staff who raised their voice to customers. I even witnessed one of the supervisors rolling their eyes and being snarky at a Business class-Solitaire customer (SQ's highest status) who insisted on lining up in the First Class line (which the SQ website says they are allowed to do so). 

Additional: 
- I've been having issues with missing miles on Singapore's Krisflyer and my interaction with SQ customer service has been a nightmare. It's been 6 months now since I've had the issue, and 4 months since I've flagged the issue to Singapore Airlines customer service, and it has yet to be resolved. It's a shame to see what used to be a great airline fall from grace this quickly and this badly.

We flew FRA -> SIN -> CEB. First leg was Singapore, 2nd was Scoot. Both items of luggage got lost in SIN It took them two and four days to make the luggage available at the destination airport, where I had to pick it up myself. Singapore Airways refers me to Scoot to bargain for a compensation which "we decide on a case by case basis after you prove your expenses". Back in Germany I call their hotline (+49 69 7195-200), but it's busy like "all our agents are busy, call again later". We flew economy in an A380, seats were older than that plane exists. On board entertainment was ancient.

I'm a frequent flyer. My first time with Singapore airline shocked me. The rudeness of their service is appalling. To start with, maybe a smile will help but instead of being friendly this steward insist of being offensive, I can understand he's being treated badly by a couple of Japanese in front of me. It may just be a language barrier. So this jerk choose to deal with this experience by being rude  to everyone in the vicinity. I wish I got his name. He should be fired!

Basically, even though a decent airline, the economy coach baggage allowance of 23kg per luggage piece is simply unreasonably low for international travel. A minimum of 32kg is standard, and the least amount a traveler should be forced to comply with. Had I known Singapore Airlines had such a useless baggage policy, I would have booked my fare on another airline. The kg overages for zone 3 travel are 16$USD PER KILOGRAM. This is an exorbitant and unreasonable rate versus fuel costs. In future I will not be booking any travel on Singapore Airlines. That's not called customer service; it's called extortion.

2th time we flew with SQ to Bali. This time we flew from Dusseldorf. Smooth check in , smooth boarding.  Very good inflight service although one off the flight attendants seemed very stressed to me. She even  didn't make eye contact during inflight service when handing out food or drinks. Good inflight entertainmant system . Smooth touch  down in SGP.

Terrible customer service

I travelled with a group of 35 high school students fro Australia to France. Due to a schedule change by Singapore Airline we missed our connection in Zurich, even though it had been a one-ticket fare. The worst was that Singapore Airlines offered very little help and absolutely no assistance  for what ended either as a 12 hour layover in Zurich or a forced airport change in Paris, from CDG to ORY. Under the ridiculous pretext of 'that it had not been part of our initial ticket' they refused to arrange a connection from Zurich via Geneva to our destination Nice.  And they refused to arrange or pay for  the coach I had to arrange between the two airports in Paris. Our experience with Singapore Airlines customer care was TERRIBLE.
Overall fair service !

Yesterday i flew from Perth to London, via Singapore, with Singapore Airlines. They are currently my favourite airlines to fly with.
The flight staff are amazing! They are genuinely happy and friendly. They seem to be continually offering you a service, but not obtrusively.
They think of things before you do. Like , offering you a drink, more food, collecting your rubbish, taking away your tray!   No sitting with an annoying tray blocking your exit from your seat or restricting your movement for hours!! They even remember what you drink!!!! They warned me that my food choice could be spicy, was i ok with that?
The long flight was enjoyable and I caught up on some great movies and slept well for an economy airline flight. Congratulations on a job well done and excellent pride in your work. 
Thank you.

Singapore to Brisbane SQ176. I travelled with my 11 year old and 16 year old ( on a single booking number) and we were all seated in completely different rows. Our travel agent asked us to confirm the flight which was done in Vietnam by the hotel concierge the day before, and we went on a Silk Air Singapore Airlines flight the day before. They were aware of our ongoing arrangements as they asked if we wanted to put the bags through or not(we had a 1 night stop in Singapore). The check in counter lady in Singapore  was rude and said that the flight was full and it was bad luck and she could do nothing. On my insistence she relunctantly looked and put the children together in row 55 and me in row 46( different cabin). After going to the boarding gate I pleaded with them to see if anything could be done and they quickly were able to change a seat with a single traveller. My family was upset and my little boy was crying but the staff had no compunction to let a child who had the same booking number as his mother , fly an 8 hour international flight alone. 0/10 Singapore Airlines!!
Good service and communication. Comfortable too!

Singapore airlines are terrific their quality of service is second to none. That great service starts right from the booking experience where we had to contact staff over an online booking recently. Helpful and polite always. We fly very frequently to the UK from Auckland and have done so since 1980 we have flown SIA many times during that period although I will say not exclusively. We have always come back to SIA because of the poor service on some of these other airlines. The age of SIA fleet is one of the youngest in the world and they are maintained in tip top condition. A big attraction too for kiwis is that they fly to Singapore direct from Auckland unlike some of their Gulf and Aussie competitors who have other stops that add to the journey time

My husband flew business from melbourne to manila and found business to be less then fair..the food was poor , the seating old and shabby, comparef to garuda which we flew from Amerstedam to Jakarta  which was amazing food , service and comfortable. .Singapore  airlines needs to pick up its act ...would never recommended  spending  the money to fly business with them again...

Living in Adelaide we don't have much choice, but have to say SQ's service is one of the better choices we can choose. Travelling on Dec 25 I didn't think it would be busy, but a full flight. Staff were professional and pleasant, service was excellent. Plane was an older A330 but clean and comfortable. IFE great and the food was professional plated and vast. You can't be hungry on a SQ flight from ADL.

Just recently flew Singapore Airlines from AKL-SIN-BOM and back. I fly frequently with SQ and i have to say their inflight service always is the best no matter what, however i was kind of disappointed with the A380 aircraft on my route from AKL-SIN. I do understand that the aircraft they use is about 8 years old now but their economy class seats are quite uncomfortable for a 10 hour flight. I wont complain about IFE systems they are ok, does not have touchscreen like its competitors Emirates, Korean, Thai etc. I much prefer their Boeing 777 aircraft economy as the seats are spaced out atleast. Apart from that i have no complaints for SQ, i only wish they upgrade their economy like how Emirates has now on most of their aircrafts to better seats and bigger screens.

Having used Singapore Airlines extensively (Solitaire member) over the past few years I am quite disappointed with Singapore Airlines and find the over rated, expensive and little value for money. As I flew return to New York for the first time (I normally go east via Japan) this was a very poor experience, not only in the air but on the ground as well. In essence you are treated as a "transaction" on the ground and in the air. The food offered is very poor. I have given up on the chicken satay that is being served on every flight as starters as they are dried out, poor quality and when you add that the choices are quite messy as "warmed up food" normally is. My wife had given up on Singapore airlines and flew to London via Hanoi with Vietnam airlines and she said, twice the service at half the cost in Business class. I will try this route on my next time as they seem hungry to deliver service and at a reasonable price where I am not at all happy with Singapore Airlines although I have used them extensively in the past. From now on, I will spread my patronage with local airlines ( not SILK) as they seem very motivated to serve whereas Singapore Airlines seems arrogant and take your patronage for granted.

I used to be a loyal SQ frequent flyer. But not anymore. SQ really need to improve their service. Seriously, once in a while I take coach, and the service are terrible!!! First, a smile wouldn't hurt. If all of you somehow managed to hurt ur jaw and can't smile, at least do not look annoyed. I frequent travel in First or Business so-so service, somehow they managed to smile in these part of the plane. Travel with a child? Strongly suggest another airline. This one is not child friendly at all... 
Once I travel in coach with a broken seat (slightly reclined, around 2 cm). One of the crew asked me to change seat during take off and landing, ok no problem, for safety reason, Got that. BUT with attitude. She said to me, "MAM, you can't seat here, you need to move with ur baby." She moved me to business class and right after take off she said "Mam, u need to move back now, this is business class area". Seriously?!? Now I fly any other airlines, Garuda, Emirates, ANA, Korean Air, top notch service, good food as well. So SQ, hospitality 101 for your crew is urgently needed!!!
Very good airline to travel with, everything was done how you would expect from a premium carrier. Always depend on the same high standard of service its a credit to the airline.

Terrible non existent customer service. I can't believe Changi does not even have a person from SQ direct to assist their passengers and the one person they had on duty could not do a thing. Needless to say it took 5 hours before we even speak with him.  He was a puppet with no discretionary authority to approve anything whatsoever.

Flight out of Guangzhou late due to late arrival of inbound from Singapore. Arrived Singapore with just enough time to transfer to gate with more than 15 mins before flight would have left but were told they would not let us on connecting flight. I didn't care about my baggage transfer made no difference.They changed us to flight 6 hrs later arriving  5.20am. Not good working at 8am with clients and patients. Need sleep, could not pay to upgrade to business to get some sleep short of $3500 one way per pax. What a joke. Preprared to pay reasonable but not $3500!

Add vouchers given had a wrong date next day, so couldn't be used!!!!

Service so bad, systems awful. One and only actual SQ staff in the whole of Changi airport, rest of staff outsourced to Changi airport. They had absolutely no authority at all. Complete disgrace.

Zero rating

Flew from Brisbane to London on 3 November 2015 with a four-hour layover at Changi airport. I have always found Singapore staff to be very efficient and functional rather than 'friendly' and this experience was no different. This is not necessarily a bad thing - frankly I prefer a 'direct' approach when getting from A to B. Nonetheless, the flight was comfy and the food and entertainment good for both legs (regionally Cathay Pacific for me have the edge with food). While Singapore can be expensive if you catch one of their quick-fire sales you can secure a great deal. 
EDITORS COMMENT: couldn't agree with you more  - you're exactly right!
Very good experience I had during my journey from India to Australia. The attendants are really good and supportive. Traveling with a kid alone I find the crew more supporting and accomodating

3 years agio this business class product used to be a quality one. Now it is absolutely awful. Aircraft is messy, old and dirty, but that's not even the headline of awful. It is the staff. From the minute you enter the lounge to the time you exit the flight, it is so unpleasant bordering on hostile. I have never experienced a worse business class airline experience in my life, and I can't even imagine how bad the economy class must be!!!

I have always traveled by Singapore airlines for all my international trips and never had a problem with them. The inflight experience, quality of food and beverages were of high standards. Would definitely recommend this airline to everyone, never had a problem with SIA.

On Friday evening, I flew from Singapore to Sydney. In the first hour I became very very sick with what I now know to be viral gastro. I was vomiting almost constantly for the first 3 hours of the flight, at which point I asked the staff for assistance. They offered me a charcoal pill, a woman who wasn't a doctor diagnosed me with food poisoning, and then proceeded to encourage me to drink water (which I couldn't keep down) and -wait for it!- hot strong black tea with sugar in it. A caffeinated sugary diuretic when I was already dehydrated. She even looked offended when I said no thank you. I then begged for a place to lie down (even the floor) as I was in agony sitting - they said simply sorry, flight's full, and offered no further assistance. Right before the end of the flight they took my temperature twice suggesting they may need to quarantine me and lastly offered me medical assistance for when we landed - which I declined as I'd rather see my own doctor thank you very much.  Any airline can do well when things are easy - this airline will not help you when you need it the most. RUBBISH service and dangerously negligent. Just wait til someone has it worse than I did and sues. 
EDITORS COMMENT: That must have been awful for you.  It sounds however   like they did what they could given it was a full flight.  No medication available over the counter can really help with vomiting and sweet tea is often used by Asian cultures to calm down an upset stomach. All they can really do is keep you warm and hydrated as best they can. It must have been an absolutely awful flight for you but there really isn't much they can do

Very disappointed.  Paid for good seats, Singapore changed them.  They admit it was their mistake but all they can offer now is for me to change my flight or be separated from my daughter.     What is worse is they LIED to me in first instance as I was first told it was because I changed date (it has never changed), then told I had changed them myself (I hadn't).  Although they admit their mistake the only choice is for me to take a later flight.

Not very impressed with Singapore Airlines. In the route Perth - Singapore - Perth they put old planes with outdated entertainment screen. Food was pretty average as well and on my return flight I ended up eating an oily deep fried fish as they ran out of the beef.

The person at the check-in was a bit rude and didn't know I could use my Star Alliance Gold status from other company on this flight. Took her 10 minutes to sort it out and she even told me she needed to check if the card was not fake!

As I'm a tall guy, I paid an extra $60 for the exit row with extra leg room but the seat was so worn out and it was very uncomfortable, so I spent 5 hours sit on something with no cushion. After complaining and being ignored by two different crew members, the third one at least tried to put a blanket over the seat, which didn't help too much. Complaint via website remains unanswered after two weeks.

Not many options on this route but I'd rather fly Qantas than Singapore Airlines.

EDITORS COMMENT: There are still a few outdated aircraft flying around but pretty soon you should see an improvement on this (we hope!)

Flew from SIN to Hanoi last month with SIA, and the service was definitely up to expectations. In-flight entertainment variety was plentiful, and the food tasted surprisingly good (for an airline meal). Take-off was delayed on both legs of the flight by 10 minutes, but I'm cool with that. Still managed to reach destination before the stipulated time.

Flight attendants were friendly and approachable. Top-notch service. Sometimes people have too strong a sense of self-entitlement that any requests not met satisfactorily is "bad service" without even thinking whether their requests are out of the line. Cheers to Singapore Airlines for such a pleasant and comfortable flight.

My first long haul experience and its was comfortable and with such great in flight entertainment the journey past quickly. The staff were so friendly and helpful would recommend this airline.

EDITORS COMMENT: They're one of our favourites for long haul economy travel too.

Houston to Moscow to Singapore to Manila - and return a month later;  Amazing Service in Economy that exceeds business class on some other airlines - start with steaming towels almost as soon as the seatbelt light goes out followed by juice, coffee, wines, even mixed drinks - snacks, exceptional meals of both asian and western cultures, and if they dont bring something soon enough you can walk back to the galley and request a wide variety of in between snacks including "toberlone chocolates" however during daytime flights they are going up and down the isles almost continuosly - 249 movies some less than a month or two since release, 500 other television shows - i binge watched whole seasons with  the first two legs of the trip each about 12 hours - Also 110 outlets and usb - oh, and i cant forget the courtesy zippered cloth bag with socks, toothbrush and toothpaste - i ended up with 4 of them in a round trip - super satisfied

Richard
Travelled on a Boeing 777 from Perth to Singapore and Singapore to Perth
Aircraft look a bit old sitting on runway, I like to see wing lets on the wing tips.
But once in side every thing look modern and neat, It is amazing what a refurbish can do.
Flight both ways was very comfortable and little turbulence both ways.
On arriving back in Perth, the landing was the best I have ever seen, This Captain knew how to fly a 777 and land one. Well done Captain 
Made a point of congratulating him and first office in the baggage hall on a pleasant flight.
To my surprise they both had time to listen and reply to my questions
And where eager to know why I was so interested in Aviation.                 Flying never leaves you after 35yrs . Just the sadness I not be-able to do it any-more.

Excellent service, food and inflight entertainment. 
Indeed lives up to its name of Singapore Airlines - a great way to fly!
Service crew were always smiling and willing to assist!

It was a fabulous flight. In one of them, we even got awesome touchscreen TVs! You could ask for any food if you wanted and if they had it, they would deliver. It was great. Just a bit more cleaniness and it would be perfect. We got to board early which was a suprise since it was a ecomony flight. We also got a mini amenity kit with super warm and cosy socks, tooth paste and toothbrush. Definitely fly again. We went from MEL to DEL
I flew Perth to Singapore and then transferred to the Singapore to Newark in Business Class, great service, food and comfort.

Perth to Singapore and return on a A330. If flying to Singapore from Perth definitely try a book on this aircraft type. Seating layout is 2-4-2 and the seat widths are slight bigger than on 777s. While Qantas continues to use narrow body jets between Perth and Singapore, I'll stick with Singapore Airlines. You got to hand it to Singapore Airlines, time and time again they deliver a first class product.

Flight:SQ221 (A380)
From Singapore to Sydney.
Check-in at Changi Airport was the worst. We travelled as a family of 5 (4 adults and a 3 years old). The woman who checked in our luggages was very unhappy, rude, uneducated and moody, tried to pick on us every little thing. She has no understanding of family travelling with small children. Shame on Singapore airline, we have been travelling with you for soon long and this would be the last, never again. On board, food was as bad, I did not have a choice, there were not enough for everyone to choose so I had to take what was left. Very poor services, worse than budget airlines.

it appears that Singapore Airlines slogan "Placing you at the heart of everything we do", only applies when you are actually travelling, any customer service does not extend to dealing with complaints regarding delays quickly and efficiently. We were delayed 24 hours in September 2023, and we are still waiting for the airline to resolve and comply with UK civial aviation rules regarding compensation.

Our airplane had a technical issue on the Moscow-Singapore (Airbus 350 SQ361 dep 3/01/17) leg on the journey to Australia. Passengers were kept inside of the airplane for 6 hours  while the airplane was remaining on the ground in Moscow airport. SQ did not arrange return of passengers back to the terminal. Neither hot meal was served onboard  (this might have breached russian law by the way) only a pack of chips within 6 hours.  Crew provided little and infrequent information. Some passengers panicked and disembarked. 
We missed our connecting flight to Sydney and had to spend an extra 9 hours waiting for the next flight. As a result of the delay I was supposed to go to work straight from the airport after 38 hours of the prolonged joureney. I asked the airline to upgrade me so that I at least I could arrive in a better shape. I expected a "premium" airline to take steps to at least partly rectify their fault. However, Singapore's airlines acted as a budget airline. They suggested to do it for an extra payment despite having spare seats.
SQ asked me to write a detailed letter describing what happend. I spent my time and did that. In response I only received a standard email.

This is Still one of the best airlines. I have been travelling by Singapore airlines for the last 20+ years to travel between San Francisco and Hyderabad. The in-flight service used to be excellent, but I still rate it today as very good. From San Francisco to Hyderabad, there is almost close to 10hr layover in Singapore and that is painful.

I flew in December 2014 from Hyderabad to San Francisco by SQ 5473 and SQ 16. The in-flight service is very good, but I rate their airport check-in, boarding (at Singapore and Hong Kong),  and reservations services to be mediocre. Everything is controlled by Singapore Airlines headquarters at Singapore. There is no clear process for their seat assignment or when they make them available--very poor. They use their subsidiary SilkAir to serve between Singapore and Hyderabad. They have quite confusing baggage rules between these two airlines, especially if you are a Star Alliance member. They published baggage rules on Singapore airlines website and depending on which agent you get to talk to, they will interpret them differently. Watch out!!!

I recently flew from LAX to Singapore and back on sq 11 and sq 12. I love flying Singapore Airlines. What I like most is - it is very reliable. I can trust it to be on time, on my bags to be safe and on courteous friendly helpful staff. The food varies, sometimes excellent, other times good but always good. What I appreciate most is the friendly helpful air steward and stewardess. They are unfailingly good but every now and again we get excellent ones like a Garry Lee. He warmed the air with his warm friendliness and care and concern for all passengers. It warmed my heart especially when the turbulence gave me some motion sickness. He taught a simple breathing technique which really help. I used to fly EVA, MAS, and the past five years SIA only and would not change it for any other.
Good service!

Due off the Vulcano, we could'nt leave Bali in november 2015.
The staff in Bali and in Singopore did a great job for us.
They give us the right information about the situation, hotel, transport and meal in Bali and Singapore.
Thank you very much, you did, under hard circumstances, a great job!

Recently i booked Singapore airlines from Melbourne to Ahmadabad am krisflyer member and use this flight frequently  .I thought airbus  380 would be good but that not true at all .one of the worst experience ever with sia air . They told me front of my seat screen is not working before take off  and staff could not help me with that  booked two tickets and they ask me  to move some where else because of screen was not working .i asked both off us to relocate but they said 
not possible .I  was seating there for 7 hours without any entertainments .which was disgusting .i paid full amount of my tickets.last time i  cut m self because of knife was in my seat and i cut my finger because of it and could not get right answer at that time they said crew member might forgot there.its last time i m traveling with Singapore airlines .
Flew again this year Heathrow to Christchurch via Singapore. Once again good food and service staff couldn't do enough for you.

Singapore Airlines the Best Airlines. 
The cabin crew is excellent service.

Went from jhb to singapore on a 777 on nov 8th. I travel a lot and this was one of the worst experiences ever. I usually fly with Emirates who I have never had a bad experience with.  The 777 was old, had a terrible in flight entertainment system...many of the tvs did not work.  The seat in front of me, it's back kept getting detached and falling on my legs. Air con was centrally controlled and we were freezing. I had three blankets.  Absolutely shocking experience all around.

So this is from beginning to end: 1
Missed my check in time at OR Tambo Johannesburg an hour through no fault but my own. The local Singapore Airlines staff were absolutely professional and courteous, not to mention very helpful in sorting out my flight for the next day (not a lot of flights leaving from that particular destination). So THANK YOU O.R. TAMBO JOHANNESBURG SINGAPORE AIRLINES! Good people deserve good treatment.

Thank you Anupam and Yap for the wonderful Hospitality . I had a lovely time on my return journey in Business class on 05/12/2015 between Singapore and Kolkata. My seat number was 11K. Thank you Again. Will definitely travel again in this aorline

I travelled Singapore Airlines from Perth to Singapore in January this year on an A330.   Seating and entertainment were reasonable but on this occasion, the meals were of a very poor standard.  I have travelled on numerous occasions to Singapore (9 times in the last 7 years) on Singapore Airlines and am not usually disappointed but this trip was below par. I travelled with my partner and granddaughter who was aged 6 and the usual activity packs were not supplied.  On the return flight, we were held up on the runway for two and a half hours due to a fuel leak.  During this delay, the staff were excellent and kept us informed as to what was happening. Even though this was not the best flight I have had with this airline, I would travel with them again.

Flew to and from australia from holland. To australia was excellent with enough beverages ,ice cream offered. Flight attendents were very nice and helpful. The flight back there were hardly any drinks offered. I think i had dinner twice. Actually ive never had  breakfast . one stewardess wasnt very friendly after i told her i wasnt feeling well . 
My rating of a 10 has sadly changed to a 7

Disgraceful quality and service extremely disappointed will be informing my agent Flight Centre,
Flight SQ727 09/03/2023 seat 65C,  Phuket To Singapore. Extremely cold have been feeling unwell asked for a rug on arrival, told could not have one. I was pushed and shoved by passengers and staff the entire journey. They ran out of food for the last two rows of food, unacceptable. when something was provided the plane was landing and we did not have time to consume disgraceful.

Flight SQ 215 9/03/2023 seat 67G. Once again towards back of plane and aisle seat same thing pushed and shoved entire flight no chance of sleep at all. Due to not feeling well I made a special food booking request of bland, when delivered it was fish,  the steward was very rude and abruptly told me that I had miss ordered. When a senior officer was called I indicated to him that staff need to be mindful of all customer service needs. We chose to fly with Singapore Airlines over other carriers because of its good standing, we will not make this mistake again. I will not recommend any one uses your carrier in the future.
Very friendly and helpful staff.  Special thanks to Cybelle from Singapore airlines Perth

Travelled Auckland to London via Singapore there and back in December. The direct flight from Auckland to Singapore is a winner but it was on the 777-200 ER and they are really getting very shabby( I flew SQ281 and 282} the entertainment screen is about the size of the IPad mini and impossible to see in daylight. The programme was pretty awful too so I did not miss much as I slept most of the way to Singapore and on the return to Auckland. Do with an up grade on these aircraft SIA. The flight from Singapore to London was pretty good on the more modern 777-300ER and it was great (SQ 308) The return from London to Singapore SQ317 was excellent right up to world standard aircraft and entertainment systems albeit the programme choice was very SIA. Ive flown a lot of times with SIA over the years and they are terrific and do go the extra mile. We had to run the length of terminal 3 At Singapore on the way back as 317 was slightly late... and people thats a long terminal! We just made it for boarding. Did not expect to see our bags in Auckland but hey there they were covered in priority stickers and all first off. too.

Suffered Food poisoning on SQ175 10th June from Hanoi - Singapore. The meal was seafood noodles approx 8-10 hours after meal started with stomach cramps progressed to severe vomiting and diarhoea for a 12 hour period. Doctor diagnosed some form of food poisoning. This was the only meal that differed between my wife and I in the 24 -48 hour period.

Hello.
I recently flew on Singapore Airlines from Rome to Singapore and I wanted to take the time to express my complete satisfaction with the experience. Everything was exceptional, and the cabin crew was the most remarkable part. In particular I would like to thank Xie Mingjia for her professionalism, courtesy, and welcoming attitude. Her thoughtfulness and bright personality are greatly appreciated!

I previously had positive things to say about Singapore Airlines, but in this case, I was very frustrated. I paid extra for an upgraded seat with extra legroom. Instead, the seat was in front of the exit door and had less legroom. In addition, the TV was broken and so for the entire 16 hour flight, I could not watch any TV. Two thumbs down.

I travelled from Manchester U.K. to Houston, Texas and return. This is an outstanding airline, the entire experience from booking to onboard was genuinely exceptional. I had to change my return date and this was handled  with minimum fuss. I found the staff and crew friendly and responsive. 
I travel extensively for business and pleasure and this is by far the best airline I have travelled with. I live in London but this flight was only available from Manchester, it was well worth the effort, and, as I travel to Houston regularly I most certainly will be travelling via  Singapore  Airlines again. As a result of my experience, my son and his family have booked with this airline on this route for their upcoming holiday.

we flew from guangzhou to singapore then to brisbane Australia 15-16/Jan/2016. when we landed, we realised our laptop's missing, we was not sure from which trip it was gone, i sent email to the airport and to the airline. one week later, a lady from singapore airline rang me on my mobile, she found my number from the tag. she was exited to find me and told me the laptop's there. she then arranged it flew on a flight next day and sent email to all the parties involved. she followed it up everyday till i confirmed we had collected the laptop from brisbane airport. during this time, some other staff had been sending me email to advise status, etc. very impressive services. not the first time to flight with them, but they have been excellent as always.

Frankfurt to Singapore on Singapore Airlines SQ325, 23 February 2023. 1st drink service served on trays with cups of water or juice & pack of mixed nuts instead of the drink trolley. 1hr+ into a 12hr flight, dinner was served. When it was my turn, I asked for a beer with my dinner but was told there was no more beer onboard explained staff. This flight felt a lot like Scoot.

PREMIUM ECONOMY Singapore to Newark, around 17 + hours. We purchased a RTW ticket.  We took 4 Economy flights and 1 Premium Economy flight.  We have no complaints about the 4 Economy flights.
Some aspects of PE flight were good but others very disappointing. Cabin, seating and entertainment were good but that is where PE ended.  No champagne send off on our flight.  No pre dinner drink at all.
Food was very ordinary and we were only offered 2 meals on this long flight.  They did offer very plain snack food in between but it was pretty bad.  Another complaint was the 12 hours of cabin darkness, just too long for most people. We have travelled PE 2 other times in recent years and they where great.
Only reason I would recommend this flight is time factor.  25 Hours from Perth to Newark.

Exceptional customer service and facilites.
We were caught in the floods in Chennai, India and missed our flight.
After being shamefully abandoned by our travel insurer we rang Singapore Airlines and got put on a later flight free of charge.
Very impressed, best airline i've ever flown on and will definitely return.
The cabin crew had a bad attitude.

1- Most of everything about SA are overrated. SA seems to spend a lot of money on advertisement and creating an artificial or fake image of how good it is. But the reality is the opposite.

2. From booking to lounge experience to in-flight service to post-flight service, it's all disappointing quality. It's all at the surface and for appearance, but substance or sincerely. Even the smiles from FAs are fake!

I was travelling from Singapore to Vietnam at around midday and the heat was quite unbearable. What made things worse was that our flight was delayed for 45mins & we were already in the plane! The vessel was quite dated and the airconditioning was terrible. On the upside, the crew was friendly and prompt. They served the food quickly as I think passengers were being cranky. The seats were pretty comfortable, in my opinion. I was able to sleep through the flight despite the weak AC. Good thing it was a short flight. Some of their planes need upgrading pretty bad. However, I'm quite happy with their service overall and I will still book my flights with them.

EDITORS COMMENT: You're right some planes do need updating but they are in the process of it  - its just takes a while. Thanks for sharing your balanced review with us.

I tried to call the customer service thru both the toll free number and the 312-843-5333 number, both of them lead to the waiting time more than an hour and once someone pick up my phone, he told me that I called the wrong department because I should call the Kris Flyer number instead. However, both number has the automatic system and let me choose the Kris Flyer department and reward flight inquiry. So the representative put me to the "kris flyer dept" again and I had to wait for it for so long for nothing. I did try to make this call over the weekend already, I had 2-3 times over 1hr wait experience without anyone pick up the phone. Singapore Airline claims the customer service is 24h every day, I wonder how they can make this claim when I had tried multiple times attempts to contact anyone over the phone. All I want to do is to cancel a reward flight, and it is not allowed to do it online. If you let people change flight online, then why not cancel flight? It will save people so much time. I fly Singapore airline for business all the time, I can't believe the customer service is that poor. This is a huge disappointment and I canâ€™t imagine if I have something urgent and require t

The best airline I have ever flown with. The friendliness of the staff, the quality of the food, the generosity with beverages, the excellent entertainment and extra space in the seats all contributed to a very pleasant journey - even on a 13 hour flight! Thank you Singapore airlines!

I recently travelled from Perth to Paris.  I've used Singapore Airlines several times in the past, but on this occasion was very disappointed.  The meals on both the Perth/Singapore and Singapore/Paris were really poor quality and incredibly salty.  The 777 on the Perth leg seemed to have seen better days; the headphones didn't work and the entertainment system was very out-of-date and we were not able to start one movie from the beginning (I travelled recently from Perth/Sydney with Qantas and their touch screen system is really great).  Qantas seemed to lose the plot for a while, but they seem to have lifted their game, with both their food and their service.  On both the Singapore Airlines flights, some of the staff were not really interested.  The food and the service on Perth/Delhi flights with SQ last year were both very good (the Perth/Singapore leg only). We travelled on the A380 through to Paris this time. The seats are incredibly hard and uncomfortable. I'll be going back to Qantas if my flight home from London/Perth has not improved.
i have flown with singapore airlines several times i have to say the airline is the greatest. cabin crew are friendly respectful and extremely helpful
Once great airline now rates 0 for customer service - changes booked flights and do not coordinate with partner airlines leaving customers stranded for days. Very hard to contact by phone.

I took Singapore Airlines from Riyadh to Manila and it was the best airline from food to flight attendant. However, the FAs from the flight Singapore to Manila is not that friendly.

Overall, my experience with Singapore Airlines was excellent.

We flew Singapore to Perth and the food was cold. Cold chicken and cold beef steak .
I saw sick bags being handed out, on a very smooth flight probably because of the cold food!

Ive been flying with Singapore since 2008 - backwards and forwards from Perth to Beijing mainly. Its a good airline with friendly cabin crew and great safety record. Rarely are they behind schedule and connections are rarely missed. Food is average to poor.

Flights to China from Singapore are excellent with newer model 777s and A380s generally not too full. Perth to Singapore and back are always full and not pleasant with the ageing 20 plus year old 777-200s.
per-sin-bkk-sin-per 777 200

SYD-SIN and SIN-DEL. 777-200ER then A330-300. Economy. Brilliant inflight service sets SIA apart from the other airlines I have used recently. The cabin crew were unstinting in their attention. The Boeing was a more pleasant experience then the Airbus; even though it was the older plane. The food was tasty and adequate (as good as it can be in economy). Good beverage and drinks service. The seats could have more padding; I used a blanket on the seat to increase my comfort (I don't have much padding of my own!). One of the best experiences I have had in economy; plus the special fare I paid was great value.

Booked Business Class tickets purely on feedback from friends and relatives. Were 2 hours late taking off from Perth due to faulty sensor on Cargo door.
Consequently missed onward connection in Singapore and were quickly kept on our way. Full marks for effort, really tried hard. Only blemish IMHO was the use of another airline we had tried to avoid, and to be honest were badly inadequate by Singapore Airline standards....we did not want to go on this flight....really.

EDITORS COMMENT: Thanks for the honest review - i presume the other airline might have been lufthansa? SQ are very efficient and delays and missed connections are dealt with so well by them.

Recent severe damage to suitcase. Zippers torn out and material ripped.
Excellent repair through Bags to Go in Canberra.
Excellent service and follow up by Singapore airlines staff.

I normally take china airlines for my monthly flight from Surabaya to Singapore but decided to give it a try n choose SIA as most people referred them as a quality airlines. I found that the departure time is nice but the return time is way too early in the morning so my travel agent adviced me to use SIA sister company, Silk Air  for the return. Expecting something special  as im paying more money, i didnt find anything special except the extra amenities. The so called Singapore Ladies/stewardess that are heavily advertised on Media are nothing special. I would fare them as OVERRATED so dont be fooled by the apperance from the advertisements, how cute n caring they are. Overall, i wouldnt suggest  to everyone who think they pay more n likely to get more, dont bet all your money . Please prepare to be disappointed.

I fly twice a year to India with Singapore airlines as thats the only airline flies to my city in the shortest flying time. but the staff and the policy has been made to make customers more inconvenience.  I booked two tickets both with Singapore airlines bt they will not book my bags from start to end destination when asked is it against the security or airport rules or is it illegal, they said no but because its not on the same ticket i will need to collect bags and check in again. guess  my connection time was  1 hr between two flights. same airline  two tickets but wont help.

Singapore Airlines services are very biased, though I flew on it a couple of times, it seems good services are given if and only if you are either from a western country or you have a wallet stashed with cash to fly Business Class which normally cost $6000 from SIN - MEL - SIN. Nothing impresses me, the IFE are old, they have yet to install touch screens on the aircraft.

Other airlines than Singapore Airlines have performed better, even Xiamen Airlines. Qantas does have better services in being updated with new IFE systems and movies.
Really poor service during the check in (even a krisflyer member)
Second time flying with Singapore airlines. Good service. No troubles booking. Service on board always good. Ordered special meals for both myself and boyfriend and requirements were met well.

I always had a great experience flying with Singapore airlines but even more so after they helped to handle a lost luggage with Vueling. I took 3 trips to BArcelona airport over 4 days, many futile calls to their Vueling hotline and emails  correspondence with no response and yet was unable to resolve my lost luggage issue. I had to fly back to my home country via Singapore airline today, when I recounted my terrible experience with the SIA crew on board. They suggested I contact the station manager in Barcelona for help. To my pleasant surprise, the manager readily agreed to help and are in the process of not only not only liaising with Vueling but also to transport the luggage back to me. The service level is outstanding and beyond one's expectations. There is no question that I will fly Singapore airlines wherever possible!

They changed my flight without proper notification. And then when I asked them for any possible solutions they were extremely rude. They refused to take any responsibility and were just horrible to deal with. I even asked to speak to a supervisor and the guy simply said there is no one else to talk to. They will send an email to your spam folder, tell you that you didn't see it and it isn't their problem. Horrible company will never deal with them again.

Attempted to contact customer service many times about a problem with my booking.
Could not get in touch with anyone from Singapore airlines with many attempts. 
I will definitely never be using them again.
Their incompetence caused me stress and loss of money.

Travelled SQ211 on 31/10/2016 from Singapore to Sydney. What a shabby, old aircraft! Old seats with cracked leather. Lots of old food debris within food table area. Difficult to eject the tray. Obviously mainyenance non existent. 
Bathroom despicable! Old cracked washbasin,with mould. Flush mechanism leaky, floors constantly wet as a rely. Poor amenities! 
Food deplorable the supposed fancy chef pork loin not edible as dry and tough. Wines appalling, cheap Devils lair hidden cave! 
Staff service hit and miss! Robotic, no follow through on requests, seem to have memory loss! This was our side A and D seats, the other aisle the lights were on with those staff as they were slick and efficient! After long sleep I requested cup tea but told to wait for regular service yet on other aisle again they received their requests! Oh the inconsistency! 
SIA never again I have done 3  other flights all on business this trip and also to China return in 2014 and can see no improvements so I better pack my toys and find another more dynamic and modern airline! I am wasting my business class money! Goodbye!

I flew from Singapore to Brisbane on wednesday night 6/1/2016. The flight was the worst i have ever been on. Seat was uncomfortable, screaming,crying infants for almost the whole flight. I also flew from Frankfurt to Singapore with the touch screen entertainment. What a stupid idea that is. Bump the screen and it turns on even if you do not want it to. I am glad the rest of my holiday was a lot better than the flights.

I have been a loyal Singapore Airlines traveler over the last 30 years. 
They have never disappointed and in my last return flight from Seoul to Perth, via a transit in Changi, Singapore, it was seamless, comfortable and restful. Except that I wish they did not wake me up at 4am for breakfast!
Will continue to fly with Singapore Airlines with no hesitation.

We had never flown with Singapore airline before and a few of our closest friends had recommended this airlines to us. We were absolutely let down with the service and the attitude of the air hostesses was appalling. The service was awful and the cabin crew were curt and pretty blunt. we travelled with our infant and there was a mix up of our seats to begin with and my wife and 4 month infant, which was corrected however. Mid flight we were told to use the toilets which were 20 rows of seats away while holding an infant through turbulence. when requested that it is too far to hold an infant and get there, they were blunt saying that the other restrooms are reserved for only business class. The captain had already said that the flight was going to be turbulent due to a weather report all they way till Singapore. So here we are mid flight holding an infant and walking through the aisle and fearing for the baby's safety while the crew nonchalantly went about serving food while we waited to return to our seats. This just proves that Singapore airlines is just like all other just value money and not the customers. Had we known this earlier we would have booked our regular airlines

I flew from Manchester, England to Sydney Australia via Singapore. And having flown from Sydney to Manchester and Manchester to Sydney many times only ever using Emirates and Qantas I found a cheap deal with Singapore airlines and thought I'd give them ago. Now being from England emirates are one of the most advitised and so I thought was the best airline. How I have been very wrong. In economy the seat sizes seem pretty much the same but with Singapore I found the seat cushions were a lot softer. The major difference I found with singapore was the service. They made me feel like a queen! They were always smiling and welcoming. And this being a night flight they didn't sit down for four hours for next meal time they circled with drinks and snacks in between more than once! And it wasn't just a little sack of peanut's like other airlines. They were going out of their way to ensure I was happy and comftable. If you get the choice to fly singapore, don't hesitate!

Dirty old planes. Interior needs refitting. Entertainment system rarely works and the plane is often delayed due to unknown issues. Staff are friendly but the whole experience is ruined due to the filthy and decrepit interior.

Not worth it. I once thought this was a great airline but it turned out to be a disaster. Most of those positive reviews about Singapore Airlines (SA) turned out to be untrue. SA seems spend a lot of money on advertising, but it's all hollow. The true value is very poor. Customer service is far worse than what they project (advertise) to be.

Booked a round trip on premium economy and had to change the date going over a couple months later. The website is set up to edit your booking with check boxes on the outbound and on the inbound segment indicating do you want to edit this segment. I checked the outbound and changed the date.  Never giving mind to the inbound since I didn't check the box to edit. After completing/paid went and selected the seats and noticed the inbound said not selected.  Since I had 32 A&C and could not access the premium economy section called customer service.  After 40 minutes, they said that I changed the flight and did not select premium for the return.  I said the obvious that I only checked one box and verified it they said itÃƒÂ¢Ã¯Â¿Â½Ã¯Â¿Â½s a round trip and had to verify both segments.  I said automatically changing my premium economy to economy without check marking that segment is ridiculous.  They said that's the way the system works and I said it's a deficient system and to fix it.  They said they can't fix it I asked for a manager who said the same thing but would escalate it.  Week later still waiting

Could not fault singapore airlines the cabin crew treat my 3 children like royalty Excellent service Delicious food plenty to drink Couldnt fault the entertainment also children activity packages were given to keep them entertained Cannot fault this airline or cabin crew who went above and beyond Definately fly with them again when i fly to Australia again next august

Singapore Airlines is the best airline I have ever flown on! I got sick while on the plane and got given top class treatment and a delicious pot noodle in staid of a meal that would upset my tummy. If you work at Singapore air I would love to say a huge thanks for my top experience in economy class and wish I could relive those 10 hours.

EDITORS COMMENT: It's great to hear such positive feedback. They are one of the best airlines and its for reasons just like this.
It was a great flight from singapore to sydney and melbourne to singapore. I was travel in suite class and really enjoy it

Do you want to experience 6 Star Travel in Economy Class? Then, you're in luck. Singapore Airlines "Trumps" all the rest in every category. Pardon the pun. I recently had the great privilege of travelling from Amsterdam, Holland to Singapore on Singapore Airlines, and what an experience it was. From the moment I arrived at the airline's check-in counter I was overwhelmed by the friendliness and willingness of the staff to assist me in my hour of need. I had torn my Achillies Tendon whilst rock climbing, and was in a surgical boot to help mend the torn tendon and ease the pain somewhat. I must admit that; at first I was a bit dubious about receiving any special consideration; because I did not speak a word of Dutch and was not accustomed to receiving anything but than less than ordinary service from other airlines. Unlike other airlines I've travelled with; who run their business lean and mean; this airline was well prepared for any and all contingencies.
There was no shortage of staff here. Two staff initially attended to me pushing me wherever I needed to go in a well appointed wheelchair.
Best airline in the world I supposed. With many beautiful stewardess serving u. Good service
I  have  flown with  Singapore  Airlines  many  times. In June 2013, I flew to Singapore,   economy  class  and was given a window  seat. The   service was great. I have no complaints at all.
Seats are always blocked during online booking and online check-in.  Upon boarding there are many empty seats.  Feedback to Singapore Airlines do not always address the issue.

Flew Zurich to Singapore A 380 business class service and plane exceptional. Singapore to Perth Business class 777-200 service OK junior crew, plane was old and scratches every where. SIA continue to fly on the 2 day service to Perth the older 777-200. In my opinion not a premium product.

I taken the SQ208 back fr melbourne on 3th June 2017.  The crew was great. I was surprised that the lead crew (a nice malay steward) greated us by our name from the time we step in until the time we were collected our luggage.  He took the extra effort. I and hubby was happy with the service. Thumps up to all the crew on that flight. Hope to meet you all again. Thanks
Delayed,they lost my baggage,no concern about the babies......

I have always rated Sing Air highly, efficient, clean, and excellent service however Cairns to Singapore is a definite exception.  737 max is cramped and barely suitable for a 6-hour + Trip. A full flight with only 2 rear toilets is a huge issue, with continuous lines stretching down the cabin and the passengers at the rear half of the aircraft understandably getting agitated.  By 2 hours out the toilets were disgusting.  The seats were uncomfortable and numbing.  Very  unsatisfactory flight  not reccommended

We travelled a combined economy / premium enconomy as SA do not have a premium flight ex Perth . Our trip was Perth/San Francisco returning New York / Perth . The section of the flight causing complaint was New York /Singapore 9/25/16 . The 380 looked old dirty and tired internally toilets grubby , cabin walls marked and chipped both tvs failed during the longest leg the food wa very average what did we get for the huge price difference nothing  there was nothing that showed the premium difference False Advertising we have flown SA since late 70's the have lost it . Premium must mean what word implies their competitors  leave them for dead   It's a growing level of service but SA are giving no indication that it matters . On the first section Perth Singapore my wife's seat was broken and could only be used upright we thought things can only improve ...so wrong but never again . We would change our return leg Singapore/ Perth in 3 days if it was not for the fuss and expense . But rest assured SA we will be your loudest critics to anyone who listens .One ripoff too many .

This is the only airlines I will fly. Just had the good fortune of traveling by Singapore airlines from San Francisco to Vietnam and India. Impeccable service, most friendly and professional staff. When I exited the plane I had left my pair of reading glasses on the aircraft, a staff came running after me and handed me my glasses.

US based airlines can learn a thing or two about service. I tolerate United airlines and there crappy and sub-standard service simply because I can earn miles in Singapore airlines. This is the platinum standard for airlines and no North American airlines can or will ever come remotely close to Singapore airlines in service, courtesy.

Flew with Singapore Airlines on several flights recently.  Manchester to Singapore on 24th October, Brisbane to Singapore, 23rd November and Singapore to Manchester via Munich on 23rd November.  Everything was as expected.  Staff very efficient and friendly.  Food good and seats comfortable.

I flew Singapore Airlines From Melbourne to Colombo with transit in Singapore a few days ago and the journey was fantastic. Check in at Melbourne was a breeze and they even offered me a window seat on the A380 which was awesome. This was the first time I had flown SQ after nearly 15 years and the standards they maintain have not changed. In flight entertainment is a treat by its self with a dual touch screens and some fantastic choices. I'm not into games or movies so I listened to classic rock and watched a few documentaries. The food too was fantastic. Above all, the air stewardesses (the Singapore Girls) were really sweet and nice which made a world of difference. Its not surprising that SQ is considered the best airline in the world serving out of in my opinion the best airport in the world.

The service was fantastic throughout the flight. I took singapore airlines from Sin to Milan. I was impressed by their non-stop drink service throughout the flight to ensure that we were always hydrated. 
The in-flight entertainment is great and the food is great too!

However, they should improve on their inflight announcements, it was difficult to understand some of the announcements. The command of the language can be improved.

EDITORS COMMENT: They do offer an excellent economy class service.
Awesome.

I've always enjoyed by Singapore Airlines flight but my recent return flight from Cape Town to Bangkok was not up to the standard I was expecting. The aircraft, a Boeing 777, was old with an in-flight entertainment system that had seen better days.
And the food was pretty mediocre. Fortunately, the crew were top-notch. 
Singapore need to understand that there is competition on this route from the Middle Eastern carriers, who often use newer aircraft with fantastic in-flight entertainmnent systems and better food.

System error when booking the flight (4 flights) however when contacted the helpdesk spoken to some unhuman who said sorry still need to charge $250 for any change...rip off airline !!!  So to fix the error for 4 passengers who costs $1,000 USD !!!
Flew their Airbus 330...Why do they keep cabin temperature so COLD? If I would not know better I would think this is for the crew confort to the detriment of the passengers...

very disappointed with the flight back to UK from Singapore on the A380 on 3rd march 2016 I had to change my flight so I asked for extra leg room on the upper deck which I thought I had paid for but the call centre did not book this for me so we were seated in row 82 upper deck next to the smelly / dirty toilets(urine  on the floor) No member of staff cleaned it up or sprayed fresh air I only saw them check it twice. also the staff were not very helpful There seemed to be a lack of staff on the economy side (only saw 3 ) unlike the business side which had far more staff.  When it came to meal times not only was there a poor selection  and the quality was again very poor  meat tough and tasteless also  luke warm coffee was cold and very strong ,all in all I felt the standard had gone down since the last time I flew on this plane. It was in complete contrast to the flight from Perth to Singapore 3 days before when we travelled on the 777, staff helpful , extra leg room was booked when I changed the flight   toilets were checked every half hour and sprayed with fresh air,  good selection of food also very hot and tasty .a much better experience
Most aspects of our trip to and from Europe were disappointing. Your feedback form is very discouraging so I have not bothered. I will not be flying SQ again.
flew to brisbane from manchester rtn all I can say very impressed we were looked after by this airline even before we traveled

Just got back from an amazing holiday in New Zealand, we choose Singapore airlines not knowing what they was like, and wow what a comfortable flight me and the family had, the food and entertainment was excellent, and the stewards/ ess where amazing  10/10

Excellent service excellent staff good food and entertainment.
Best airline flown in for ages.
Well done certainly got a winning formula!!

I had been told that traveling in a Singapore Airlines flight is an experience in itself, but I'm sorry to say that it was not the case for me. I've definitely had better flight experiences. Below are the reasons why I wouldn't recommend Singapore Airlines:
1. As soon as I entered the flight, there was a foul smell of urine, probably emanating from the lavatory at the front of the business class section. I thought the smell would disappear once I was inside, but I was wrong. The air spray came on only after everyone had settled in and the plane was taxiing down the runway. 
2. The food is OK. Regular stuff. Nothing exotic or out-of-the-box. I don't know why a menu is offered when the actual meal given is pretty different from what's offered on the menu. 
3. I was seated in the middle seat on the center aisle. The steward completely skipped asking me what beverage I wanted. I could have asked for it myself, but that's not hospitality.
4. In a 4 & half hour flight, you don't get to sleep even a wink because of the in-flight meal trauma. The stewards take more than hour just to serve and clear the trays. Even if you opt not to eat during your flight, you still anyway get disturbed.

My seat was chosen beforehand and printed on the air ticket, but there was a sudden change without my prior agreement. The passenger next to me was rather rude, so I requested for a change of seat to my original one but this was not met. I had to sit near the emergency exit, which was rather uncomfortable and there was not a proper table. My luggage after transit was late. Overall I had an awful experience and was not satisfied at all. Hope the airline will continue to work and improve on this.

Have flown from Melbourne to London and back, with Singapore about 10 times in the last 4 years. Always very well looked after. No complaints at all. Their timetable is also very good as you can avoid jetlag with their body friendly timetable.
Singapore to Kuala Lumpur on Business. Despite short haul, the service was great. Crew were friendly. Seat was comfortable. Overall a great flight.

My wife and we're excited first about traveling to Singapore and secondly going on Singapore Airlines.  Our travels started in Louisville, Ky flying to JFK on Delta and then transferring to Singapore to Frankfurt and onto Singapore. We traveled in Business Class and were assured that our four pieces of luggage would be transferred at JFK from Delta to Singapore and in fact the luggage tags were  checked through to Singapore .  After arriving to JFK I talked to three individuals including the gate agent assuring us that our luggage was ON the plane when in fact it was NOT.  When we got to Singapore 21 hours later we were informed that our luggage is still sitting at JFK.  We are to get aboard our ship tomorrow with no luggage. They said they would let me know later today if it will be on the plane tonight.  This could have been avoided if they would have followed through with what they assured us.  Extremely disappointing.

The flight was excellent. The food superb and flight staff excellent. Sad they really don't handle the front end very well. Actually JFK Singapore does not have very much awareness there. Hard  to find gates and lounge.
Overall not happy as we have no luggage.

Beware the stopover in Singapore with this airline. Our family flew to Laos with Singapore airlines and my husband returned home directly for work. Our 3 teenagers and myself stayed in Singapore for 4 nights on the way back. 
We were charged $437.50 PER PERSON i.e. $1750 for this. On repeated enquiry to the airline the only explanation that was given was that the flights were a different code. Departure tax was mentioned, with more asking as to why this charge, but this amounts to about $30 per person. I would expect a national airline to be encouraging passengers to stop and spend money in their country not penalise them to do so
We won't be flying this airline again

Flew on Christmas Eve 2014 from Durban--Johannesburg--Singapore--Malaysia, excellent service from the flight crew. Best airline food I've had. Overall excellent experience. I was also able to check-in my luggage straight from my initial destination to my final which was appreciated.

Impressive airline. 
Excellent customer service. Tasty food. Comfortable planes. 

Check in and luggage delivery went smoothly.

The airplane food & the size of the TVs on the plane were slightly above average. However, due to the service I received on SQ173 on 06/11/15 seats 40A-E, this will be the first & last time I ride with Singapore Airlines. We had a delay of 1.5 hrs which was only bothersome to me because there was a stewardess  who was rude to my husband when asking her to fix a broken entertainment system. We pressed the service button to inform her of the issue after my husband tried many button-clicks to get the remote & entertainment system to respond. She comes over annoyed & starts condescendingly pressing all the buttons. She then commands, "I'm going to reset. Don't touch for 10 minutes." She could've spoken to my husband more politely. She also skipped my daughter when asking for drinks who was sitting next to me & moved to the row in front of us. When I asked her why my daughter was skipped, instead of apologizing, she was defensive. I really think Singapore Airlines should train their stewards to have better service because that's what sets airlines apart. Consumers have way too many options to settle on an airline that doesn't care about their customers.

Booked a Singapore to Paris (return) flight on their Premium Economy flight launched early in the 2015 back 3 months ago. Now with only a month to go to my departure date and with all my train bookings, car rentals and hotels confirmed and fully paid, YESTERDAY on 3 September,  Singapore airlines simply announces on their website that their refurbishment of the A380 for the Premium Economy is delayed by 3-4 months (CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT) .. and our booked and paid up flight cannot be fulfilled and offered my Economy flight instead in exchange for PITTANCE.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME??  If the delay of refurbishment affects flights from September till December for the Paris leg, it meant that Singapore Airlines would have already known back in June when we bought the tickets correct? So why did they not come clean then? OR you trying to save face then because you had so  much marketing campaign? OR you are so  messed up internally that your Operations and Marketing teams don't talk?
Everyone, the once world class Singapore Airlines is no more. They negate on their commitments. Worst than budget airlines now.
BNE-SIN-DXB-SIN-BNE

Perth to Singapore in business class was very good, the staff and food were first class. The Perth lounge could do with updating.
Singapore to London in business class, we were booked on a A380 but this was changed to a 777 ER. our flight was a night time so we were looking forward to a nights sleep. The lie flat beds were very uncomfortable, having to lie across the bed at a angle. the cabin service was good.
Return flight London to Singapore on the A380, same bed set up, very disappointed, this bed is way behind other carriers we have flown with.
Will not fly with them again until the bed/seat if updated.

I have just completed a long haul journey in Business Class flying Four of my longest flights with Singapore Air.

The ground staff at Perth Airport provided a lovely start to  our holiday with a smooth and helpful checkin. The flight attendants on our Perth to Singapore, Singapore to Copenhagen and our return flights were all very polite, professional and helpful.  The seats were very comfortable.  One segment was on a brand new plane which was outstanding.  We were delayed leaving Copenhagen by the Danish airport and as I had booked a short gap in between flights we were  late for our connection to Perth.  We were met off the flight by a Singapore  Airline staff member and she explained we had missed our flight, she had rebooked us on a flight later that day, we were provided with accommodation in the Crowne Plaza at the airport for the day with breakfast and  lunch provided.   Absolutely fantastic service and staff are always so nice to customers.  Really left us feeling very well looked after.
The best airline ever i flew with. Excellent staff. Their service is the best. Enough space to sit. Food is very good. I definitely will fly with them again.

Steady downward define of service level.  Flew Haneda-Changi 0800 flight that lands at Changi  about 4PM.  In the whole flight, served only a light breakfast (Croissant+Eggs+Beverage).  To catch an 0800 flight you need to be awake at 5:30AM and rushing to catch the flight, easily miss breakfast.  7 hour flight with 2 hour boarding and only 1 meal is ludicrous, especially whats the trip spans breakfast and well past lunch.  WHAT is Management thinking ?  This is not the standard of a "World leading" Carrier.

I'm astounded that SQ has fallen so far from its previous standard.  Stewardesses also have lost their classy and pleasing ways.  Training is lacking as they don't seem to understand basic hospitality principles.  Chief Steward was OK but it was clear he's old school.
Management decisions to cut corners is cheapening this airlines.   SQ is more interested at maximising profits than preserving their brand.  In all honesty, it can no longer claim to be one of the best airlines -- and management should take care that they don't drop to the "bad" category.  They are seriously out of Emirates / Qatar Airlines class .
