Flew Perth - Heathrow and return with Singapore airlines in July/August 2014.

Perth - Singapore leg A330
Singapore - Heathrow leg B777-300
Heathrow - Singapore leg A380 - 8000
Singapore - Perth leg B777 - 200

A good variety of aircraft types here and all provided a good service and standard of comfort that you would expect in Economy class.

Entertainment systems provided a good variety and the meals were quite acceptable, although on the Singapore - Heathrow leg all meals on offer were quite spicy and although I enjoyed them they were not to my wife's taste.

The seats selected on the return journey were the upper deck of the A380.  This is for couples a better choice than the main cabin as layout is 2-4-2, and the window seat has a very useful compartment at the fuselage side.

All in all Singapore airlines tried to make a 13 hour non stop flight as comfortable as possible and the shorter Perth - Singapore trips were just fine.

Boarding was handled smoothly with ground staff enforcing the load from the rear policy - well done, but why don't airlines enforce the cabin baggage restrictions as overhead lockers were all full and too many passengers had oversize or multiple articles of cabin luggage.
As a regular flyer with Singapore over the last several years, it has been disappointing to see their standards drop when dealing with Gold FF flying economy.

Excellent service again, has always been good but I haven't travelled for over 18 months,  but the service and everything is still there,, always travel with them without complaint and most likely will always travel with them,,, top airline in all aspects ,,,

After I saw so many reviews I can't not put my review in. I'm very disappointed with Singapore airlines. I thought they were the best. 3 years ago when me and my husband flew from Singapore to LOs Angeles. The seat that  we were in was warm seems the air con is not working imagine how many hours we have to suffered, also service was terrible. After that we flew again a year after to give it ago and the service from the flight attendant were terrible. I was not saying that I was unreasonable. I am in the service industry too and I understand how important is my own brand and customer service. Yes customers are not always right. But really Singapore airlines your service and your flight attendant is going down hill. Maybe you will not do anything about it. I am thinking twice now to fly with your airlines especially with young family. I will not get any great service.

I recently flew Singapore Airlines from Perth to Colombo, Sri Lanka return. I am a frequent flyer with Qantas however connections into South Asia just aren't as good as other carriers. As far as the flight experience with Singapore, they are undoubtedly one of the best for service, and are known for it. From check-in through to cabin staff, service was impeccable and the plane was an A330, fully finished and appeared quite new. Being a frequent flyer with Qantas left me without some of the comforts that I am used to. Loss of lounge access is one, particularly between flights and my normal forward aisle seat was of course moved right down the back in a middle seat. The flight wasn't overly crowded so that was a positive.

The flight timings coming back were not that great  leaving Colombo, from memory 1.20am isn't ideal but most planes on this route seem to overnight, so probably can't be helped. Connections were tight so that was a positive.

Now that Malaysian has joined Oneworld I will try them out next to this part of the world

This review is for 2 different business class flights on 2 different trips. LA to Narita and Narita to Singapore. There's a reason they're the best and their business class didn't disappoint. The only negative was my wife's seat had tomato sauce on the console from a previous passenger that she cleaned off herself. The plane comfort, food, staff, online check in, customer service leading up to flight and lounge were all top notch. We highly recommend them and hope to fly with them again. My previous international business class experience is with Delta and Turkish Airlines.

We took SQ856 to Hong Kong on 13.04.2017 and return via SQ 871 on 16.04.2017.

On board of SQ 856, the cutleries dropped on my husband while the flight attendant was collecting the tray from the passenger behind his seat.

The breakfast served was not fantastic.

While returning on SQ 871, the roll bun was not served with the dinner and the dinner served was not as good as before.  The trays were not collected timely.

On both flights, the flight attendances were not very professional.  They took orders but did not return.

Some of the passengers were seen struggling to put their handheld luggages at the top hang cabin.  

The inflight programmes were limited.

Travelled on the A330 from Vietnam to Perth Australia. The only words i would suggest that fit the Service, comfort and Air Crew attention is fantastic. Both planes were a little aged but the smiling and happy crews made you feel a million dollars. The quality of food, wine and attention to detail was excellent.
Would suggest some Australian Airlines should have a good look at themselves.
I have been a very loyal patron to the major airlines in Australia, however feel Singapore has beaten them hands down. Congratulations and thank you.

Flew London to Singapore, then Singapore to Brisbane had had a lovely experience. Never flown Singapore airlines before but the service was amazing, the ladies were lovely and the food was the same. Was a nice change over Air New Zealand.

EDITORS COMMENT: They are one of the best for sure!

Interior design of the aircraft we flew in were not appealing, particularly the A380 which looked old. I flew in an A380 six months ago with Etihad and the aircraft looked fresh and vibrant, which in turn created a much needed amount of positive energy for a long-haul flight.

The entertainment system (Krisworld) was patchy at best as there would be a 1-2 second lag every 5minutes making the viewing experience quite frustrating. Every so often, the movie/show you were watching would just switch off and return to the main menu so you had replay the movie and fast forward to where you were up to.

I think the airline put more effort into designing the onboard food menu than actually producing quality meals. The curries all tasted the same and was borderline sickening.

Staff were friendly enough but some don't enforce the 'seat upright when eating' rule and we had to take matters into our own hands.

Disappointed overall for an airline with Singapore Airlines reputation.

I previously had positive things to say about Singapore Airlines, but in this case, I was very frustrated.

I paid extra for an upgraded seat with extra legroom.

Instead, the seat was in front of the exit door and had less legroom. 

In addition, the TV stand was broken and so for the entire 16 hour flight, I could not watch any TV. 

Two thumbs down.
I flew Houston to Moscow to Singapore and the back, Singapore to Moscow to Houston. Unsure of aircraft type. Flight crew was extraordinary. Food was good. Fights were all on time.

Slip in quality. Having flown with SQ many times, this trip from Perth to Rome return, was not up to their usual high standard.
Although seating in Economy was adequate, the quality of food was just terrible. And all of the choices of Entertainment, we only watched one movie each.
Cabin staff were excellent which saved the day.

I have travelled Singapore airlines three times now in Economy over the past several months. I have found that it is pot luck whether the customer service is friendly and efficient or rude and officious. It's the only airline I have experienced (and I have experienced a lot of them) where I get the feeling that the cabin staff are looking down their nose at the economy class passengers. I have decided not to fly with them again for this reason.

Best time ever best service always will love this airline. Me and my boyfriend loved it 

Thank you

Flew from LAX to Tokyo Narita both ways. Service was very good and accommodating. The team was very gracious when they made mistakes. I flew next to an Indian man on the way to Tokyo who was vegetarian and had pre-ordered a vegetarian meal when he ordered his ticket. They ran out of vegetarian options, so he did not get a meal. The attendant scrambled to find non-meat sides to at least get him some food, and then made sure he was comped vegetarian meals on all his connecting flights to India for that trip. I was impressed as you would never see that happen with an American company.

The negative: I did notice that a few controllers for the seat back entertainment were not working, including my partner's who was seated next to me. Also, on the flight back I got food poisoning from their "beef" option almost immediately. Within an hour of eating it I was spraying from both ends. By the time I reached LAX I had nothing in my stomach left to puke. But it didn't stop there...I ended up throwing up in front of the LAX international building and didn't get to make our side trip into LA as planned because I could barely move. 

In summary do not take your chances with the beef option.

My wife & I were to fly to Osaka to join a cruise in 2011 but the earthquake & tsunami forced a change of plan so that the cruise started in Hong Kong. The airline demanded a fee of over $100 each to change the booking (reimbursed by the cruise line), but refused a refund for the much lesser value of the airfare, about $300 total. The excuse given was that refunds only applied for flights both into & out of Japan. For this reason, we shall not fly with this company again.

We have flown Singapore Airlines when traveling internationally for over 20 years.  There has been a considerable drop off in the level of service in recent years  

The most recent trip to Europe was a huge deterioration in service 3 of 4 sectors were particularly poor.  The flight  from Perth to Singapore had a crew that had obviously taken their grumpy pills before boarding, the attendants being noticeably curt, then again I have noticed this on crews that service the Perth route.  

The sector from Singapore to Frankfurt was as I remember Singapore Airlines friendly service with a smile, couldn't ask for more.

On the return sector from Amsterdam to Singapore  the service could only be described as horrific , e.g. a request for water had to be made several times and took 45 minutes, in mid flight fruit was offered however when it came to our row the fruit was all gone and we were offered a bag of chips instead! the crew appeared to be in a state of confusion most of the time and not interested in the passengers. The food was particularly poor on this sector, in 13 hours we got a light lunch after take off and breakfast just before landing(and they couldn't get that right).  10 hours between meals is a long time! Oh I forgot we were offered a bag of potato chips mid flight.

The Singapore to Perth sector was all business like and curt as like the outgoing sector.  On the upside the check in was still efficient at all sectors the flight crew did their job and got us to our destinations without any problems.  The 777s used on all sectors were looking tired and in need of a refit on one sector the sound unit didn't function  and on others there were intermittent faults
It was very nice, the seat was nice, the service was very good, and the food was heavenly.

Recently flew Singapore Airlines Perth/Rome & Amsterdam/Perth in Economy.
I had not fully recovered from a hip replacement operation and Airline staff were brilliant in organising transfers at each airport; The care and assistance was exemplary. Cabin staff  exceeded my expectations with their assistance during flights. First Class airline with brilliant staff and service.

I quite often fly Singapore Airlines from Perth, Singapore and Vietnam for business.  This airline is fairly consistent in that the whole flying experience is usually efficient, friendly and comfortable.  However, one consistency I don't enjoy is that on the Perth- Singapore leg the aircraft is never as clean, the (hot) food is quite often cold or not fresh and the entertainment system does not work properly.  Things are always much better on the Singapore -Vietnam leg which more often than not has a plane full of (non-Australian) business people.  Do Australian passengers not warrant the same service as people from other countries

Flew Perth to Istanbul return. Exceptional device by cabin crews on all flights. Nice aircraft on both Perth - Singapore legs. Airline flys their retrofitted 777-200ER between Singapore and Turkey which are at least 17 years old. Their was a stark difference between quality of refit in both aircraft - one was quite nice whilst the other was tired and a bit grotty. Can not fault staff etc

I traveled from SFO to HYD. The first segment was good. But then being a Star Alliance gold, I was not given lounge access because, my next flight was in Silk Air although my ticket was through Singapore Air. Silk Air is like Tiger air, only difference being food served in Silk Air. Leg room is small, no movies on board, no star alliance preference, no mileage accrual. With an 8 hr wait in Singapore, I am really disappointed at the treatment of Star Alliance gold passengers by Singapore Air.

1)
May 31, 2014
Frankfurt to Singapore
Airbus A 380
Business Class

2)
June 11, 2014
Singapore to Frankfurt
Airbus A 380
Business Class
Booking Flight always fail

We just came back from Singapore to Perth today and had the best flight ever with Singapore Airline SQ223 ( 30 OCT 2016 ) Derek gave us so much a ttention and the rest of the crew had such nice smile as they work all thru the 5hrs flight. Thank you so much Derek, hope the next plane I take, will be you in it.
Perth/Singapore/Perth on boeing 777 as usual always a great flight with Singapore Airlines, food, service, entertainment and efficiency.

I took SQ16 on June 17th and SQ1 on June 25th.  The plane was 777-300ER refitted which was my all time favourite seat. Its so comfortable and provides loads of privacy. Crew on both sectors were pleasant and professional.  

As I had some issues on my connection to SQ1 the ground manager at SFO and HKIA were super nice and look after me since I was somewhat distraught. They both showed professionalism and empathy.  I was looked after very well. 

As these are long haul flights you can be assured that a cabin crew is always around unlike other airline where you need to find the crew just to get some water.

As the 2nd 5 star airline in the world their service level is great

My trip with Singapore Airlines was Brisbane to Istanbul returning via Paris to Brisbane. I need to begin by stating that three of the four legs of this trip were fine, in comfortable aircraft with OK staff. However, the flight from Singapore to Istanbul was in an old plane (777-200) with most uncomfortable seats I have experienced. When I first sat down I thought I must have sat on something, but no, it was the thin and lumpy seat. The only way I could get comfortable was to request another pillow and blanket just to sit on. Other passengers were doing the same. My son and his partner also complained about their flight from Copenhagen to Brisbane recently with Singapore Airlines and they had the same experience, also on a 777-200. Also, in-flight entertainment screen was small, and mine stopped working halfway through the flight, so I read a book.

We missed our connecting flight from Singapore to Frankfurt because our flight from Koh Samui was late. First, we were only offered a flight with another stop in Zurich which we found not acceptable. After two hours waiting in the airport of Koh Samui, they organized a direct flight. All 5 family members got disconnected seats. Finally, we arrived in Frankfurt with 10 hours delay. This was not nice, but may happen. 
Even worse is that the air condition in the plain from Singapore to Frankfurt was malfunctioning. While the temperature was OK in the front of the aircraft, it was unacceptable cold and draughty in the back. For this reason, my wife stood most of the time in the aisle until after 10 hours a flight assistant could organize another seat for her. 
We complained to the airline after the flight, but were disappointed by their reply.
Food quality was also pretty bad.

7 hour delay in flight after many passengers were sent back and forth to two different location x 3 times with incorrect information, I join extremely long queue to get free hotel in city tickets for the night and a meal voucher. 
After 30 minutes queuing in pain (x2 fractures in back) I left queue to see if I could find someone where in hotel to sleep but was unsuccessful.   I returned to information desk, no hotel tickets or meal voucher left and no-one to could help.

SIN/SGN/SIN, SIN/BKK/SIN, SIN/RGN/SIN, SIN/YVR/SIN, SIN/SFO/SIN, SIN/JFK/SIN, SIN/MLE/SIN, SIN/ICN/SIN, SIN/PVG/SIN, SIN/CGK/SIN, SIN/PER/SIN, SIN/SYD/SIN ETC...
SQ it is! 
Nothing but safety first is how I choose my carrier all over the world.  When I am on SQ, I know I am safe. 
Thank you very much SQ, for the past many years in staying excellence in service & product and putting safety first at all time. 
Cheers!

Many years ago I flew exclusively with SIA.  This time my decision was exclusively based on price difference between them and Qantas.  My memories of this airline were excellent, and overall I was pleased this time.  On the flight to Singapore, the movies selection disappointed me.   I watched a couple and was pleased I had not paid money to see them.  On the return journey, none had been added, so I did not bother.
Someone wrote about seats not being that comfortable.  I mentioned to a steward that Qantas had a covering which was placed over the seat to make it more comfortable. A blanket put on the seat resulted and improved this problem markedly.
Food was excellent as was the service.
I should mention for the benefit of passengers from Brisbane, that the food and service in the SIA lounge at Brisbane International airport was exceptional.
Only issue is seating assignment not available early

Recently flew between Adelaide and Singapore on the medium haul 350/900. I have never felt so cramped on a medium haul flight. Once the seat in front is reclined you can hardly move. Anyone who is on the larger side will not be able to put their tray table fully down. The seats do not seem to have much padding. We did not get a meal or even a light snack on the night flight until breakfast. Queuing for the toilets is difficult due to the lack of space . 
Some people would suggest if one isnâ€™t happy then upgrade but not everyone can afford business class or even premium class. 
We have always used Singapore Airlines but if we do not have to go through Singapore in future I doubt now that we will. 
On a brighter note their long haul flights were very good but we have to take the medium haul leg as well when travelling to Europe.

Hi,
I just took SQ223 from Singapore to Perth today at 9:30am. 
As a frequent flyer of my own national airline, I must say I am very disappointed with the in flight experience that I received today. The standard welcome drink and peanuts were not served and the food portion was reduced and not up to standard. I wasn't even served tea or coffee after the meal. The flight attendants were moving up and down ,oblivious to serving the passengers. I have taken many SQ flights before to Perth and I have never felt so shortchanged like this morning! It seems like they are cutting corners and it can seen just from the food tray. Serving cheap Magnum ice cream instead of Haagen Dazs which we used to get. We paid the standard airfare for our economy flight and didn't expect this sort of service. I wonder why standards have slipped. 
I really hope SIA will look into this deterioration of service seriously. I am a Singaporean and I feel very ashamed that they could not maintain what made them a good airline in the first place.

May SIA seriously reflect on their service standards and not take their customers trust for granted. Cutting corners is a very dishonest way of doing business.

I always fly Singapore Airlines from Manila to Australia, i tried other airlines such as Qantas, MAS, Cathay all in Business Class but none well maybe Cathy can close to second from SQ. From the check-in counter till you leave, they will take care of you. I have yet to try the long haul first class and that needs to be experienced only with Singapore. Though some of their airlines lack the flat beds going to Perth but still a good value for money or even use of miles.

I traveled from SFO to BOM (via Incheon and Singapore) and back and I was extremely pleased with the service. Last time I had traveled by Emirates and it was horrible. The on-board crew were extremely courteous. Even when one of the flights was delayed due to the weather at Mumbai, information about connecting flights etc was readily available. Food, beverages and on-board entertainment was excellent. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Amsterdam to Singapore 777-300ER
Singapore-Sydney 777-300ER

Sydney-Singapore Airbus A380
Singapore-Amsterdam 777-300ER

Alle the flights left in time,very friendly staff and good service.
Clean toilets.
A bit of a dissapointment were the desserts,I ve ordered a vegetarian meal but that included only fruit for dessert.
Would have been nice if it would have been an icecream or something like that.
Because my passport was valid for an other 5Ã‚Â½ month after departure in Amsterdam I wasn't able to check in on line nor make my own choice for a seat.
Had to check in at the airport.

Singapore airlines never fail to impress me with their quality of staff, service, food, beverages, snacks bars, in flight entertainment and arguably the best economy blankets in the sky. A recent flight to Europe was no different  except for the aircraft and their seating. Our trip involved travel on an A330, A380 and 777-200. The A330 was great - couldn't fault a thing; the A380 had less seat recline than the A330 and the seat was harder which I found uncomfortable on such a long flight; then there was the tired old 777-200... the seat whilst having the best recline of all of them had lost its ability to "cushion" so to speak and all the bits and pieces that are supposed to inflate to create extra support simply didn't. The in fight entertainment was also quite outdated when compared to other SIngapore Airlines aircraft. I still hold this airline up there as one of the best in the world but the in flight product continuity they used to pride themselves on is starting to wane

Not worth the trouble in economy. They split my friend and I on a 17 hr flight, in spite of the fact tickets were bought five months ahead. The seat selection on the website did not work on multiple attempts. Not one of three different gate agents even tried to help us. Extremely poor customer service. Singapore did not live up to their reputation. The rest of economy was no different from any other airline. Save youraelf a headache: fly Qatar or Emirates.

Singapore Airlines is rated as the best airline in the world, but their customer service has to be the worst I have dealt with. 

Singapore Air neglected to confirm my connecting flight with their partner airline, causing me to miss my flight to Singapore. When confronted with this, they offered to rebook my flight for later that night for a $400 fee and a downgrade in cabin class. Not only did they force me to pay a premium, they did not refund me the cost of the cabin upgrade that I paid for. 

I could never speak to a manager - none of my emails have been returned. They were able just to do whatever they wanted to me, and I had no power at all. Now I am going to miss my first day of my new job, I am out $400, 70000 points, and all of my stuff is in Singapore without me, and there is no option to do anything about it.

I recently convinced colleagues to travel to Manila for work using a combination of airlines including Singapore airlines as I had travelled happily with them some years ago.  These recent flights, however, were extremely disappointing.   The air conditioning wasn't working properly, the seats were extremely old fashioned, there was a poor selection of movies and the food was pretty awful e.g. bread rolls were hard as a rock.  I hoped it was only the Singapore to Manila route, but on the return flight from Singapore to Auckland it was equally poor, despite the plane being a newer 777.  I would really hesitate to book another flight with Singapore airlines.  Suggest you check carefully if it's likely to be a flight with an upgraded interior.

Have flown to UK every year for about 15 years and always had the best of attention from the staff.  The connection times from Perth to Heathrow are very convenient with a stop-over in KL of two and a half hours.
Breakfast served on KL to Perth leg has always been disappointing and needs improvement. The aircraft travelled on are A330, B777, B747 on the Perth - KL - Heathrow journey and I look forward to the A380 on the next trip in November. next

We as a family travelled from Brisbane to Singapore on SQ256 on 14th December 16. We were provided exceptional service by Vick and his team members. They were polite and above and beyond to make our trip very enjoyable and comfortable. Thank you. Vick and the team and Singapore airlines our favourite airline. Thanks again. Rodney John

Crew was really nice!!! If you need help they come fast to you! Seat was sooo nice but only you don't have a good engine view in the business class. What I hate on the flight was the airco I was really sick.

Hi Team, Thanks for giving me an opportunity to review my flight experience. I am a fairly new traveller with Singapore Airlines with 7 trips in 2014 usually from Singapore to & fro my homeland India or my reporting office in Germany. Am already on their top miles list. Today returned from my short Easter vacation with a round trip Pune-Mumbai-Singapore in Business class on 421 & 422. They got Spacious seats with extendable leg space for sleeping. Excellent Service- I was wearing a skirt & without me asking, they offered me comfy blankets & head rest within minutes on the flight journey so I wouldnt feel cold. Am also impressed that they serve the best inflight fresh food. You must not miss their 'Book the Cook'option and their speciality is the delicious Lobster Thermidor, which the stewardess recommended to me. You will return to thank me here for recommending this super menu dish for your next Singapore Airlines flight. They provide supersonic headphones, no shortage of wines & proactively assist with channel changing or games. The best of all- all of the staff pronounced my difficult name correctly and the stewardess offered to fill in my Landing visa form & to my surprise, my luggage was already towed in advance to my waiting car so I wont have to wait at the terminal after my flight.  Hats off to Singapore Airlines! You truly are the best, amongst the rest. thanks again for such an Over-the-Air experience :) - Aphrosh

SFO-SIN-SFO Nov/Dec 2016  Economy class with small fee upgrade for window seat behind exit row with no seat in front of me.  A new and quiet A350 for the 15-16 hour non-stop flight.  Cabin service and in-flight entertainment were superb.  This airline knows how to make a long flight bearable.  Galley was always open to pax to get a glass of juice or water and a snack.  Sandwiches too, just ask.  Meal began with menu in economy class, then a hot cloth towel service, and then a generous meal.  Repeat again with different meal selection after 8 hours.  Cabin crew inspected restrooms hourly to replenish supplies and tidy up if needed.  SFO counter service was over the top efficient and friendly.  I felt like I was a First Class frequent flyer when I left the service counter.  A wonderful airline experience for someone accustomed to US flag carriers (mal)treatment.
Terrible service from SIA which is reputated to provide excellent customer service. They have no integrity unlike what they preach.

This airline needs to lift its game. I flew Cairns to Singapore on a fully booked flight at FULL PRICEThe seats are narrow and uncomfortable. There was NO INFLIGHT ENTERTAINMENT. For six hour flight. The toilets were crowded with long waits. This is Budget standard. Not good enough.

I tarvelled to Kochi with my family from Brisbane on 13th December 2016 and returned to Brisbane from Kochi (India) on 20th January. We travelled Kochi every alternative year from Melbourne to Kochi since 2009 by Singapore Airlines. This tme we travelled from Brisbane. I tried Air Asia in between but went back to Singapore Airlines due to higher quality. But my latest experience with SIA has left me feeling dissapointed. On every other trip, the food we got was above average, especially for economy class,. But this time, the food was absolutely horrible. I got a pork sausage with egg and vegetables. The sausage was dry, the egg was far too cooked and the vegetables were almost raw. The second meal wasn't much better. I also noticed a dip in service quality. I had been warned by my friend that Singapore Airlines were losing their standards. He had a horrible experience but I opted to remain due to my trust in the airline. I now deeply regret this descision.
Living on their reputation - old 777's showing their age, indifferent food and poor inflight entertainment only counterbalanced by attentive crew.

The extra legroom is good until the seat in front is reclined. The leg rest does not come up high enough and the footrest is the same as economy class. The footrest seems to be out of alignment with the passengers legs, resulting in the feet falling off to the side of the footrest. The headrest does not raise very high, causing the head  to be pushed uncomfortably forward. The headphones have a sharp ridge in the centre, hurting the ears. The wine and food are both good as is the priority boarding and baggage retrieval.  While it is better than economy, I feel it is not worth the extra cost. The main reason for this is that the comfort level is not greatly enhanced over economy.
i have travelled several with singapore airlines and as far as I am concerned they are the best inn the world. Friendly courteous staff,

Food was terrible. Egg noodles was dry and taste like crap. Nasi goreng was tasteless as well. 
Airline staff was fantastic
Amazing, all round.

We travelled on Singapore Airlines business class from Melbourne to Hong Kong in May on the midnight flight. The service from take off to landing was first class. Tattinger champagne before and after take off and then a ''book the cook meal'', a couple of glasses of chardonnay and then a slumber before landing at Changi. 

I didn't avail myself of the bed as it is basically impossible for me to sleep - I just snooze.

We then had a connecting daylight flight to Hong Kong once again in business class. Like the flight before it, it was faultless with superb service. 

A few weeks later we flew from Bangkok to Singapore and then Singapore to Melbourne a few days later. Once again all the flights were memorable for their professional service. The only down side for us was the flight to Melbourne which left Changi at 10.45 am. As soon as the seat belt signs were off the four other people in the forward business cabin all pulled their beds out and shut down their windows resulting in the small cabin being plunged into darkness.

The planning that went into a daylight back home was completely lost so we may as well have taken an overnight flight instead.

I recently traveled between Melbourne, Australia, and Singapore with Singapore airlines with my wife and 7 month old daughter in an Airbus A380.  Everything went perfectly.

I was quite anxious to be flying with a 7 month old baby but we were given bassinet seats all the way and the baby slept very well.  The kindness and consideration shown to us by the stewardess's made an enormous difference and I am so grateful to them for making it such a good trip.     

The A380 is a beautiful plane to fly in.  The take off feels more like a gentle lift than other aircraft that I have experienced and the turbulence is not so noticeable.

I purchased 2 economy class tickets from Singapore to Paris in February for a flight in July. I wanted to upgrade to business class with my miles. Upgrading one leg only comes at the full fare of 374,000 miles (!) for the 2 passengers and the two cheaper fares are unavailable 6 months in advance. The call center said all was booked and the waiting list for cheaper fares is already closed. I have come across this problem numerous times. I fly 250,000 miles a year with SIA. In 4 cases out of 5, the upgrade is impossible, even being a Gold Member for many years and being 5 times over the Gold membership threshold. Krysflyer loyalty program is deceiving and does not give any kind of consideration to very frequent flyers. I have given feedback on their Facebook page and their website and they don't even bother to give me any answer. I also had in the past 2 months 2 seat selections moved unilaterally and without warning by SIA from aisle to middle and discovered it when boarding the plane. All these issues show in my opinion a lack of respect to the client and a serious degradation of SIA's service quality

We flew back from London to Singapore in premium economy.  We had previously flown on our outward leg 5 months before, from Singapore to Rome in premium economy as well.  I hate the seats in premium economy.  They are boring and uncomfortable.  The foot rest is a terrible design and not really thought out properly.  I could not get any sleep on the outward journey 5 months ago and was hoping it to be better on the return.  Not the case unfortunately.  The seat is still horrible.  The food is nothing special either but as always the crew are brilliant. On our second leg , Singapore to Sydney in economy the seat was a much more comfortable design. It was still just a sardine can, but much more comfortable than the premium economy seat. I do like Singapore Airlines but will not be flying with them again in premium economy.

Because of dietary issues I contacted Singapore Airlines months in advance of my flight to request to be assigned a Child's Meal as I had found from previous trips that the simplicity of the Child's Meal was most suitable to my needs. My request was denied by Singapore Airlines because I was an adult. No other reason. I escalated my request but each and every time my request was denied. Of both the Low Sodium and Low Fat options I ended up selecting, each and every meal was fish which by my return flights was frustrating due to the repetitiveness and that I'm not a big fish fan. Not a big deal most people would say however during my flights back to Australia I became ill because I could barely eat any of the food. One flight didn't even have any fresh fruit available. Singapore Airlines have subsequently advised that in future I can have the Child's Meal but I won't be taking that chance after being repeatedly denied on both my outgoing and incoming flights to Australia. The lack of flexibility with the meals and the lack of imagination in the meals has turned me off.

Business MEL to PVG; check-in and lounge were great as always, though the aircraft(s) getting a bit old compared to other airlines. Food was ok for business, not exceptional though. Flight to SIN was delayed and no support to reach connecting flight at Changi Airport was offered. Had to take shuttle bus and run to just sneak onto flight to PVG - older type A330 again. Luggage didn't make it to Shanghai: lost and found - handled by some Chinese CSA guys was rude very unfriendly - got 700 RMB in cash, that's it. Was on a business trip without suit and personal stuff and no one from Singapore Airline to talk to. With the connection in Singapore and arrival experience in Shanghai I am disappointed, considering this was a Business Class flight (9k AUD return). Not a bad airline but it feels they had better days.
SFO to HKG TO SIN flight was well staffed and service was very good.

Staff appeared to be in a rush but took nearly three hours to get a meal on a flight from Singapore to Brisbane. They ran out of chicken, which was obviously popular, half way through serving economy, so didn't have dinner. Breakfast was not much better. Haven't flown with Singapore Airlines for many years and wont fly with them again. Malaysian Airlines and Qantas are far better.

Hot towels pre-departure and before landing.  Brilliant.  
Menus - excellent
Socks and toothbrush on long night flight and quality blanket.  Very good
Amenities supplied in loos and constant cleaning.  Very, very good.
Staff   kind, caring and very pleasant - both sectors.  And immaculately presented. 
Movies, delightfully surprised at quality.
Two criticisms, poor quality earplugs, entertainment.  Hot dish ex Melbourne, surprisingly poor and average ex Singapore.
I will not be flying Malaysian again.  Please keep up the good work.

Honestly Singapore most over rated airline I've ever. Seats don't lie straight in business class, no PJs (unlike United), don't let you into their top tier lounge despite 16 hours for US$9K ONE WAY, and pilot booted a fellow pax for saying she would rather fly United.  So bad.
Excellent service on board by all staff who addressed me by name

I am a star alliance gold member for the last 4 years and regular traveler on this sector ( 15-20 time last 12 months). Recently from the 1 Nov Singapore airlines has decided to replace the regular A330 service with a older much worse 777-200ER service. Singapore to Brisbane a a popular route I am surprised they would use such old dated cabin in this aircraft 

my main concern is the poor qaulity entertainment screen, also the poor meal service now converted to a brunch and every poor standard, better meal served on budget airlines. also there was no pre-drinks service before the meals.

I hope they review this and revert back to regular A330 service.

Travelled with Singapore Airlines both 2014 and 2015. Perth Singapore Zurich - London Singapore Perth. Or experience was generally good.  One issue that surprised was a completely broken seat that we were allocated on the Singapore Perth leg on a 777.  Busted on terms of recline ands operation . Reported this to the General Manager Australia. Response back was ambivalent

I flew on SQ 468 from Sin to Cmb on 13 Feb 2016 returning from New Zealand. One of the female cabin crew (in blue dress), a young girl in my section was requested by me for a copy of the Readers Digest magazine on boarding. She stated that she would get me the copy later. When drinks were being served, I asked for a specific drink from the same stewardess who promised to fetch same later. When meals were being cleared I reminded her about the drink for which again she said would fetch later. This was overheard by the senior flight stewardess (in red dress) who intervened, apologized for the delay and immediately got me the drink requested. Later on I reminded the young stewardess about the Readers Digest magazine for which she surprised me by LYING that the periodical was not available on board. When the senior stewardess passed me the next time I requested the magazine from her which she promptly delivered. I would have reported this matter to the senior staff if not for the short duration of the flight. 
This young stewardess is not suited to serve in such an international award winning airline. Surprised that SQ has recruited such a person/ not given her proper training.
Love the new business class. we flew on PER LHR and return ZRH PER and it was by far the best airline experience 5 stars all around

Flew  Singapore Airlines A350 premium economy.  Melbourne to Singapore 
Our seats were in the front row of premium economy. 
There were no amenities kits but we were provided with headphones plus a blanket and a pillow which were removed by cabin staff  prior to take off and not returned.
The seats in our row looked like business class seats from about thirty years ago and were completely worn out and broken.
My inflight entertainment control was wedged into the arm rest and the seat did not recline. The cabin staff made me feel it was my fault the seats did not work.  All the seats in our row were faulty. 
Dinner was provided about 2 AM. However I already had a â€œnumb Bumâ€ by this time
Cabin service started in the rear of the aircraft and worked their way forward. Premium Economy were served last 
The meal appeared to be left overs from economy. 
I chose the beef, it came with a bread roll that was hard and dry, the beef chewy. Desert was a brown â€œPaddle Pop â€œflavoured iceâ€ 
Book the cook did not work.

Breakfast consisted of a glass of water.

I was disappointed with this business class trip. The flight attendants were not interested in their job and not attentive. 
 They were actively discouraging passengers to order food. Definitely deteriorated since my last Singapore AL trip which was economy and very good
I flew Perth to Singapore then onto Bangkok return on a 777.

I have been flying to Ho Chi Minh from Sydney and Brisbane return since 2003 and have no complaints with anything, service, food, inflight entertainment and seating all very good in my opinion. They are the best airline in the world, I have never had any complaints in the 10 years that I have flying with them. Once they missed a connection in Singapore but they asked me if I had to be in Ho Chi Minh that day which I didn't so they put me up overnight in Singapore in an excellent hotel, provided transport to and from the airport and all other expenses except drinks. I have travelled in just about all of their aircraft including A380, 777, A330, 747. A great airline. I use to fly QANTAS but SIA leaves them for dead.

Flew Singapore  from Perth - Singapore - Ho Chi Minh and Return (Economy). Outward leg could best be described as average,the aircraft was an A330 seating was hard and uncomfortable, food inflight meals pretty average the old Singapore airlines standard has long gone. The return trip was a horror particularly the Singapore -Perth leg, the cabin was plunged in to darkness after takeoff only to be illuminated an hour later for breakfast at 0200hrs. Who eats noodles and stale chicken at 2.00am. I was asleep but was woken by cabin staff for the meal. Why?  The lights remained on until about 40 minutes before we started our approach to Perth when it was plunged into darkness again  for about 20 minutes, and the incessant warnings about turbulence and not being able to serve hot beverages. On a night flight i'd like to sleep.

Part 1 - Flying Brisbane Singapore Munich / Amsterdam Singapore Brisbane on A300-B777-A350-A300. The most disappointed part about the trip was the Business Class seats on the B777 and the A350.  If you slightly recline the seats your legs are up against the seat in front of you and you are unable to stretch them. There is this rediculous design that you can sit sideways in your seat and put your legs up on the bench that forms part of your bed. The seats are so wide that you can't get arm support on both sides. You either have to lean to the right or the left.  When they convert the seat into a bed the seatback is dropped down to form a flat surface. However you can't stretch out. You have to put your legs into a space to the side which means you have to sleep at an angle with your legs bent. If you want to sit up at some stage the bed has to be reconfigured into a seat with the help of a flight attendant. At least on Qantas, Cathay, American and Emirates your seat can be adjusted at any angle between upright and flat. There were no amenity packs as on Qantas. You were handed a pair of slippers, socks and mask but no toiletries although they were available in the toilets.

Flew Premium Economy Singapore to Johannesburg SQ478 on April 14. Very disappointed, not a patch on Air NZ Premium Economy. Service was dreadful, no smiles, didn't seem to care we didn't touch our food which was beyond awful or drink our tea - which was weak to point of undrinkable. Reclining seat in front  crowded you, felt like Economy. Sharing tolilets with economy cabin. Dreading flight home. Not worth extra money. Staff need lesson in being friendly and attentive. As for food, worst I have had on any flight in any cabin. Will not take Singapore Airlines again.

I travelled on Singapore Airlines, just today (03-01-17). I am eleven years old - and had a great experience on Business Class. I went back to my home country - the U.K., for Christmas, and was flying back Business Class (as I do every time coming back to where I am currently living - in Singapore), to resume normal life. I had a fantastic experience. The staff were amazingly kind and caring. They'd bring food and drinks around (which was amazing), and have a lovely smile, but most of all they helped me when my nose was bleeding. It was 3:00am GMT, and my parents were asleep, so I went up to ask for some tissues, and they looked after me so well, as they gave me some tissues and some warm towels, which I could wipe myself with, as the blood was over my nose and mouth. It went on my bed, so they changed it, and they were very kind as they didn't mind it. Unfourtanley I didn't catch their names but the flight was SQ321. My nose bled again, and they gave me a bag and assisted me again very kindly. I have been on Singapore Airlines before, on both Economy and Business Class, but I have never felt so looked after and had such a good experience! I would highly reccomend this airline.

Very disappointed with Singapore Airlines during our recent return trip to and from the UK. Firstly Pre Organised Special Meal was not given on the return trip, and when I enquired Cabin Crew denied the request was received when it had been specifically pre ordered. No alternatives were offered. Also we were not informed Upstairs Economy was not available on the return trip as we specifically booked due to my husbands Physical Disability. Water must have been rationed as we only received half plastic cups when we requested, particularly overnight. Have flown many thousand of miles with Singapore Airlines and we are very disappointed. Now looking at other Airlines for our next international trip.
EDITORS COMMENT: oh half glasses of water are very annoying - fill it up I say so we don't have to keep asking for it.
I love it

I took a flight from India to Singapore then back to Australia, during the flight my headphone jack in my seat stopped working completely, leaving me with no entertainment for the rest of the flight. And then the flight attendants forgot to serve me breakfast while they were serving everyone else breakfast; I was expecting someone to come back with mine but they never did. Extremely frustrated with the service and would never consider flying with them again.

We recently flew from Brisbane to Singapore on a Boeing 777 Sing to HK A380 return to Sing A380 and Sing to Brisbane ( A330) . BNE to Sing flight wasn't great as crew weren't particularly friendly one hostess quite curt actually, the pasta dish was almost inedible but breakfast was fine. Seats comfy and plenty of leg room for us. The entertainment system was poor - static interfering with movies throughout flight . The A380 return Sing - HK was awesome - quiet plane, excellent food and service was fantastic. The pilots were very good at making smooth landings unlike our previous Emerites A380 experiences. Return home Sing - BNE on A330 was good, food was fine as was the entertainment screen quality. I found the A330 a little loud but we were behind the wings so maybe that's why.

I was on the first Manchester to Houston non stop on the 30th October 2016. Everything about it was excellent. The staff, the food , the comfort all 10/10. The landing was the smoothest Ive ever experienced. Thank you. Im a nervous flyer.

Singapore to Brisbane in Business Class. After having flown Economy on Singapore Airlines, I was expecting better than I received. Dreadful breakfast with tepid coffee. Good airport lounge, but Singapore Airlines seems to do Economy better than Business Class
the worst food ever had in my life.

From the moment we got to the check-in gate to the farewell wishes on disembarkation it felt like we had travelled back in time to the golden days of air travel â€“ this is what it was all about.

Amiable staff on the ground and in the air, a spotless, spacious and tidy cabin all made for a flight that was most enjoyable from start to finish. I will definitely spend a few dollars more to fly AQ in the future.

Sq235 singapore to brisbane

Business class experience not much better than australian domestic business. Plane interior fitout at the bottom end vs the competition . Seats uncomfotable, dont lay flat. Plane needs pensioning off. Staff on this flight in business were unfriendly and abrupt. Several times i experienced them pushing their way into my space to do something instead of waiting a moment. They were clearly more interested in doing tasks than their customers experience. If i have the choice in future for this leg i will choose other options. Much better offerrings available. Definitely gone downhill since my last flight and this leg flight attendants worse than the trip Brisbane to Singapore (same plane facilities though)

Singapore airlines couldn't of been better. We flew from Perth to Singapore Time 5 h and 25 mins. The five hour ride was a pleasure with no problems at all. The boeing 777-200 LR was an amazing plane. No turbulence was received and credit to the pilots for that. The takeoff was smooth and that was the same as the landing. I didn't have to wait to board on or off the plane. Singapore Airlines gave me no delays what so ever and i was very very happy about that.

The airline lost one of my luggage and damaged the other luggage. They offered me very small compensation. I have to sue the airline and obtain a judgement against them. It's been almost four months since I obtained my judgement and they still have NOT paid me.  
michael riz

I am a regular flier, (200,000km so far this year) and fly in SE Asia a lot. I used to hold Singapore Airlines up as a yardstick for the others but have noticed that their standards have dropped considerably recently. I fly business for work and economy for leisure and standards in both classes have slipped. SQ are still one of the better airlines but need to pick up their game for that statement to remain true. The equipment is good, Changi excellent (though getting way too expensive) but the in flight service and attitude of many crews leaves plenty to be desired.

Today 26th May 2014. We go to Singapore by Singapore Airline SQ 931. Myself, my father (disable person with no legs on both sides) and my mother.
Onseat 47.

We went to the boarding ticket counter. We asked for front row seat (no. 31) for my father.
The person in charge said that all front seats booked for all babies. Not allowed for disable persons. Because have basins in front of front row seats that use for babies.
"Yoy must contact your travel agent" as she said to us.

I just realized when we boarded inside the plane the reality was "that not all babies seat on the front seats."

I am really surprised that Singapore Airline not happy to bring disable person inside their aircraft.
Maybe next will be better if they announce "Disable person please don't hope to get front seats' or 'not allowed for disable person to go with Singapore airline'. 
And this plane has been booked for all babies.

So we can noticed before we buy a Singapore Airline ticket.

There was also an old lady around 80-90 years old that put seated far behind me.

Singapore airline, 
Why not allocate at least 2 seats front row for disable persons.
A few years ago, your airline was very famous by your hospitality. Now all gone...

Thank you.

Best Regards,

Mr. David

Donâ€™t book with this airline.They are appalling.Cancelled the flight months previously.We were not informed neither was the travel agent.Arrived at the airport devastated.All our transfer flights and hotels gone.Lost all the money.Singapore airlines donâ€™t want to know.
DONâ€™T BOOK WITH THIS AIRLINE

Perth-Singapore, Hong Kong-Singapore-Perth A330
As you would expect from SIA great service all the way, my flight from Hong Kong was delayed so to enable me to catch the connecting flight from Singapore to Perth I was put on an earlier flight, they could not apologise enough for the change, even handing me free meal tickets.
The only slight down fall would be the entertainment system, so far Emirates has by far the best.

It is such a shame that the service of cabin staff so significantly differs from the appalling, rude and detached service of their Sydney check in staff. Not only do they enforce a bizarre 50kg weight policy in first, but the manner in which this is enforced is executed is disgraceful. Singapore airlines HQ should send their customer service training staff to Sydney for an urgent boot camp.

we are a frequent flyer and so far the best service we have got, just one area they needs to improve is helping parents in their journey. the rest was incredible. we invited our parents from india to Australia 3-4  times, we have requested for help as they dont know english, the help provided to them was best. Over all, good value for money and great experience so far.

would not recommend Singapore Airlines.  Delayed flights, staff not available and uncomfortable.  Dirty toilets.   Customer service is a non-existent and slow.  NOT recommended... don't use if there is an alternative.

DISGRACEFUL TREATMENT!

I am disgusted that there was absolutely NO compassion shown in regards to wavering a post-phonment fee for my Mother and I on our tickets to a later date of travel due to my brother-in-law having three seizures and being diagnosed with an aggressive tumor and having to be operated on immediately. Instead we were shunted from pillar to post between Singapore airlines and BYO jet with no resolve at all. A ticket that cost us $800 was now going to cost us $1400 to change. UNBELIEVABLE! I will for sure tell as many people as I can about this experience. Singapore has just become our least favourite airline!

Flew from LHW-SINGAPORE, exceptional! Very professional, arrived on time and felt safe the whole way through. Economy class felt like First class, tv was very entertaining with modern music, loads of films and tv programmes and control of our seats (lighting). Arrived at Marina Bay Sands as expected! FLY with the best airline in the world! 
EDITORS COMMENT: We wouldn't expect anything less from this airline.

I have previously rated SA very highly, but their service in this instance has plummeted. Prior to purchasing my return ticket, I rang SA to inquire about the Gold member additional baggage allowance, knowing that my outward trip was as KrisFlyer Gold and that the Gold Membership would expire whilst I was overseas.  I was informed by SA that since the return ticked was being purchased while I was a Gold Member, then the baggage allowance increase (an extra 20 Kg) would apply for both directions regardless of the fact that the card would expire.  Seem fair and logical enough to me!  I was flying with a heavy tool box and my suitcase so it was very important to know I could get everything (about 40Kg) back home again. 
Well, now it's time to go home, SA have changed their mind and tell me I only have a 30Kg limit, and it will cost me 45 GBP /Kilo to fly the excess 10Kg home again. 450GBP! I must have had 5 return calls now from Singapore now saying "I'm sorry Mr .."  Seemingly, it appears that SA have no staff with any authority to give me back 20Kg allowance or add 10Kg to get me home with my stuff. The solution would cost them nothing I would not be here today, as a very KrossFlyer
Flew from London to Melbourne and my experience could not have been any better. The flight attendants were helpful, friendly and I could not fault the experience.

Airline
Is absolutley fantastic
Air hostess went above and beyond for my little son (8 yo) who had a headache. She supplied her own panadol and cold flannles all night. She even worked out the times he should have more. 

She came looking for us at the airport  and when she found us she wished us best of luck, gave my son some panadol, and told us she hopes it gets better 

Airline is also fantastic, good planes and good service.

EDITORS COMMENT: Thanks for sharing your positive experience

I flew with Singapore airline first week of march from Sydney-Singapore_Cochin  and back..very good experience . The ground staff were awesome. Especially at Cochin ..you guys are wonderful (Mr.SAMITH SURESH & ALL)...Thanks guys..But few cabin Crews were not up to the mark.. May lot of people were  in the flight :)

Singapore airlines are targeting Indians for little quantities of excess baggage. This is racist behaviour from the side of the airlines,  if a white person checks in with the same amount of excess baggage they will easily put it through without any question

Their service is very poor!!! Don't be fooled with the good reviews or you will regret in the end! Yes, their aircraft is nice but that's what it is all about! Staff should go back to customer service 101. And by the way, their company policy is all about them and not caring for customer's benefits at all!!! Selfish company I must say! I will definitely go back flying with Emirates from now on! If I know someone in BBC I would definitely with no hesitations share my worst nightmare with Singapore Air in international telly so everyone will know!!!

Had my first experience on SQ11(A380).. The seat belt was quite short for chubby person like me, compare to other SQ it seems more shorter length.. Foldable table wasn't clean up and stains all over, most disgusting is stains on the cup holder. No air-con throughout the 7hrs plus flight from Tokyo back to SG, Hot like nobody business! Food wise was kinda disappointed also, bread was really hard like stone. Worse case is that we haven even finish the food (as they serve real late compare to those "special order") they started to collect back all food tray. Is this the standard SQ is having? Are they trying to rush us to finish off the late serve? Was really disappointed in SQ as i thought they would be in good standard.. :(

Feel Cheated and disappointed with rude and unprofessional customer service received from on ground staff at Adelaide airport.Always traveled with Singapore airlines and recommended to my friends and family but not anymore. I was charged  AUD483.31for extra baggage at check-in and on my asking for the reason for charging this huge amount staff could not provide me with satisfactory answers.  Further to my disappointment, received an email reply from Singapore airlines customer service department to justify the amount charge and just a sorry for rude staff's unprofessional dealing with customers. Never ever going to travel with this airline again in future. Stuck, this time, thought would have pleasant travel and instead of considering any other airlines with cheap airfare as compare to, Singapore airlines would be better but it all turns out to be, was a BIG MISTAKE.
ON GROUND RUDE STAFF AND UNPROFESSIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE.

I was flying with Singapore airlines ZUR-SIN (airbus a380) and SIN-SYD (boeing 777).
Very good service, staff most kind, spacious economy class, food as expected...i can say it's one of the best airlines.
Entertainment is excellent (tv-series, movies, music, games...you can find everything on airline's website). If you're hungry during the flight they'll give you more food. Fresh hot towels before meal, coffee, tea, juices, beer, wine...everything you want.
I'd like to give a compliment to Fazila F. and Tang Yew M. on the first flight and Alvin W. and Ruth A. on the second. As I said very professional and kind service which I'm not used to it at the other airlines.
Strongly recommend Singapore Airlines. I'd say Rolls Royce in the sky :)

Flew with Singapore Airlines from Frankfurt to Brisbane. Overall it was a poor experience as the interior of the plane was very tired e.g. earphone plugs and entertainment screen not working properly, seats were uncomfortable.  I expected much more for the comparatively high price.

As I look around the plane there are at most fifteen passengers on this flight.  There are more attendant than there are passengers.
1.  Cabins are clean
2.  Lavatories (look closely on the ground, I took pictures) are incredibly dirty around the edges - quite gross.
3.  Meals are inconsistent.  First meal was fish and the fish smelled bad.   I mentioned this to the attendant and before she returned I found a gray hair in the pasta portion.  Quite disgusting.  I was offered a $75 voucher to a discontinued (or not currently available) shopping experience.  Replacement meal was excellent.   Breakfast was SOOOOO over-salted I couldn't eat it.  Only the steamed veggies.,  I figured the fact that I left it out when I went to the bathroom would indicate to them there was something wrong - again.  I was told I was not eligible for a meal this second time around.  Instead I was offered a bag of peanuts.

I travelled from Perth to Singapore the seat comfort was VG, the food was excellent and the staff were excellent on this flight.
The flight from Singapore to London the flat bed seat was excellent, the food was VG based on an average if the evening meal and a breakfast meal. The staff were excellent.  The return flight from London to Singapore the flat bed seat was excellent, the food was VG however the staff member i had on this flight was not she tripped and dropped the breakfast all over me, she then advised me she needed to serve all of her customers BEFORE she could clean the mess off me.
I cleaned the scrambled egg and mushrooms off my clothing and hand bag and the seat. When she returned about 5 minutes later she was going to just take the plate away i had to fold up the soiled table cloth and put it on top of the plate to make her clean up she cleaned a little from the floor and left me to sit for 2 hours in a messy seat.  The flight attendant did apologise but her apology gave the impression of right that is all i need to do.  I would have liked the seat and floor cleaned for the remainder of the flight it was gross.   When i contacted Singapore Air they advised they could not find any report on the incident and they crew could not recall any customers having their breakfast thrown over them.  How convenient.  Not what i expected from this airline.

Zero stars.
Very disappointed with Singapore air. Not so much due to in flight issues, but from a customer service/policy standpoint.
I had hundreds of thousands of air miles banked with the airline. These are miles I accumulated by spending hard earned money to receive.
One day I logged on to use the miles and they were gone. I called Singapore and they told me that the miles had expired. I did NOT receive a warnings about this and when the issue was looked into, I was simply told - sorry no miles anymore.  
This is really  an insult. If you bank miles for future use with an airline, what gives them the ok to simply zero them out???  
I will never fly with them again and I have pulled my company account as well.  I advise that you choose them wisely and look around for alternative travel.

Flew form Cape Town (South Africa) to Phuket via Singapore and again from Bangkok via Singapore to Cape Town. Aircraft departures and arrivals on time or somewhat early. Staff friendly as can be expected. Aircraft on most legs were old and rattle boxes, seating very uncomfortable in economy class. Sound systems at times poor to bad. The stop- over in Singapore, however, was very pleasant and was the only thing that "saved" the entire experience from rated as "Very Bad". I presume that South Africa, being part of Africa, is rated as "third world" and therefore does not merit the use of newer aircraft on the long travel legs (14 hours Cape Town to Singapore). In comparison Qatar uses the new Dreamliner on its Doha/Cape Town leg and therefore they fly this route every day and not three times a week as is the case with Singapore Airlines.  Emirates three flights a day from Cape Town! Question is what do Qatar and Emirates do to attract passengers that Singapore does not do? In my book it is not so much the special flight packages that are offered but the aircraft that is being used.

I flew from Sydney to Christchurch New Zealand and it was the best plane/airline/crew/food/entertainment experience ever. The A380 is by far the most quiet plane, it doesn't even feel like you are flying. Great experience, it's the Best!

Economy CHC-SYD on 777ER middle seat. Awful experience, no arm room at all. The aisles are very narrow so the person on the aisle cannot easily give you the shared armrest and the middle two seats of the four seats are left nudging passengers on each side. The legroom might be fine, ICE is good and the meal is good but the seat had me basically sitting sideways and badly uncomfortable. For a longhaul flight I couldn't think of a worse airline seat than that - sardines have more room I reckon. I would sacrifice all the other things for a decent seat. Never again on Emirates 777.

We had 4 flights by Emirates: from Moscow to Seychelles via Dubai. From Dubai to Seychelles flight delayed for 2,5 hours (18 November 2013). On backward the same situation from Dubai to Moscow (3 December 2013) - 2,5 hours delayed. For this reason, we missed the next flight. 50 % of delayed not too much?

I was happy to think I was to fly in Emirates, but it turned out to be the last airline that could make you Happy. 
1. Water served after 5 hours and Meals served after 6 hours.
2. Kids only, given bread only after 2 hours. No water served, when asked...ignored.
3. Inattentive crew.
4. Cold tea served after main meal.
5. Emirates, your services do not make me Say, it was a nice time.
6. Any other Airline, never been that poor.  Next flight, never Emirates.
7. As the saying goes, big shop but zero quality.

I had a lot of respect for your airline, thought it was a good brand. What a terrible thought that messed up the whole journey.

I love this airline. Flew with them for th 1st time feom Brussels to Bangkok with a stop in Dubai. The planes are high quality, big tv screen, delicious food and menu to choose from. We were seated in the middle so no window view but the cool thing is that in the front row in the middle is a huge screen where u can see the view outside in the front of the plane. They show this camera during take off and landing so u dont miss anything! I love it. We had enough leg space. The entertaiment was super, a lot of new movies and so many other choices! U cant get bored which is very convenient on a long flight. I would definetly recommend Emirates. The only minus was the layover of 3h in Dubai. The airport was boring and the only Burger King is so busy ure easily 30min in line and then comes the search for a seat.

Highly disrespectful  staff and costumer service. The airline randomly canceled a Flight that I had booked 7 months in advance and I had to repurchase my connecting flights. Spend countless hours with them over the phone and received nonsense explanations, no flexibility  whatsoever. When trying to speak to supervisors at the Dubai airport for arranging hotels, visa,  and extra expenses they asked me to just send a feedback email to their website which I had alredy done and it takes them a week to reply. The staff at the emirates office in Dubai was extremely disrespectful and not willing to help at all. NASTASKIYA SAMUEL and AMINICA  from the emirates help desk in Dubai told me that I needed to  learn how to read in a very rude manner. Never flying with this airline again, very unreliable and unnaceptable customer service.
Flew from Melbourne to Auckland. No choice of meal.Rude cabin staff.

Emirates aircraft, inflight crew and service is very good. However, their 'Customer Affairs' branch is a blight on the airline as they appear unwilling to acknowledge their wrongdoing and responsibility when things go wrong. Emirates lost our luggage on both the outward leg and return leg of our recent journey, resulting in considerable delay, inconvenience and expense for us.  Though supplied with all details and receipts, Customer Affairs have flatly refused to compensate. Whether it is Emirates policy or not, it appears that  'Customer Affairs' functions to ignore and deflect passenger problems rather than take responsibility and mediate a solution.  We have found their behaviour to be quite unethical.  On this basis, we would not recommend Emirates over most other airlines.

Had the misfortune of flying Emirates 8 times since July. The service is so poor and inconsistent, I don't think the cabin crew understand the meaning of customer service. One wonders if the staff get any training at all. I will never fly Emirates again, it's just not worth it.

Flew Sydney to Auckland in January 2017 with the wife for a break and received upgrade to business, so things were already looking great. Didn't get lounge access though, but beggars can't be choosers. Emirates' A380 business class is stunning when compared to Dash-8 and 737 aeroplanes we are used to. Service was great, food exceptional for travel options, ample amenities that were very tidy. The seating and complimentary this&that brilliant, including steady stream of drinks. Bar at rear of cabin super chic, but very useful. Coming home, paid the extra to have business upgrade again, but again told no access to lounge upon arrival at airport, which was certainly disappointing considering it was not mentioned when paying for the upgrade. Flight was late in boarding, so deeper pang of regret at not getting lounge access. But beggars can't be choosers, so we gave the bar a workout and arrived back in Sydney quite merry. Cabin supervisor was also particularly awesome and even allowed a quick look at first class after other passengers had left. Reminds me of the saying 'If you want great customer service, start by being a great customer'. Top stuff.
Flew Cape Town to Dubai then Dubai to Perth. Cape Town to Dubai was the worst flight ever. Lack of service, rudeness from cabin crew, uncomfortable seating dreadful food. Will not fly with them again

I"ve used Emirates several times between Istanbul and Bangkok and decided never to fly again. Only good thing about this airline is comparably cheaper prices. Main problem in the cabin is the seat layout, which is 3-4-3 seat on each row. That means the corridors are thin and the cabin is filled more passengers. It makes you feel claustrophobic. As there are more passengers inside the cabin compared to other airlines, the number of flight attendee is not enough to for providing satisfactory care. One annoying thing about their entertainment system is that you have to watch several commercials before the movies or any other videos. In conclusion i recommend to avoid this airline, pay little more and choose other airlines for better flight experience.
Great service and very attentive staff. Especially love the bar area as it allows you to break the long hours stuck in your seat.

Emirates airlines is notorious for its bad customer service. When you fly business class, you get beyond pampered and catered to, but try having a complaint - it rolls off their backs with barely a shrug. I flew the new service from Auckland to Dubai, and it was a hellish 16 hours of blocked toilets. Emirates is also the only Business Class I know of that has middle seats. And before you think I'm just a spoiled whiner, I have flown Economy class in Emirates and was appalled by the noticeable drop in serving standards (courses get skipped, no coffee for you) My latest gripe is their automated systems when using your Skywards Rewards - the system demands a PO Box Number off you, even if you don't have one! You can't enter in "NA" or "0", and they NEVER reply to emails...I wonder if my reward will ever get sent to me?

Good service and easy to check in online with only a small delay in our transit flight. The passenger comfort and seating area are good for economy seats and the good price. The flight hostesses are understanding and helpful. Food selection can be very good or mediocre and at most times it having a good taste and freshness.

I have been using Emirates for the past 12 years and have always been happy. Unfortunate my last trip was a nightmare.  Our  flight from Jhb to Dubai was late, my tv was giving problems, the staff was not unfriendly and on arrival in Dubai we were kept waiting before being allowed into the airport. By the time we got through we missed our connecting flight. We were put on a later flight, which also left late. On arrival at London Heathrow, it was a nightmare trying to locate my luggage. I was being sent from one baggage claim area to the next. I am sorry that I need to get on to another Emirates flight in order to get back to South Africa.

I am very disappointed with Emirates for changing our preference of seating for all but one of our flights during our one month family trip to Europe.

No apology
no empathy
their customer service centre was robotic
their cabin crew are robotic

As a customer I feel that their staff members do not make eye contact and I get the feeling that they all hate their jobs

I flew last September Perth to Dubai and onwards to Rome. The flight from Perth was performed by 777-200. This aircraft is not known for comfort nor leg room.
The age of the plane I traveled would make it one of the oldest in the fleet.

Cabin staff were indifferent and the captain's announcements in broken English were at time incomprehensible.

Never again.  I'll go via Singapore to Europe.

Anemeties of Emirates are still one of the best but the crisis management is the worst I have ever had to experience.
We had a delayed inbound flight from MNL to DXB connecting to DUS. The plane estimated landing was 7:15 (catching up one hour of a 2:40h depature delay from MNL)  and the scheduled depature to DUS was 8:30. Nobody was picking us up at the arrival in DXB. The flight attendands weren't willing to help with the short connection. But the worst thing was that we still arrived at the gate when the Passengers gateways were on the plane and they were still loading the plane. This was at 8:36. However, the Gate was "closed" and the Emirates staff was not willing to contact the supervisor (we were checked in, had seats assigned etc. already) The flight eventually departed 9:35, one hour margin! 
We had to sleep in the crapiest Hotel ever and did not get our suitcases as it was promised by Emirates! 
Now I am here one day later at the gate again waiting fro EK055 to DUS. This time the flight is
Things happen, but I blame Emirates for not taking care of their customers, having badly trained employees and offering no compensation at all! 
"Emirates" the FORMERLY premium airline!

Emirates Airlines is one of the best airline companies, I travelled with it several times and my last flight was the last month and i recommend everyone to try it as it is very nice airline and you'll feel comfort even if you wear in the economy class.

We flew back to Australia from Rome and were booked in business class - for some reason they upgraded us and it was the most fantastic experience. Excellent service; excellent seating, etc. Although I guess you would hope that 1st class was excellent - but it was beyond my expectations. Thanks Emirates - will definitely fly with you again.

My family has been travelling Emirates Airlines for more than a decade now. Emirates is top our list. Excellent crew and services. The crew is always courteous and very kind. Never had a delayed flight.
Best entertainment and food which is very important for us.
Thumbs Up!!!
Return trip Male via Dubai very poor food (uncooked on one journey) and service and response from customer service team very poor on complaint
they lost my luggage, which I had to wait 3 days

I have just travelled from London Heathrow to Perth WA was disgusted that I was not served any food on this flight as they had run out on such a long flight this is unacceptable 12 hours without food cabin crew said they would  fetch food but did not return. You should not treat your clients this way whatever coach they  travel.Meals are not free they are included in price  of travel. On my out ward journey drinks were not very forthcoming on long haul it is very important to keep Hydrated. What has happen to the service on Emirates flights for the Economy passenger? Your service is not what it was.

I recently traveled from IAD (Washington Dulles International Airport) to DEL (New Delhi, India) through DXB (Dubai). Everything looked fine until I reached Dubai Airport (DXB) before gate. My luggage was weighed by Emirates staff (One cabin bag and a laptop bag) and I was passed through. At next stage a female staff informed that I couldn't carry my cabin luggage as there is not much space inside the flight and I will need to Check-it in. I requested to carry it inside and explained it had original property documents which were very important and I couldn't check it in (I even opened my bag and showed her that there were only the documents). While I was talking to her immediately Mr. Mohamed (Seemed their Supervisor) came to me, grabbed my luggage in very rude manner and started taking to the other side, saying " let me see now, get him deported". took luggage back to weighing place and told I am not allowed to take a laptop bag. I explained that it is mentioned on my tickets that one carry-on item such as laptop is allowed. He said no it is heavier. I opened the bag and showed that there was nothing in the bag except the laptop. but he was acting really rude and was ignoring what I was showing him on ticket documents. he said your other bag is also heavier than allowed limit and I will need to pay the money for that.I told it was already passed from Washington Airport as well as here (Dubai) also. It was just that he was trying to harass me. He was being extremely rude and said he will make sure that my flight is missed. I was really in trauma while dealing with him as it seemed that he was trying that my flight is missed. As I was in a different country I was really afraid. He was not allowing me to go. It looked like that other emirates staff there was also not comfortable with his behavior. One of the staff member who had weighed my luggage earlier and allowed slowly told me that I could complain online about him. I tried to ask his name but I was told that they couldn't tell his name. which later I saw on him uniform that his name was Mohammed. Finally I requested him to let me go and I will pay the amount whatever additional they charge. I felt it like a ransom. After a lot of request and paying the amount he allowed me and told the staff to still check in my luggage and didn't allow in the flight. I was really depressed after this incident and I was scared about my return flight if somehow this person is there again he may put me in trouble again. He shouldn't have behaved like this. I was surprised why these kind of criminal mentality people are serving in such a service field.
