Their dining service was also better than that on SQ where each meal consisted of a choice of two starters, three mains and two desserts - all of which were high quality
The Boeing 777-300ER with registration A6-EGO entered service in 2012 and was a brilliant aircraft. Perfectly maintained and brand new, the plane was quiet as well. The overhead bins provided plenty of room for carry-on luggage and added to the highly spacious cabin. 
Would fly with them again in a heartbeat.

Aircraft B777-300ER. Flew Emirates for 3rd time and, even in Economy cabin, I hav not been disappointed. On each occasion, I have flown Perth-Dubai-Glasgow and return. Efficient & friendly staff. I particularly like short waits at Dubai for connecting flights and not transitting via London Heathrow which is a nightmare.
Amazing service, comfortable seating and good food.

Total disrespect to Covid rules

Business trip 2 pers - own bubble. We were allocated 2 seats in a block of 3. A 3rd person was placed next to us, while 10-15 blocks (with 3 or 4 seats) were either completely free or only occupied by 1 person. Asked twice to move what was refused by the cabin crew because of, understand who can, "Covid regulations". So 6.5h at 40cm from an unknown (otherwise friendly) person, where dozens of places were available that did meet the social distancing conditions. I can understand that the software check-in system makes a mistake when allocating the seats, but it is unimaginable that the cabin crew refuses to let the passengers run less risks. To avoid other passengers having to suffer the same fate, complaint filled out via the site, but unfortunately only received a marketing response with the message that Emirates respects the social distancing rules as much as possible and that they do everything they can to  protect the health of the passengers, which in this case is 2x totally incorrect. It is unfortunate that Emirates does not even recognize the problem and therefore nothing will be done about it.

â€œHe should be in ***(airline)â€. This comment passed on me by one of cabin crew of Emirates Airlines. Overall experience was good with Emirates but when i was about to leave the plane the flight attendant was a lady she was standing near exit door and she passed this comment to me. So such a bad experience with emirates.

This is the worst airlines ever. The staff is rude as, and never attend to you. 
I was a bit sick on the plane and wanted some water for my medications, I press the call button, no one turns up (this got repeated on all flights, so it is no a one off experience). I got up all the way searching for a steward, then I found all gathered, chatting & laughing next to food preparation area.
I asked why no one attends for the call, & I am a bit sick and some water; the shocking answer was "it is not our duty". Whose duty? I asked, they said "we do not know, some flight attendant on the plane, & he must be busy".

Good quality planes but a company policy that doesn't care about Customer Service.

Emirates airlines are really good in Window dressing when it comes to their Customer Service. At first sight it looks like they're really value their (loyal) customers but unfortunately in reality they don't live up to the expectations they promise to the world.

I've been flying with Emirates many times before and also reached their Silver Member Status so you can call me experienced when it comes to this airline. The plane itself, the seats and the food provided are OK.

Only when it comes to how they treat their (loyal) customers it becomes a complete different story. Once you've ordered and paid for your ticket they loose their complete interest in you as a customer. They treat you like a number and the only feedback you get are the lines that were written out in their "Customer" scripts. 

This resulted for me to the (unfortunate) decision to use the Emirates services in the future and look for other airlines which provide proper Customer Service

First time taking Emirates from Kuala Lumpur to Milan, Italy with stopover in Dubai. Excellent experience but marred by a 4 hours delay at Dubai on transit back to KL. Food was excellent with very good in-flight service. The ICE was exceptional second to none. Its fare was also relatively cheaper compared to our very own Malaysia Airlines.

Flight was pleasant and on time were traveling Riyadh to Dubai. The only issue was at the Airport Fast Track which the exclusive for Emirates Airlines, They give a fast track past if you are in Business or First but the Q barley moves and the airlines should take care of that. I got around 16 people in front of me which is not bad but, i had to wait 40 minutes since there was one desk helping while other lanes were moving much faster.

I can only say that I was shocked by the cabin crew as they were mean and did not respond to my call. I remember asking a waitress to get me water, and she never did. Food and entertainment were excellent though.

Flew BHX to DXB, then onto HKG, was quite excited about flying Emirates as had heard so much positive views. To be honest it was alright, nothing really to complain about, apart from leaking ice machine made the floor underneath my wife's feet soaking wet. 
But there again nothing to get excited about either.
Return flight HKG to DXB, with 4 day stopover then return to BHX again.
When flying to HKG later in the year, will be looking at using other airlines.

LGW - CMB - LHR/ Boeing 777, A380
I didn't enjoy Dubai airport customer service.

My wife and I chose to fly with Emirates and we are glad we did, no complaints from us, my vice is gluten free and the food was excellent. The Emirates staff in all areas need a big congratulations, we had a lost iPad  in Dubai found and returned within 2weeks  thanks Emirates Peter.

Horrible customer service all over 
I was traveling with a 3 Month old infant, 6 year old, and 9 year old. I sent in a request by email for them to change the seat for all the seats to be next to each other.
1. At the check in in Egypt the agent was very very rude, would not help, and on purpose had one of my daughters seat by herself in the back of the plane.... HOW IS THAT EVEN POSSIBLE!

I transit in Dubai, and spoke with a supervisor to help as again they had my flight that was for 19 Hours away from my daughters. He was very rude and laughed me off, and walked away without helping. 

The agents inside the plane are very very rude, as i ask to help warming the bottle for my 3 month old infant, or to keep the formula inside the fridge. They would speak very rudely to me, as they don't care. 
Never ever flying with Emirates AGAIN

Certainly not the Emirates of the last decade, i fly quite regularly with this airline both Business and Economy and can say things have gone down hill greatly. Firstly prices are sky high compared to many other long distant airlines, planes have become dated and in serious need of TLC, food is mediocre at best but operations are the worst, excess seating costs, delays, and now seating allocation problems. Not to mention when connecting through Dubai emirates wants to save time on moving the planes so passengers are made to wait nearly one hour before entering the gate do due the planes parking for the night and slow transit to the gate, its a very uncomfortable experience and i would recommend to any first time connecting passengers to avoid Emirates Dubai connection at any cost.

We booked from Prague to Tokio via Dubai and back for 450 Euro. The seats in the A380 where wide and comfortable for Economy class. In the 777 it was not so comfortable but OK. The service personal on board have been very friendly and helpful. Would book this connection for that price always again.

I flew Emirates business class return from Sydney to Christchurch to visit friends in NZ in 2019. The business class lounge at Mascot was immaculate. Both flights were amazingly comfortable and the in-flight staff were highly professional, polite, and helpful. The in-flight services were first rate as were the meals and refreshments. For the return flight, the Air NZ lounge in Christchurch was available and this was also very cosy although not as opulent as the Emirates lounge in Sydney. All over, a very pleasant experience.
Good product but very long (distance) routes over UAE. Too much "air time" compared to the competition going between SE Asia and Europe.
Very poorly maintained aircrafts and food is below standards. The quality is very small. The airbus from tiger needs proper maintenance.

You get what you pay for! No truer is this the case than with Scoot. A $400 return airfare from Sydney to Singapore was an irresistible opportunity to visit a friend on a business trip there. All aspects of the check-in & boarding process were very good. On the Sydney-Singapore sector, the flight was probably only half full, so the extra room around me made up for the really uncomfortable seats on the 787-9. With no TV's, the only entertainment is whatever you bring onboard or the iPad's you can hire. I bought a 24 hour internet package and have to say I was blown away by how quick it was. The under seat power charging for an additional USD5 was also very useful. About the only irritating aspect of the Scoot aircraft is the placement of the buttons that operate the light & call button. Being right on the top of the armrest, I kept accidentally pressing the call button. 

EDITORS COMMENT: Thanks for your balanced review. We agree!
Great flight lots of room will use them again

Pretty good value for money. Seat in no children area had good leg room. Food was awful - eat before leaving! Staff ok but did not clear uneaten food debris for over an hour making it pretty uncomfortable. Still budget airline that was comfortable and on time seems good to me!

Pleasantly surprised by how comfortable I felt flying with Scoot in January from Singapore to Perth. Seats were comfortable and had a nice angle, and didn't feel like you were sitting on top of the person next to you. 
Had good departure time from Singapore, which is why I chose to travel with them (as well as the great price). 
Was disappointed at the price of a bottle of small water. There also seemed to be plenty of empty rows, where no one was offered (or allowed maybe?)to be shifted to, if there row was full up.
Would definitely fly with scoop again, if price and schedule was right.

On my flight from Singapore to Melbourne, the air steward was very kind. He took the initiative to help passengers stow their belongings in the overhead locker. When he heard that I had fallen before I got on board, he got me some water. I have taken many flights on full-services airlines and it is not often that I see passengers receiving such attentive help. Thanks Yuxiang!

Crew staff are generally pleasant, polite and helpful. Air crafts are comfortable enough. A budget airline that offers passengers a good sense of dignity.

Unfortunately, counter and call centre staff need much room for improvement for their work morale and attitude. Are they generally disgruntled to serve customers from Singapore? Rudeness and curtness experienced. Selective approach in their dealings. More training could be provided to these staff, in professionalism and courtesy. Hopefully, they can take pride in accurately representing an organisation that has provided them employment.

Regular traveler to singapore asia Worst exp I have ever encountered TZ 292 SIN/BKK 22nd april 2017 Delayed 2 hours out of singapore not one announcement  Re delay 300 PAX just sat and waited and waited  Pilot said sorry paper work was not completed properly Could not understand several crew members spoken english Surely this is a safety major issue  No immigration forms on board for BKK  after 2 delay arr Pax had to find their own immigration  forms and go to the back of the queue of several hundred people another 2 hours clearing immigration Scoot could not care less Jet star just rated worst budget airline in world I am sure scoot will soon dethrone them   Disgusted

Flight Perth to Singapore return. Delay of 2 hours on the way over with no text / email notification which was a little frustrating (mainly because Perth international airport is so boring). Seats were comfortable with adequate leg room for me ( Although I am short) but you should book extra leg room if you are tall. Plenty of opportunity to purchase food and beverages  during the flight at what I thought were reasonable costs. Plenty of overhead room for bags etc. But what I really enjoyed was that on both flights the pilots came over the speaker to explain why the seat belt signs were put back on and how long they estimated they would remain - This goes a long way with assisting those of us who are nervous flyers (there were at least 3 of us sitting in close proximity to each other but not travelling together). Would love to fly on this plane again (super quiet with amazingly smooth take off).

We boarded our plane to Singapore and had to wait on board for 2 hours due to technical difficulties. The flight was then cancelled as there were not the appropriate staff or parts available to fix the issue, and the night time departure curfew had been reached in Sydney. We were told to disembark and return to the check-in counter. No scoot staff were present here. The call centre had no information either. We were going on this trip for a long weekend, so when they could not reschedule our flight until the day we were due to return, we were offered a refund for this one-way part of the flight. We had to re-book flights with another airline at the airport which Scoot then would not reimburse us for, or for the loss of pre-paid parking fees. We did have comprehensive travel insurance, however almost no policies on the market will cover for mechanical failure of an aircraft that leads to a delay or cancellation (which I didn't know!). Scoot did not reschedule the flight for the next morning, communicate with any of the stranded passengers at the airport, or prove at all helpful in the months following when we tried over MANY phone calls to follow up. Don't fly with this company. If they cancel your flight there is no skin off their nose - but you'll have a costly nightmare on your hands - regardless of whether you have travel insurance or not.

Scoot No Good
While the fare was quite good, and the staff were good fun everything else was rated lacklustre to just plain bad. Add to this that all 4 flights I have flown have all been late means I won't fly them again.

Worst customer service I have ever experienced!
Our flight was delayed 6 hours which meant we would miss our connecting flight so we took the option to cancel and receive a refund. We were advised it would take 3 to 4 weeks to receive the refund. Well it is now 10 weeks and I'm still waiting and every time I call customer service I receive a robotic response that the refund takes 6 to 8 weeks! When I asked to speak to a manager I was placed on hold for 20 mins only for the staff member to tell me the supervisor was on lunch! Absolutely disgusting

They got me to check in online and then told me I had to go to the counter anyway, even though I wasn't checking any luggage. They should really tell people ahead of time that they can't get an online boarding pass or use a kiosk, so they don't waste their time trying :(

Excellent Flights, both trips to and from Singapore.  Flight attendants were attentive and greeted me all the time with my last name, which is very seldom even in some full service airlines.  

Flights attendants were so attentive that they even asked for my preference in when to have my meals as that was a midnight flight and woke me just in time for my meals before touch down.  

Water was offered once on board, within seconds on both legs, even without asking.  

Can't ask for anything more, except for a priority check in lane at Singapore gate for security check.  

Scoot is always my favourite on LCCs, even when compared to certain full service carriers like Cathay Pacific.  To me, CX is more like a LCC nowadays than to Scoot.  

Wifi on board is another reason why I am choosing Scoot.

I travelled very frequently with Scoot airline to any country that Scoot covered. The last bad experienced I had with scoot team and insurance that I''ve bought travelclaims.sg@acegroup.com that is link with Scoot airline was unacceptable response from them regards for 8 hours delayed from Singapore. That my claim was unsuccessful due to that it was not mechanical/ structure defect. 
I am very disapoointed with Sccot team airline as I am a fan of Scoot and strongly recommend to my family and friends regardless the airline always delayed for 3 hrs. But now, I am not sure to continuing travel with scoot.

Flight was schedule to leave Syd 27/2 13:45 hrs local time. Flight delayed until 16:45hrs same day. The Customer Call center told me to check in 3 hrs before the actual schedule time 13:45hrs. This is the second occasion that I had experience flight delays up to 2-3 hrs. There were other passengers on connecting flight with other Airlines in Singapore and they are very frustrated because they loss their tickets on the connecting flight from Singapore. Don't fly SCOOT or you lose your loot.

Completely unacceptable food (only one meal in 7.5 hours and that was a tiny effort with fatty meat and nothing substantial plus a Toblerone), one drink in 7.5 hours, a seat wih no footrest, the curtain draped over me (seat 11D) so everytime a passenger went to the toilet it woke me, no effective priority boarding (only one line), no priority bags, no in flight entertainment unless one had an iPod, no newspaper, no cushion, no blanket and the economy passengers got off before us all adds up to the most unsatisfactory so-called business flight I have ever taken on my flights from Bangkok-Singapore-Coolangata. I would have got better service for cheaper price travelling on Thai or Singapore economy. It will be the last time I fly on Scoot, which should be called Skeleton instead because that is what it is - a bare bones service.
EDITORS COMMENT: we are reviewing Scoot Business class in January so will look out for these things

I had the most abysmal experience with Scoot at every interaction including before the flight (cancelled 1 day before and no other flights available except their partner company Singapore airlines which was $500AUD more). On the flight there is no water available for free (12 hour flight) until I complained and stated it is actually illegal and the airline host told me to be quiet and game me a small bottle. And after the flight (still going on and it has been over 6 months...) I have been emailing Scoot customer service and they have refused to provide a complaints avenue so I have succumbed to my first ever online review because of the level of disappointment and fury I have with Scoot.

Our Scoot Nightmare in nine shocks (part 1)

shock 1: On our way to Bangkok airport we received a voucher for the cancelled fligfht home!
shock 2: A new internet booking for 9.000 baht isnâ€™t possible, instead we have to buy an overprized ticket for 21.000 baht!
shock 3: After buying the overprized ticket they didnâ€™t want to let us fly! We showed an email from the Greek ministery of foreign affairs (mfa) giving green light for my wife - and they checked us through to athens.
shock 4: In Singapore Scoot denied boarding to my korean wife (not me). we tried to show the mfa email, they didnâ€™t want to see it.

Service was good. Seat was really really uncomfortable though. The price was reasonable for business class. The CAs were friendly. Food wasn`t bad, better than JAL`s business. The seat though was really really hard. It was difficult to sleep or relax. It was about the same as Air Asia`s economy class. I`m not sure I would fly again on Scoot or not.

I bought a ticket from Melbourne to Singapore. Payment through their Poli System and had no proof of my payment but the funds were taken out of my account. I called customer service and their only solution was to wait 24 hours - by that time the flight would have left. They did not allow me to speak to a supervisor nor did they produce any solutions. I am now chasing the company for follow up and credit to my account.

Definitely affordable air travel from Perth to Singapore (cheaper than traveling interstate in Australia) however for a five hour Trip you would most likely need to have a meal... And this is where it goes downhill "all "the food we saw coming off the food cart including the 2 disgusting meals we bought and took one mouthful- yuk and overpriced. Unfortunately we spent the next few hours into the flight hungry - I recommend take your own food - obviously food quality and taste is not a priority to Scoot Airlines 

EDITORS COMMENT: Scoot are fantastic but the in flight catering does need an overhaul

This review is solely about the price Scoot charged me for a one way flight from Phuket to Perth last week. I was ill in Thailand and had to return home early. Scoot had no customer care or support at the airport - they gave me 3 different phone numbers to ring and none of them answered. Their email address also did not work as it would take up to 10 days to receive an answer. Next day, Scoot charged me 3 times the normal amount to return home. In total, I had to pay them 23,700 bahts to change my flight and in addition to the flight which I had originally booked and did not use - 7,800 bahts, I ended up 31,500 bahts poorer or AUS$1,278 for a one way flight to Perth from Phuket. Do not think about using this airline if you need to change your flights and it will be the first and last time I will ever use them.

I am a frequent traveller from HKG to SIN, for both business and leisure.  I flew on their 777 a few years back and up to now, I am still a loyal customer of Scoot.  It is even better than Cathay Pacific or Singapore Airlines but of course, you get what you paid for.  

My last trip with them was in Mar 2015, on a B787 Dreamliner.  Only one word Excellent.  The cabin was spacious, the seats were great.  Probably it was an overnight flight, so the flight attendants simply switched the cabin lights off, went back to their place and no one was disturbing me for the whole flight.  Who cares for food on a 3.5 hour flight?  Getting a can of coke in the air for just S$4 isn't too much, is it? The lightings were great and energetic.  The crews were friendly, lively and handsome.  

The wifi on board at such a cheap rate was another plus.  I can stay connected with my friends and family.  No one even knew I was 41,000 feet above the sea!

Thanks to their cheap rates, I can now see my friends in Singapore like once every month.  Look for their special promotion, it can be as cheap as HKD$99 for a single trip!  Amazing airline, thanks to the hard work from everyone on the Scoot team!

Flew from Singapore to Perth on 29 May 2017.  This is the first time I have flown with Scoot and I found the experience quite pleasing. I know it is a budget airline and you get what you pay for, so you actually choose your own level. I paid extra for a bigger seat which I am glad about. I did not pre order a meal but I did purchase one on board just to see what they were like - typical airline food. I found the drinks (beer) was very expensive. Overall it was good for the price - I will travel again with Scoot.
Uncomfortable seats, crew that don't care and schedules that they don't care about. Simply the worst airline I have ever travelled on. Never again.

Be Warned don't fly Scoot! Stay away it's not worth it! Lost our baggage 4 weeks not 1 call from them . And calling them you need to wait 20mins just to get through to anyone and then you get told you need to call Singapore airport FROM AUSTRALIA! So unprofessional its ridiculous. Not to mention the I don't give a shit attitude from start to finish from the check-in counter to the staff on the plane but most of all the so-called customer service. They lost half the planes baggage and then you need to chase it up by calling Singapore as it's not there problem. Are YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME! 5 weeks into this issue and been lied to repeatedly and treated like this is my fault. Never once was nasty to anyone but now they refuse to find it so its my mission over the next few months to warn people on every website I can find about there terrible customer service and half-ass airline!

Purchased a more expensive ticket for their 'scoot in silence' seats which promises an adult-only zone which is silent so you can sleep. However my and my wife's seat was directly next to the toilet, and consequently the queue, the flush and the banging door. It was actually the noisiest flight I've ever had. I complained and was told there was nothing they could do.

I've also added up the money I save by the cheaper ticket, and with all the other hidden charges it would have been cheaper to fly with a better airline. Yes, they are a budget airline, but there are some things which shouldn't cost money, such as good service. When our plane was boarding, the staff were just talking to each other and a huge amount of people were confused and not even sure what was happening.

The food is also terrible - we paid for two teas (yes you have to pay even for tea), and they bought two foam cups and handed us two tea bags. We asked for milk, and got a strange look, and eventually someone came back with powdered milk sachets. 

DO NOT USE.

Had a great Singapore Airlines experience last year flying Sydney to Heathrow via Changi so booked with them again for March 2023.
E ticket stated 4 flights with Singapore Airlines but Sydney to Changi turned out to be Scoot.
Very bad experience. Old plane with hard seats and no cushion.Arm rest broken and patched with sellotape. One poor quality, complimentary meal and drink and after that everything had to be paid for, even drinking water. No inflight entertainment. This was an 8 hour flight!!
Arrived at Changi feeling tired and uncomfortable, with another 14 hour flight ahead of me.Would not have booked if I'd known.

The order web site is the worst I v ever seen. They try to sell anything.

My first (and the last) experience with Scoot can't be worse. My flight has been delayed for 6 hours, but the customer service guys were so inpatient to hear my complains. I booked the night flight and planned to sleep on plane, so that meal and drink was not pre-ordered. However the flight was delayed till the second day which became a day flight lasts for 8 hours without meal and drink.

Despite my wasted car rental on the second day due to flight delay, I only asked for free drinks and meal as compensation. The customer service even did not want to have a try to request for me but just said "no we cant do it". They even asked me to cancel my flight and they will compensate 20 dollars administration fees....

by AU and US regulation, in any case, if it is delayed by more than 3 hours, meal should be provided. I am not sure where can we claim in Asia.

Crap, crap, crap!!! We had a wonderful holiday in Singapore. Scoot was the only part of our holiday that we regret. I'll spare you the details, but the 5 hour delay (...BOTH WAYS ) we had (...which our travel agent didn't even know about) was not the end of it; the bad stomach upset we both had on our return following our meal on the flight sums up our experience pretty well. If you're contemplating a trip to Singapore with Scoot ... DONT DO IT!! This is without s doubt the worst airline (... budget or otherwise) we have ever experienced. CRAP!!

Scoot was a very enjoyable carrier. I would definitely recommend booking with them when they have a sale on, if they fly to your destination. It is infact cheaper to fly from Perth to Sydney via Singapore on Scoot, then it is to go direct. Took a flight from Perth-SIN-Perth on 777. 

If you do book with scoot, I recommend you book in the Scoot In Silence section of the aircraft. It is like the premium economy section of a premium carrier like Qantas. It is rows 21-25 of the aircraft. It includes so much legroom, more than I have ever had in any economy class flights, and you have the advantage of the meals being brought to you before the rest of the plane, as you are seated up the front of the aircraft. The cabin crew were very friendly, I thought their service was comparable to the likes of Emirates, they smile a lot, always doing their job as efficiently as possible. If you are on a long flight I recommend eating prior to the flight because the meals are a little small. I was able to keep myself entertained with my own music and magazines, I assume it is better now with in-flight wifi, but again recommend taking books, magazines or anything to entertain yourself in your carry-on.

To everyone out there. Don't fly with scoot. I had buy my ticket on the 17 March, and I choose not to have travel insurance. Somehow, after I paid for it, there was insurance add on to my account. I called them up right after I found out, which is 2:10 am Melbourne time. the girl on the phone said she will get me back my refund, but this will take 6 to 8 week. I wasn't happy about this, but I guess they give me back my money, so better than nothing.

When I call them up 2 days ago, asked has the refund been processing yet, I got told there was no refund record on the system, and I had missed out on the 7 days cooling period, so nothing they can do about it. I asked them, is this meant I been forced to buy this insurance, they said "Yes"...........
after talking for other 30 mins, they agree to find out the record of my first called to them about the insurance which I had given them the time and day I call. And scoot said they will get back to me with 24 to 48 hr.

but as we all know, they never call again.

DO NOT WASTE YOU TIME AND MONEY ON THIS COMPANY

p.s they had charged me 2 times for seat selection fee, due to an error on their system, I asked them about it, so they put it a

Worst airline experience I've had to date. Never even made the flight. After going through an online checkout process riddled with hidden upsells (including trying to get you to pay for selecting your seat), I paid for my flight. I immediately realized that I had made a booking error, which was totally my fault: the time was for 2:25AM, not PM.

I called them immediately (minutes later), and they wouldn't budge on refunding. Not only that, they wouldn't let me change my destinations, and their only flight schedule for BKK to TPE was between 2:25AM and 3:50AM, for the foreseeable future!!!

I was on the phone for an hour. They were completely unhelpful and unwilling to make an exception in the name of good customer service. I will never recommend this airline to anyone. Ridiculous.

Called the scoot call centre to discuss changes to my bookings. Worst call centre i have ever engaged with in over 20 plus years of flying with different airlines. I believe its in Philippines or managed by phillipinos. Poor communication and listening skills. Spoke with 2 different operators( one claimed her name was Sachie and the other i didnt even waste time with as she was abosultely a terrible customer officer) both were equally bad. I will never ever be recommending Scoot to any of my friends or family. I would rather pay slightly more and take another budget airlines that a
provides better customer service and experience.

I have taken several Scoot flights over the last couple of years.  Overall, each flight rated above average.  However, I had to cancel my recent flight on compassionate ground and this is when the nightmare started.  An airline must also be rated on the way it manages issues outside SOP and when genuine clients are in need.  The company hides behind its call centre and does not have a channel to alleviate complaints.  It has been almost 3 weeks since my initial contact, with my numerous follow up, about the cancellation.  To date, the issue has not been resolved.  In case you need to go through my experience, you need to take a full swig of the patience potion and hope that you don't suffer from hypertension.  Upon receiving the request, Scoot advises that it would again be submitted for further evaluation and subjected to approval.   To add fuel to fire, they asked for further patience as their process could take up to additional 8 weeks due to their large volume of requests.  Note the irony.  Before booking a flight on Scoot, read the fine print - refund is in the form of a transferable travel voucher valid for 6 months, irrespective of your circumstance.

EDITORS COMMENT: As frustrating and unfair as this seems, this would be the case for 90 per cent of carriers if you were traveling on the cheapest -non flexible- fare.  These fares are great - it means we can all travel more but don't expect a refund or any compensation of you need to change your plans no matter what the circumstances.

This airline is just one of the kind. Like i have never seen an airline this unfair and unorganised. 
I travelled from Singapore to Melbourne on late January. Flight at 12:40am. I arrived at gate 12:20 and they did not let me in. They hold the plane till 1am to find my luggage and throw it out. All they said was sorry you missed your flight. I showed them the time as in i have 20 minutes left and they were like,NO you have to be at the gate 45 minutes before and that is the rule. they passed me through the flyscoot office to collect my bag. I went to their airline office to seek help and the girl sitting behind the counter talking on the mobile phone with the headphone as in i am not available. After 5 minutes of chat on the mobile phone i explained the situation and she calmly responded: SORRY WE CAN NOT DO ANYTHING AT THIS STAGE AND YOU MISSED YOUR FLIGHT. you have to buy a new ticket back for tomorrow. 45 Minutes later, someone took me to immigration to stamp entry again to Singapore in order to receive my check in bag. They said we can not pass you your bag in transit so you have to enter Singapore and receive your bag after immigration. Even immigration officer was surprised.

EDITORS COMMENT: This is not a specific to Scoot. Cut off times at Changi airport are not 20 minutes and to be fair all the signs through the airport do say final call etc. It is ridiculous to delay the plane so your bag can be found we agree but we can assure you that this is a Singapore Airport thing.

On a recent flight on Scoot, my baggage got lost, during Transit at Singapore. I had paid $40 for  their service called 'Scoot-thru', wherein one's baggage is checked through if you are connecting to another flight. So the least one would expect if your baggage gets lost, is that they return the charge I paid for the checked in baggage service. But instead of getting anything in return the letter states that the fact I got my baggage after a few days means that they have delivered the service. So with no heed to the inconvenience caused I am another delightful profit provider. I really liked Scoot till now, moving forward i am not sure.

EDITORS COMMENT: yeah that's a bit wrong!! They should refund that really

Customer Service is non existent, call centre takes a long time to get through to, then staff have difficulty understanding, promise to escalate the issue, give timelines to get back to me & never do & there is no other way to contact them.  I even lodged a complaint through the feedback service on their website, received a computer generated email saying they would get back to me in 10 business days and they never did.  I paid for 24 WiFi services for all 4 passengers on a recent flight from Gold Coast to Singapore.  The cost was $AUD30 per passenger.  We never received the promised email with log on details, which was supposed to come 24 hours prior to the flight.  After calling Scoot call centre, I was provided with 1 log on user name and password.  I questioned the Scoot agent twice about each passenger needing their own log on details.  I was assured that as we were on the same booking number we would only need 1 log in. When we were on the flight, only 1 passenger could log in, as we ALL NEEDED A LOG ON user name & password. I have asked for a refund for the 3 passengers and have received nothing - customer service say they will escalate and get back to me, but they never do.

The worst customer service ever !!!! paid 17kgs extra luggage one month ago. Then they put me on a Singapore airline flight from Singapore to Sydney. Singapore Airlines then told me they had no access to the info from Scoot so they made me pay all the excess again. Now waiting after 7 calls and promises for a refund of the 17kgs paid and NOONE responds. Each email of customer service has been closed. Never seen such a disaster service ever !!!!

Scoot is very good low cost carrier compared to likes of air asia. Their 777 service is very well thought out and being a bigger wide body jet it is quite comfortable. 

Flight crew was very friendly but looked very inexperienced. 

Overall very satisfied as you get what you pay.

We travelled Scoot business class Gold Coast to Singapore return.  As this is a low budget airline we were not expecting  any extra services & found payment for drinks etc quite acceptable. Yes travelling Singapore airlines as we have previously is vastly different but the convenience of leaving & returning to the Gold Coast  not having to travel via Brisbane/Sydney is the perfect fit! Meals were acceptable budget airline food.  The cabin crew were courteous & obliging why do people expect extra's on these airlines you made the decision to fly with them!  We thought the return fare for Business Class was reasonable and we will certainly be using them again living an hour from the airport suits us shame  more International locations are not available yet.   You get what you pay for!!!!
EDITORS COMMENT: They're excellent value for money when you're expectations are realistic - like you said, they're a low cost carrier! Thanks for the great review.

Awful reception at checkin in Melbourne, staff unhelpful and rude
no inflight entertainment, disorganised boarding methods.

I have been waiting for a voucher from Scoot , for 12 weeks ! I am on a Disability Pension , originally I needed to post pone for a few weeks , they said no , then I had to get not one but two medical certificates , April 4th 2015 ! Today is the 19th of June , she no voucher ? This would have to be the worse experience of my life ! Disgraceful Scoot !

Flew PER - SIN 13th September and SIN - PER 20th September. Both flights were on -time, pretty smooth flying going to Singapore, flight actually arrived early. Not a big fan of their new departure time from Perth @9.30pm, however the departure time for the return flight from Singapore @ 3.00pm is a good time. We flew in "Scoot in Silence" both ways. The advantage is supposed to be more quiet due to no kids under 12 years of age. Doesn't stop you getting adults sitting behind you kicking your seat though. They do allow Scoot in silence passengers to disembark before other economy passengers. My meal going to Singapore was the braised chicken with rice, I didn't really enjoy it that much, but I'm not too keen on airline food anyway.The meal on SIN -PER was Roasted Chicken thigh with honey garlic sauce which was a lot tastier. My husband enjoyed his Nasi Lemak meal. Tried to use Scoot TV on way home but had an issue with the credit card processing so gave up. You have to download the Scoot APP before you fly and then log on to Scoot wifi to access the payment screen. There's not a lot of newer movies to watch, mainly ones that already on Foxtel or Netflix. Leg room was fine for me, I'm 170cm. For taller people, the stretch seats would probably be better. The staff were great on both flights with Captain or First Officer keeping passengers informed at beginning and before descending. Yes I would fly Scoot again, just wished they arrived in Singapore a little bit earlier.

our scoot nightmare (part 2)
shock 5: The tricky boarding stuff sent us to Transfer D: â€žthereâ€™s a Scoot officeâ€œ taking care of everything and they will help us. But in transfer D thereâ€™s just a night staff, who canâ€™t do anything for us and many other Scoot nightmare guests.
shock 6: No service, no food, no water, no help at all - while waiting more than 6 hours!
shock 7: Our luggage is not available - itâ€™s behind immigration counters. If we go out, weâ€™ll be quarantined for 14 days.
shock 8: The Scoot manager is kidding us: We need a medical certificate, we would get it in a clinic nearby. But this clinic doesnâ€™t test anyone - and the manager should know it.
shock 9: No flight money back! The manager was generous enough to give us the flight to Bangkok (instead of Athens). We could hardly remain cool.

No shock, almost expected: Since march 20 Scoot didnâ€™t refund anything, doesnâ€™t answer emails.

Absolutely hopeless and would never book with them again. I booked a ticket for my daughter to come visit Sydney to Singapore return. Contacted customer service to book as she is 17 yrs old, asked if she would need a letter as an "unaccompanied minor" and they said yes. At Sydney airport they refused her to travel as she was unaccompanied and as of September 2016 rules had changed that passengers had to be over 18 unless travelling with  an adult (ticket was booked in November 2016). I have been now waiting over 10 weeks to receive a refund and keep getting the run around. Unbelievable bad service and would never recommend or travel with them again.

I have traveled sydney to hyderabad through scoot on 10 dec. I have received email and SMS saying that there is 3 hours flight delay due to technical issue and flight started 3.5 hours late in sydney. By the time i reached singapore my hyderabad flight check in is closed and tiger ground staff booked me next flight which is after 24 hours. There is no accommodation nor compensation offered as flight delay was less than 4 hours. I have to pay my accommodation and food and wait 24 hours in singapore transit hotel. I have traveled next day to hyderabad and to my surprise my checked in baggage didn't arrive. I paid scoot thru and they are supposed to transfer my luggage to my next flight. I have written a complaint in hyderabad airport and left. till today i didn't recieve any call from ground staff about my luggage. i have tried 50 time to the numbers provided on PIR. Phone is either engaged or disconnected after few rings. Not sure what should i do now to get ac my luggage.

My experience with Scoot was disgraceful. 

I do not understand why this blog does not post reviews about delays, as Scoot delayed us by 22hrs which is extremely significant.

Regardless, the attitude of the company and staff on the ground was woeful. After more than six hours of delay with no answers or information regarding the next available plane, fellow passengers and I had to literally demand that they organise us accommodation. These staff members were some of the simplest forms of human beings I have ever come across, and there was no management on the ground to support them, nor would anyone higher up answer when we could physically leave the airport. 

After nearly 20 hours, many of us became so desperate for answers (after a second delayed flight) that we had to ask our loved ones to call the Singapore Airlines hotline in our home countries. My mother did this for me and SA had no idea what was happening to us, so they contacted Scoot Airlines to find out more information about the next flight, but were met with barbaric service and were hung up on.

The cheap prices are enticing but when you lose $$$ accommodation at your next destination, its just not worth it.

Not bad for a low cost carrier especially the option of different classes onbord are appreciated even business class is not the same as a proper business class but having the private cabin and the seat in front of the plane is well worth the small extra cost

Awesome flight from Gold Coast to Singapore then conection with tiger air to phuket made easy with scoot through.  Travelling with two kids aged 10 and 12 drama free is almost un heard of but for us flying with scoot we had no issues at all. Lets hope our return flight on 26th sep from phuket to Gold coast is jyst as good.

Scoot is the worst budget airline I have flown with. Its ground staff/baggage enquiry staff at Changi Singapore airport are very unhelpful. I purchased extra baggage up to 35kg for SGD88 online and when I was successful in paying for an upgrade to ScootBiz with 30kg of checked baggage, Scoot luggage enquiry manager informed me that I had to purchase another 40kg of checked baggage when my combined luggage weighed about 40kg which will cost me another SGD100 online and another SGD150 at the check in counter. There was no other option to just purchase an extra 5kg online. Since I had already paid for the 35kg in addition to the free 30kg in Scootbiz, it is reasonable to expect that 40kg is not over the allowable weight limit but no, Scoot ground luggage staff informed me that I had to purchase the 40kg for another SGD100. This is daylight robbery! Inflight service in Scootbiz was equally lousy. You had to pay for everything. No change of drink once the order had been keyed in by the flight attendant and no free blanket or socks. You need to pay for all those necessities! If you read the information on Scoot website, you get a different impression. Misleading advertising!!!

Travelled business class from Singapore to Melbourne. It doesn't feel lime business class at all. No drinks were offered,  not even water. Had to pay for everything including blanket. No tv,  had to pay for online movies using our own devices. Food was disgusting. 

EDITORS COMMENT: As per our editor reviews on this site, Scootbiz is a low cost 'business class' its basically like a basic economy. I wish you had of seen the review first so you were not left disappointed as it's very different to business class as most people know it.

We flew Scootbiz, Melbourne-Singapore return. 
The Dreamliner planes were so new and we loved our big, roomy and comfortable seats, especially good for my big, tall son.   
Our pre-booked meals were all good quality. We also bought snacks and drinks that were good and cheaper than we expected . 
The crews were very friendly, informative and very attentive.

On our 1st flight they wore dress-ups and played a Valentines Day game which included passengers from throughout the plane. This was fun and raised plenty of laughs. 
The crew chattered  to passengers and looked happy in their job. (Very different to some other airlines!!)
Scootbiz is 'no frills' business class so you do need to pay extra for 'extras'  such as wifi, blankets, extra meals and drinks.
 But you do  get so much included in the very cheap flight costs including a choice of meals, drinks,  tv channels, 30kg check in luggage and 15 kg carry on with big comfortable seat with great service from the crew was which is  ALL included in the advertised fare. 
We were 100% satisfied with our Scootbiz experience and the great value for money. We will definitely fly Scoot again.
Gold Coast to Singapore scootbiz was excellent. Will fly again.

I cannot understand why a budget airlines has a Business Class esp. when it gives "Business" class such a bad name.
35 passengers sharing 1 toilet.  Seat was wider and a little more legroom, but recline was about the same as Economy, and worse not electrically but self powered.  Flight Attendants not interested to help my kids push down.
No Australia Entry forms. 
Return flight on Econ.  1 hour flight delay.  Another hour to get onto flight, 45 mins on the tarmac under strong sun.  Got on board and policy NOT to provide even water -- for their tardiness and lack of organization.  Ordered a Cup Noodle (5$). They took my cash and promptly forgot.  3 hours later I ask for it, they ask to see my receipt. I told them they didn't give me one. They suggested that without a receipt, they can't verify what I really ordered.  I told them thats fine -- I'm diabetic and I'll pay another $5 to avoid going into diabetic coma if they insisted on the position that their passengers would scam them of a paltry $5.
They brought the noodles thereafter but made me feel like it was charity.
No concept of hospitality.

Incredible service. The dreamliner aircraft has beautiful clean air and the windows are really big. Scoot has really good value for money and the culture onboard the aircraft is really fun and social. Love the scoot biz class too! Flew that too.

EDITORS COMMENT: We agree!

We wish to congratulate Scoot on the compassion they showed to a family travelling with a disabled son on our flight from Singapore to Perth today. They kept passengers advised of the situation and tried to make up time lost during the flight. We were very impressed. Our flight was comfortable and staff were very efficient and friendly. Thank you Scoot. 

EDITORS COMMENT: Thanks for sharing such a positive story.

I couldn't add any luggage in the website. And there, the price was about 15 Us. They ask you to go to the check in and do there directly. But.... At the check in, the price was 70us for 20 kg! Almost the ticket price! I asked for the same price, but the attended were so rude and treat me like a stupid! Looking for my passport and embarrassing me! Terrible experience for me and my son... He was so scared! Never more! Wrong twice: to obligate me to pay a unfair price and be aggressive with me and my family!

During POLi transaction payment on 22 Apr 2017 flight booking my page got disconnected and I was asked to do a card payment by customer service team to continue with booking. I was given an assurance that the earlier POLi transaction would be refunded. But it has been 8 weeks now and even after several calls to customer service I haven't received my refund. I am thinking of going to consumer court if my refund is not done by end of this week.

I recently travelled Scoot from Singapore to Perth.

I was fairly excited to travel with them as they have boasted flying the new 787 Dreamliner.  I had booked their business class to have the extra room, luggage and meal.  Now I realise this is a cheap offshoot SIA, however this near new plane was in pretty shabby condition, honestly the interior looked like a plane of ten years old, pen marks all over seats, grubby walls and carpets, it was a real disappointment.

The immediate thing I noticed is noise levels, I had a few days  earlier flown from Hong Kong to Singapore on Cathay on an A330, they are much quieter aircraft, so I don't understand the claim from Boeing, the so called tinting glass rather than shades you pull down are a gimmick, they dont work, they only block 80% of light and they give off a blue green light, unlike the good old pull down shade that blocks everything 100%.

The cabin crew were pretty ordinary, they did just enough, never went beyond and stayed well planted in the galley, food ordinary, overall a disappointment.

But, on saying that, you have to accept this is what you pay for, so for me, I'll stick to the full service airlines like Cathay, SIA.

It was the our first time travelling on Scoot on Friday, 17/7 as SIA was fully booked, from Perth to Singapore. Based on that experience, NEVER AGAIN. Flight was delayed from 6.30pm to 10pm. Given a pathetic reason 'Hold up in Singapore'. Had to sit at Perth airport for six hours. After I posted my comment on your Facebook page, there was no reply to the many passengers that had to endure a long wait. No matter how cheap your flights are, you should still apologize. One would think that as part of SIA, you should still have some form of service. 

When I landed in Singapore, all I heard from friends and family was 'That's Scoot, always delay'. I hope people read this so they don't experience the same long delays and bad service as my husband and I did. I understand Jetstar Asia is better.

We are oldies who once again have great difficulty in fighting our way through online flight booking sites, and Scoot where no exception with usual minesites concealed along the way and the invisible prompts which  stop you dead in your tracks. After finally booking our business class seats to Hongkong from Perth, my wife rang up to clarify if we had done the right things. Lo and behold we find we have booked economy seats, so in rode our big white knight Mathew who painstakingly  went through it with us rebooked our seats meals etc and did a great job removing our stress and despair. The only catch was because we had booked meals, by upgrading to Business class we cant get a credit for those meals, but no probs as they give you a free meal anyway so we are very impessed with the customer service phone line it was excellent. Well done Mathew. We couldnt find anywhere on Scoot ste to send a thanyou note but soemone in Scoot might see this. So we are looking forward to see if the flight carries on with the same standard Mathew has set. Darryl WA.

PER-SIN-HKG SCOOT 777-200 9V-OTF  no both legs.

Aircraft well and truly showing age in the cabin. Tape holding parts of some seats together and I had a broken seat on both legs of the flight In general a very worn and tired cabin.

Paid for and selected specific seats in the 'Scoot in silence' section which appeared to be non-existant. 

The highlight was the attitude of and service provided by the cabin crew which couldn't be faulted.

With the pending entry into service of their new 787 aircraft it would seem to me that every expense has been spared by Scoot in maintaining a high standard of cabin in 9V-OTF.

Changed my flight from 4pm to 8am without proper notice. Their customer service was extremely rude and unwilling to offer any kind of help or possible solution. In all my years I have never experienced an airline this horrible. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this airline.

Bought a return ticket with Scoot from Taipei to Sydney, via Singapore. Didn't purchase Scoot-Thru add-on because I knew I wouldn't need to change my flights, my plans were fixed. Arrived on time and ultimately waited through an eight hour delay, took off just before midnight for a flight scheduled to leave at 3.30pm. That's annoying but these things happen. What was unfair was that I missed my Singapore connecting flight, also a Scoot flight, due to the delay (I had purchased as one Taipei-Sydney package from the Scoot website). Scoot washed their hands of me at Singapore airport, said they weren't liable and it wasn't their responsibility to put me on another flight. Gave me two McDonald's vouchers and sent me on my way. I had to buy another ticket with another carrier to complete my journey to Sydney, more than $1200. Scoot's partner insurance service ultimately compensated me $150. The return flight back to Taipei was also delayed by three hours, and they lost my bags. I wasn't expecting five-star service, but I had hoped that purchasing a Taipei-Sydney ticket would mean they would deliver me from Taipei to Sydney.

Flew Melbourne to Singapore on SCOOTBIZ and return on FlyBagEat.  SCOOTBIZ seats was OK, more leg space and width. Food on the MEL/Spore leg was passable although serving was small compared to normal economy food.  The return leg although not SCOOTBIZ was passable except for the prepaid food.  We had scrambled eggs and croisants.  The scrambled eggs was melted like pudding or jelly and the hashbrown was mushy.  If normal airlines can served proper scrambled eggs, there is no reason why SCOOT can't served prepaid proper scrambled eggs.  Perhaps it is because of the poor preparation by SCOOT crew.  The croisant was likely better, although it is still icy inside.  The answer from a Scoot stuff when questioned about the scrambled eggs was---"other passengers have also complained".  So much for their response to customers complaints.  

EDITORS COMMENT: Scoot are brilliant in every way except their food.. though I hear there have been some additions to the menu that are better.
Very poor communication. Need more reviews. Don't recommend. One flight. Just wanted to add my weight.  Thanks Afj

Flight was delayed five (5) hours Perth to Singapore. I was notified by TXT and email, no problem. Promise of $50 compensation voucher for delay over four (4) hours still in Scoot's bank because I don't have it.  Fly with them again? I don't know, Food bloody awful also. OK it's an economy airline but live up to your promises and don't play the passengers for idiots, Your livelihood - not mine!!

EDITORS COMMENT: It will come but it takes time. A refund generally takes 12 weeks. Food is terrible I agree but the airfare normally make up for this and you just eat before you leave.

Delay leaving Perth was ok, due to union disputes, but would have been nice to have a bit more of an update. Service on way to Singapore was good, minor hiccup with ScooTv codes that was sorted out. 

On way back completely different story. Flight delayed again due to undisclosed "Technical issue", no big deal. ScooTv access codes again an issue. Not sorted priot to take off (on ground, doors open) and finally told it was ground staff's fault 2 hours into the flight. Maybe if you worked that gem out before closing the doors when I asked the first time that would be awesome. 

Anyway, moving on. Partner was told twice that she couldn't use the toilets in ScootBiz, despite charging us close to $2k for the privilege of flying in ScootBiz. 

Terrible in-flight service. Not communication or training. Would have been better off flying Singapore Airlines Economy class for $600 less.

traveled from Perth to Singapore in  Business class,,  First leg on the 787.  A nice plane but why o why didn't they they install an entertainment system?  Flight on time and seating was reasonable, better than Economy any time.  Cabin crew were shown to be inexperienced and messed up food orders.  Wonder what they would act like in an emergency? Return flight delayed one and a half hours due to an instrument fault on the 777.  also gate changed without notice at check in, lucky it was gate E28 and not E 27.  Again cabin crew acted raw.  Limited drink menu and the food was poor quality.   Rated cabin crew as fair becuse they were willing but not trained or experenced.
EDITORS COMMENT: The in flight entertainment on the 787 is coming in the next few months

My daughter Grandaughter and myself travelled by Scoot from Hong Kong to Singapore, then Singapore to Perth.  As my daughter was wearing a moon boot for an ankle injury, when booking seats, the person booking us listed us for row 30 as he said this would offer my daughter extra leg space.  Sadly when we boarded and settled, suddenly staff started stressing about her sitting in that row with a protective boot...said it was a safetly issue, although could not define what safetly issue.  In desperation we paid to be moved into business class from Hong Kong to Singapore.  When we boarded that flight, same seats had been alloted, but again staff stressed about safety issues with my daughter sitting there.  Asked to pay to move to business class, no that was not an option...insisted she move before take off as if there were issues in take off she would not be able to run???  As they made the whole incident so embarrassing for her, she finally conceded to move as directed.  After take off my grandaughter and I insisted to be moved to be with her, which did occur.  However the staff member who insisted on the move,  Gra Shi Ting was rude  and offensive, telling my daughter she was disabled

First of all, I read that reviews about compensation and so on will not be published, but I consider this occasion as one that should be known if people consider to fly with Scoot.

I know you get what you pay for. In this case I didn't even get that. The ground staff denied me entry to the flight, based on the reason that I am "too late" (I was not. As were the 10 other people waiting in queue with me for over 20 minutes.).
The "24h English Help Hotline" is "not there for such discussions" (yes, this is a quote).
The support of Scoot didn't answer to my complaints on their hotline, their homepage, nor their Facebook page (which shows the complaint as read).

If you have the choice, chose another airline.
I fly at least 50 x per year. This is by far the worst airline i have ever used. They never respond to emails nor phone calls.

Bought flexibility option from singapore to sydney round trip. For the return leg, we wanted to fly on a later date. We followed their "quirky" instructions published in their website, which advised us to make changes online and take pictures of the changes (which was really weird). We proceeded to do so about 3 weeks before the original return date. Nearing our departure date, we found out that our return leg was reflected as "no-show". We immediately called to enquire, the call center could not help but asked us to send an email via their website. Be warned that they do not have reminder service for departures. Therefore, we did not know the change did not take effect. A reply email to inform that they would investigate, this was since late Feb 2015. They did not honor it and their customer service is really bad and rude. Its fruitless to follow their instructions to wait for their investigation result as to date, there was no response. Called the call center several times, their responses are scripted and are absolutely unhelpful if not untrue. Terrible. This was my first time travelling with Scoot and will be the last time. Avoid them as they will cause much grief.

Seats are tight, no entertainment except you pay to watch over your device using in airline wifi, airline charge for every little thing including phone charging and water, can't put arms on armrests as light push button on it and elbows press them when we rest our arms, leg room not enough for tall person, no blankets provided. Overall budget flight which cost almost same as others when we add basic needs like travel luggage.

First time Scoot flyer. Paid $30 extra in Bangkok for my luggage to travel direct to Gold Coast via Singapore. As told I went to  the transit lounge for my boarding pass for Singapore to the Gold Coast but was told I had not paid for that facility and would have to be processed through Singapore immigration and check in again. Never done this with any other airline flying transit before. Upon checking back in I was told my luggage was  not flying direct as paid for but it was off loaded and I should have collected it prior to being processed at immigration. Now I had to get customs clearance to go back to collect my luggage that by now was no longer on the carousel and had to go to lost luggage to find it. After spending nearly an hour waiting at lost luggage I was informed they had found it and as the normal proceedure was to collect it and pass through immigration again then check it back in and pass through security I was running out of time to make my connecting flight (I spent spent 2.5 hours of my 3 hour layover finding my lost luggage) out of time they said they would load it directly on the plane as paid for. I arrived on the Gold Coast and still no luggage, Still lost.

Terrible experience. Flew Singapore to Sydney, pre-booked wifi and selected seat and paid for. When I arrived the plane had been changed and I didnt have the selected seat or wifi. No email or update on the change and when I asked staff to be relocated and have wifi they said I would have to repay and contact the airline. I contacted the airline 2 weeks ago via submission form and no response. I called the airline and all 3 calls dropped out at exactly the same point in the pre-recorded message. Awful, awful customer service. On board staff were abrupt and drinks - even water was ridiculously expensive, $4 for a tiny half bottle for water. No water could be carried on board as we had to discard bottles before entering the departure area. No free water provided at all, which is a basic human right. I paid for wifi on board (for the second time) as I had work to do and the wifi didnt work at all for the entire flight. Still waiting for a refund on that too.

You get what you pay for. It is probably one of the better low cost carriers and is miles ahead of Tiger. The child free zone is excellent. The meals are inflexible, ie it's coke not diet coke or lemonade, it's coke. So much for being diabetic or not liking cola. A bit more flexibility would go a long way. Let the pax decide before he/she boards! The staff are friendly but do not know what the call button means; might as well remove it. The faux excitement is a bit much to stomach and even the crew don't seem to like it, especially when English is not their first language. And finally, while the women are well dressed the male flight attendants look as though they have escaped from a sports shoe store.

Since the booking process they try to scam you. You select no seat and no insurance, they still make you pay for the seats. You go back to check this out, and then, the insurance is automatically selected. It's a real struggle to manage to get your booking without any supplement. Having issues since the booking process doesn't look good for the company already.
Flights are OK, although food and entertainment are very bad. Seats are quite unconfortable, but OK for the price.

I travelled on Scoot from Sg to Perth with my four daughters.  On the way to Perth, the flight was delayed from 1310hrs to 1650hrs.  What was meant to be dinner with family turned into having them come pick us up from the airport at 2200hrs. Similarly on our return flight, another delay meant reaching Singapore not at 0010hrs but 0330hrs. While I fully understand that Scoot is a budget airline and delays can be expected, never did I dream it will be by this much and frequency.  No apology was made at Perth side, not at check nor onboard.  To say I was disappointed would be understatement.  The reason I chose to fly Scoot was the time offered to me and thinking it's a subsidiary of SIA, it should share some traits.  I have flown Scoot & Tiger before and was happy with it but this recent experience have left me jaded.

My flight was from Singapore to Melbourne, which is more than a 6 hour flight. For a flight of this duration I found it unacceptable that there were no inflight entertainment screens. On such a new plane at that! Even if you were willing to purchase entertainment, like I was, you would be out of luck! There were no USB ports to charge your own device should you wish to watch one of your own movies either! Water had to be purchased and was not made freely available like on other budget airlines I've flown, such as Jetstar and AirAsia. Cabin staff were just going through the motions! I was eagerly waiting for them to get to my row to buy some water, but when they finally got there, before I had a chance to ask for anything they had moved on right past me! Also, I'm pretty sure I heard them announce that eating your own food is not permitted on their flight. I'm not sure what you are meant to eat if you have not pre-ordered food, as there were no menus available and for all I could tell, there was no option to purchase any food on board. Although, this impression could be partly attributed to the poor service from the cabin staff. I would never fly scoot again!

Very bad, flight delayed by more than 21 hours. No proper communication.

Booked flight on 29-Nov-2016 from Singapore to Chennai. 

Flight rescheduled from 10:30 PM to 3:40 AM to 6:00 AM to 9 AM to 6 PM to 8:15 PM.

Flew PER- SIN 17/9 and return 24/9 .This was a very full night flight with lots of groups of men on a boys trip to the Formula 1. Hence, there was a lot of alcohol being consumed on this flight. Thumbs up to the Scootees telling the guys in front of us they had enough to drink! Was surprised there is quite good legroom in economy compared to other budget airlines. Better to pre order a meal if you like to eat, as pre -ordered meals come out first then it seems to take a long time for anyone else to get their meal. Don't order the ham & cheese croissant, it almost comes frozen, not a nice texture ! My son said the teriyaki chicken wrap was tasty and my husband liked his nasi lemak. The salad on the return flight home was a good serving size. Hint, there is a water fountain in the boarding lounge at Changi airport, take an empty water bottle with you and refill before your flight.  We had no in-flight entertainment, you did have the option of paying USD11.95 / hour for wifi...no thanks.  Overall they were quite good flights both ways, would probably fly them again but not too keen on the time you arrive in SIN, after 12AM by time you get through customs.  Got to hotel about 1.30AM.

Our first flight with Scoot and probably the last .. we submitted an upgrade for Scoot Biz which we received but the total lack of service and sub standard didnt make it enjoyable.  The food and beverage was worse than other airlines economy options and everything was about selling products to make more money ..  the welcome drink a plastic cup of water .. lunch in plastic container.. no tea or coffee offered... no wine available as out of stock.. you have to purchase wifi if you want to utilise... the crew did not speak to us just sat behind the curtain gossiping ... very poor experience Scoot...

Purchased window seating in Silence Section - paid extra for these seats.  Perth to Singapore no problems....Singapore to Perth - chaotic.  Upon arrival at Changi airport we were told the planes were changing but we had the same seats even though we originally had 8a and 8b but now we were 33a and 33b.  Upon boarding the plane we were taken into normal economy.  Yet at checkin we were assured we were in the same area and seats!  Staff tried to state this is what I had booked - thank goodness I had my printout and confirmation with me.  Eventually we were given a seat in the area, no window seat.  No apology.  No offer of the extra money we had paid - NOTHING!  Food is awful.  Service was non-existent.
Should be called Scat Airlines. 5 and a half hours late leaving Melbourne for Singapore, 2 and a half hours late returning.

We flew Gold Coast Australia to Singapore 2 days ago & had one of the best experiences in a long time. We paid a little extra to sit in the Quiet Zone which is rows 6-10 just behind Business Class. Comfortable seats with adequate leg-room. Attentive & pleasant flight attendants. Nice food & drinks & we were even able to pay in $AUD

Very poor customer service they do not take responsibility for any thing that goes wrong. If they fail to provide meals that have been pre ordered & paid for all you get is sorry. I f you do not get to sit in the seat you have chosen & paid for that's not their problem . Paid for inflight Wi-Fi that does not work you don't even get a sorry.  They are cheap but the service is cheaper..

Recommend taking Singaporean dollars with you and plenty of it if you plan on eating or drinking anything. They don't even offer a glass of water free. Zippo. The staff were friendly enough. 

EDITORS COMMENT: No it's a low cost carrier so they can charge for everything, that's why the actual airfare is a lot cheaper than a full service carrier.

Late take off at both Singapore and Sydney.
Business class would expect eyemask without paying.
No entertainment of flight fromSydney as aircraft not fitted with wifi yet.
One senior experienced cabin staf, the rest not up to her standard.
7 hour flight but i must choose my meal before we take off.
Will take SQ economy next time.

My confirmed booking from Bangkok to Singapore vanished into thin air. No assistance given to rectify the problem. Had to purchase another ticket at the counter for $300AUD and Scoot advises they will only refund $69AUD. Absolute theft and fraud. I will be doing everything in my power to see this airline buried where it belongs.

Scoot Airline is a sucker and not a budget airline. I am pregnant and I do not wish to fly and thus I ask them to change my name to my parent. I paid $800+ for the airfare. They are inconsiderate, they wanted me to provide medical certificate which is almost impossible to provide. I have checked with doctor and they couldnt give me the certificate as I aint having a diarrhoea or infectious disease. I would thought Scoot could grant me the changes with my reasons, but NO! For the last 8 hours, I receive the email from them with a link, outlining their rules etc. That has gone too far Scoot! You are a sucker, inconsiderate and bad sales service.

You have lose me and I will spread the bad things about you.

6/2/14 Sing Perth. Economy fare good value at very short notice (on web ) Food is still pretty dreadful so scoff up before boarding :) As android does not work with Scoot  bring a book or Snooze .Cabin Crew appear to be getting better every flight .Plane was clean  probably 70%full  yellow seats comfy so snoozed on way back.The deal maker with this sector is the arrival time into Perth  18.20 spot on time every time been with them .777 is also a big plus as block times faster than the airbus  alternatives and just feel better all round.Irrational perhaps but where 777 are on sectors try and get those is my prefered pick .Scoot web is still a dogs breakfast but good bang for buck .Inexperienced travellers really must study every weasel clause to avoid any disappointment .Reckon Parent is on a winner here with this sector at least

One of the worst airlines I have ever travelled with. On the 17th of July I had taken a flight from Singapore to Chennai. Flight No. F502 from Terminal 1. It was a 22.45 departure & we were already tired. We cleared the security check & boarded the flight. Before take off the captain announces a technical difficulty & we were offloaded & made to wait for 3 hrs. We had to go through the security check again & in the hand baggage they found us carrying a perfume bottle which they said they wouldn't let us carry as it was above 100 ml. However, they missed this one during their security check the first time. When requested, the security staff there, Selva Kumar, was really rude and got into an argument with us. When highlighted that the first time we were let go with the perfume in the hand baggage and the airline was at fault, he refused to take responsibility on behalf of the airline and bluntly said that he didn't care. Highly unprofessional, neither courteous nor empathetic. I am an Ex employee of Indigo airlines & he was teaching me airline rules.  He had the audacity to tell us that he would not let us take the flight. He refused to apologize & such staff need to be fired.

If you fly with scoot and you transit anywhere, you have to clear customs pick up your baggage and check in at every transit destination! Unless you pay $57 + $7.50 card charge for scoot though. Service is terrible as reviewed by others and you can't use the toilets.

EDITORS COMMENT: Yep that's another optional add on that low cost carriers offer. If you don't want the extra charges you do the bags yourself. Full service airlines with their higher fares include all this which is why they cost more and are referred to as 'all inclusive' airlines. not sure what you mean about not being bale to use the toilet? There's nine toilets on economy so shouldn't have been any problem.

I wish to register a complaint about your working symtem which, even right now, I am not sure if this mistake ocurred because of the Thai operation or the Japanese operation which caused a lot of inconvenience and the delay to get on board at gate at Narita Airport. Before boarding, there was an anouncement asking me to meet your staff at the gate. At the beginning she spoke to me politely and asked me to show my credit card that I used to purchase the ticket on Dec. 19 in Thailand which is a one-way ticket flying from Narita Airport to Donmeung Airport, Bangkok. She insisted it must be the card which the last four ending numbers are 0322 which is not the numbers on any of cards. She showed me the document which showed the recored mode of my payment XW Visa XXXXXXXXXXXX0119 0322 This confused me. She's not trying to understand or think logically that the last four numbers are 0119 and the numbers 0322 must be the numbers of something else which, at that time, I myself could no relate it with the expiration date of my card. She still kept insisting that it must be only the card with the four final numbers 0322 or else I had to buy a new ticket, and her tone was impolite as well her face most of the time that I tried the clear the situation and wondered whose fault it was that delayed my boarding. At that moment, I had a very bad cold and felt so dizzzy that I could not deal with the situation perfectly and did not think of asking to see the manager about the mistake and almost caused me to buy a new ticket and wasted the money that I purchased the ticket in Thailand. Anyway, she finally called someone to check about my purchase and luckily I showed her the documents I was holding with me which showed the last final four number 0119 and the ticket was confirmed. I would appreciate it if you would look into the matter and make sure that this will not recur to any other customers, especially if a customer cannot communicate in English. This caused me a very bad impression which I will convey to my colleagues at the universiy in Bangkok as well my students in my English courses. Today, you have to compete with the other two airlines: Air AsiaX and Thai Lion Air. I didn't look at the name on her shirt, so I can't give you the name of that staff dealing with me on that day. My flight was XW 101 dated Jan. 2, 2019 departing Narita at 13.55 and I'm an English instructor at a university in Bkk. Thank God she finally figured out that 0322 is the expiration number.

I travelled on the new A320 from SIN to TRV and returned recently. It was a really no frills airline down to the bone airline.

 My old school bus seat had better cushioning for a 4 hours flight. I could feel the seat metal frame on my back and bum.

 The airline should understand sometimes value for money should not be at the expense of basic comfort. My bones were aching the next day after the flight.

Just like to feedback that this was our first time on Scoot from Singapore to Melbourne, dep. -13 Nov & return 21 Nov. WE generally found flight stewardess services very good. As I was not familiar with the on-line booking, we only used less than half of the total weight (i.e. only about 48kgs) to and fro.
Prior to our dep. Melbourne, a pre-check on our weighing scale indicate over-weight as the weighing scale used was accidentally set on the unit of pounds instead of kilograms. As such, I had to call to increase my check-in luggage by another 20kgs on 20 Nov and paid S$58/- extra. 
Appreciate if you could kindly perform a check on your system and WE would be very glad to receive any re-fund as explained above. Have a great & blessed day & weeks ahead.

B/Regards
Capt. Tan KH

We took a returned flight Scoot from Singapore to Perth on 3rd Jan and it was a full flight. The services provided by the service staff were really poor. When get onboard the staff greeted us with no smile (probably they felt sorry going back to work after the public holiday). We travelled with Scoot every year and could tell the services provided by the staff were going downhill. Whe Scoot first started to fly out of Perth, services were excellent, gradually the standard drops every year.
