Apparently, we were not allow web check in in Singapore when our booking was from Perth. This was told by one of the rude staff from the call centre. It's very disappointing to see such a good reputable airline like your with rude staff.

My opinipn is that Scoot is probably ok but in would suggest having a connecting flight. Purely because of a tendency gor delays. Of u do have a connecting flight, suggest book a day after scheduled arrival.

How does Scoot customer service works:

- Redirect you to 3rd party - you will be in loop.
- They will harass by asking more & more info or put you on hold for long time or/and disconnect your call
- They will tell your problem is escalated and someone will call in 24hrs but no one will call.
- When you call back after 24 hours they will tell nothing is escalated. 
- If you tell them you want to speak to the same customer service staff that you previously discussed or you want to talk to supervisor, they will tell they are busy.
- When you call back after 24 hours then you have to explain the whole problem from starting and one of the above will happen.
- You can lodge inquiry in there website and if you give follow up call then one of the above will happen.
- And they will lie easily and make false promise or play delay tactics.

Worst airline in my 25 years flying. 
They do not have staff at the airport (either Singapore or anywhere else!).
They take your money - but then do not refund it when they cancel their flights.
I am so sorry I chose them. If someone avoids this horrible company because of my review - I will be happy. Learn from my mistake.

First time flew with Scoot in December 2015 with my daughter from Melbourne to Singapore. Comfortable and spacious.
Second time around flew from Melbourne to Singapore on the 2nd July and vice versa on the 11th July, can't fault this airline at all. Had my cousin with me for the return flight. She wasn't sure about this airline but she was amazed too and said the plane was all white and looks spacious enough and the seat was comfortable too.
Overall, well done Scoot. I'll be flying again on the 13th October for my cousin's wedding and can't wait for it.

This airline doesn't let you bring your own food or drinks onboard. Once I got on, I tried to buy some water, as they don't give it out for free. I was on my way from Singapore to Melbourne (Australia), so I tried to pay using Australian coins. The flight attendant wouldn't accept coins. I had a US$100 note, so tried that. She said $100 was too big a note. I tried my Visa cards, but they wouldn't accept debit cards.

"So there's no way I can get water on this flight?"

Flight attendant smiled and said, "Sorry."

The flight was 7.5 hours long. Don't fly with this company.

I flew on scoot from gold coast to Singapore. I am disappointed that the seats are soooo uncomfortable. I in fact travelled on the extra legroom seats, still ended up with a back pain as the seat has very little padding and the handles are extremely cheap plastic. To make it worse some idiot deviced the buttons for lights and attendants on the handles. So people were constantly pressing them accidentally, so there is a light show and the attendant button being randomly pressed. I think even the flight attendants are irritated with this as they have to constantly come and tell people please cancel it as you accidentally pressed it. 
The most ridiculous thing is they don't even offer water free of charge! This is a 8.5 hour flight. Where are the human rights? Will they charge for air next?  I think this should not be legally allowed. Even a cheap domestic flight where you pay under $50 sometimes gives water free of charge. A small 200 ml water is $4.00. What if someone is not carrying money and does not have a credit card? I think it is inhumane not to give water on a 8.5 hour flight. Will never travel again. It is definitely not value for money. 
EDITORS COMMENT: Whilst we don't agree with no free water, the fact is that they are a low cost carrier and therefore they can charge for these things- majority of low cost carriers do. There is a reason that you booked this flight over Singapore Airlines or Qantas, the cost. Full service airlines include everything but on a low cost carrier you do compromise in flight product for a cheaper fare. Scoot are actually one of the most comfortable low cost carriers as they use twin aisle aircraft rather than single.

Denied boarding me saying unvaccinated can't travel to Philippines in spite of meeting the Philippines requirement supported by the Philippines Government proof of these requirements, beside having 2 months visa, Scoot Supervisor said "but I'll leave a note at the system to help you get the refund"
I Complained to the customer support over the phone, she couldn't explain what happened saying we need to escalate this matter, and cut the line without giving me a complaint reference number,
in another contact I found out that I've been tagged as "NO-Show"!!
They damaged my holiday plan!!...
NO TRUST TRAVELLING WITH THEM ANYMORE

Paid 600 for SCOOT from Sydney to Sing with meal included but then when on board they didnt give me meal stating it was not in the bill. They can see clearly from the bill that i have paid extra 17 dollar for meal but decline to give me any food due to their inflexible and poor service, which leads to my decrease in health as i have very bad health already and the flight was 8 hours. 
They told me to claim the money back when on board however when ask service desk she seems to not care and say nothing can be done, told me to call centre. It took more than two hours to reach them due to my experience hence i gave them the money and told them they just lost their customers, the service lady doesn't care either. 
Additionally i purchased extra kg for luggage and then my partner who traveled with me  exceed his luggage and the staff didnt tell us we could transfer kg which leads to extra charges (400$ to be exact). However after a long complain we finally have a right charge (50$) but took lots of effort and time.
To conclude, scoot was the worst flight service i've ever flew with due to their tricky of making money from people and i advise people NOT to book with SCOOT.

Travelled from Singapore to Melbourne on 2nd May 2016 and I can't fault Scoop.  We checked in 6 hours before departure and all of the staff were so helpful.  They took our luggage and provided me with a wheelchair, (which I hadn't requested), but the check-in assistant knew that I had a problem, and she went so out of her way to get a wheelchair for me.  I just cannot recommend Scoot enough for future travellers.  You certainly get more than you pay for.  Very well done Scoot.  I was very very impressed.

We flew with Scoot for the first time and were pleasantly surprised.
After reading some of the reviews, we were abit apprehensive however all was good.
If you remember it is a budget airline and some people expect too much. 
We were on time and the staff were efficient and friendly and the journey was very comfortable.
We will definitely fly Scoot again.

777 Sing Perth 12/12/13
Seats ok for the sector   Pre ordered food better than expected  left on time arrived 12 minutes early  CEO was on flight doing PR walk about etc Cabin staff  happy but obviously new at the job so to speak .Safety briefing met all criteria . Cabin clean  ,as were toilets  Plane pretty full in Cattle class .This mob Scoot I feel is a real winner for Pertyh as Leaves Sing and arrives in Perth at a  decent time .Price wise great bang for buck   Thus have just booked 6 more sectors out of Perth to Asian ports  with scoot  Next Flight 14/1/14 will try ScootBiz  Per Sing -Sing BKK

I paid for a meal when I booked which comes with a can of coke because I am a diabetic I asked for a can of zero coke instead of coke (same cost for airline to purchase) I was told I had to pay for zero coke I did say begrudgingly that I would pay for zero coke but they never ever brought it to me.  Then asked for  a white coffee it came with sugar in it, and I said I wanted a white coffee without sugar and they said white coffee comes with sugar in it (never heard this in all my life).  They then brought me a black coffee which I had to pay for.  I never had the coke which was paid for when I booked a meal and they then charged me for a black coffee.  Never again not the best on a flight when you can't have a decent drink

Very poor customer service from scoot. My flight was delayed by 3 hrs for Perth to spore the zipper of my bag was damaged and I was unable get anyone in scoot in spite of calling numerous times - always on hold due to ' high volume of calls'. Finally emailed them on return to PERTH as it was a short visit relatives trip, and reced an email saying I should have reported damage before leaving the airport and that my case has been closed! . Do passengers open their bags at airports? And at 4.30am in the morning after a 3 hr delay??

Singapore to Sydney 3rd Jan 17

Bid to upgrade to Scoot business and bid accepted by email and Visa charged bid amount. Yippy!!

Arrived at airport to find flight delayed by approx 3 hours (4.14am) yuk.

When finally check in advised that the type of plane has changed and has fewer Business Class seats so we are bumped back to economy- yukkkk!  Not happy and money already taken.

The flight staff & Captain do their best to make all who are bumped to economy feel good , which was the only positive. We get a free meal/ wine and TV so at least they tried for something which was not their fault do well done to the crew.

Never the less, contacted Scoot on arrival home to see when we would be repaid our Business Class 'bid' fare and told it would take 3 weeks - well 3 weeks has passed and no payment so just crossing my fingers& legs and hope it comes soon.

I love the Dreamliner plane and will fly Scoot again,

EDITORS COMMENT: Thanks for your balanced and informative review. Too often people focus on whats gone wrong rather than how the airline tried to help when something unplanned did happen. You will get the refund - many airlines take 12 weeks so if you get it in three to four then that's actually very good.
Rescheduling, Refunding.. Even contacting scoot customer care is really difficult. Calls never connect. Low cost airlines with very cheap service.

Sydney to Singapore return. The staff were friendly, the food was good, on time both ways. The seats are uncomfortable and I would recommend taking a cushion and a pillow if you want to sleep.   The value is good.

I travelled from Sydney to Singapore on Scoot in May 2013.  Flight left and arrived on time.  We had paid an extra $25 to choose a 2 seater at the back of the plane.  The first row after the 3 seaters stopped and we were disappointed to find it had a fixed arm rest.  The rest of the two seaters behind did not.  I would avoid this seat if travelling with a companion. 

I have flown with Air Asia several times and certainly find their seats more comfortable.  The scoot seat was really hard.  

Cabin crew were good but food was quite poor.  Still the flight in under 8 hours so it is not a big deal. 

I would not fly with them for an overnight flight but the day flight was good for the price.

I had booked two Scoot business seats Hong Kong to Singapore in May 2016 and a further two business seats Singapore to Perth. Scoot had neglected their duties to inform us that they no longer fly out of Hong Kong and placed us on a Tiger Air flight leaving Hong Kong on the 13 Jan 2017. We were not informed of this change until late Dec 2016. I tried to seek clarification and compensation for the price variation between economy Tiger Air and Scoot business. Clearly there is a huge difference in what we paid for and what we received. The call center could not assist us due to their computers crashing at the time. At Singapore Airport Scoot could not assist with our situation eithger. I rang today 25/01/2017 to seek compensation for the price we paid for Scoot Business and the Tiger Air flight we both experienced. I was told by the Scoot call center they could not assist. Too bad! Scoot does not have a complaint section other than the ineffective call center to resolve a simple issue of compensation. Singapore Airlines as the parent company should take some ownership of complaints regarding Scoot. No one seems to care. I would not recommend Scoot to anyone.

Scoot business was very poor. TV service was broken both routes,so noentertainment for 2 seven hour journeys. Staff English was poor, food was poor to average. Overall a bad experience. Qantas economy is better than Scoot biz. Recommend you avoid this airline if you want comfort and service.

Very cheap price for a flight from Singapore to Melbourne. I actually missed my flight and showed up  a day later (my mistake) and the Scoot ground crew was very helpful and put me on another flight with a small charge. Flight was great, airplane was almost brand new. Great and affordable airline. Will fly again for sure!

We found Scoot to our liking for the Perth to Singapore and return trip mid-January, the only downside to not having Airline Controlled Entertainment was that the man in the aisle seat of row 10 was watching a pornographic video on his IPad, as such anyone walking past from the rear of the aircraft got an eyeful, unfortunately you can't select the type of person you have to fly with!

Retruned Sing. to Gold Coast TZ7 dep. 23rd Dec. After a long walk to gate w were first there, one hour or so later after clearing security waited for boarding call, then the poor Scoot flight Manager had to to inform us that we had to go to gate E27 some several hundred metres back up. I'm in my 70's and had carry on so the quick hike back up was exhausting and by the time I arrived there I was nearly last in the queue to security check again. I need to please ask that some consideration be given to offering free water at least on these longer flights, I was quite severely dehydrated and the small bottle of water at $4 was outrageous. I appreciate the fare is budget so didn't expect much but these issues really spoiled my experience with Scoot. Love SQ which I've used many times over  the years I was in business. A little sad some of their experience hasn't shown on the airline.

My wife and kids flight was delayed in first segment. So they missed connectinting flight. 
They gave her a flight 24 hrs later. And now the second flight is delayed by 5.5 hours. 
Thats 30 hrs delay on one flight. 
Beyond ridiculous...

Ordered meals when I booked, when I got on board advised "that I had cancelled them",  I didn't do this and had still been charged.  Paid an extra $79.00 AUD x 2 for extra legroom and seating allocation, got on board and had been moved.  When I questioned that we had paid extra for extra seating staff just advised that the seats had been double booked.  When I wrote to Scoot was only offered $50 Singapore dollars per passenger (I paid equivalent to $82 Singapore Dollars for seat allocation)  This was not offered as a refund but a "voucher" to use when travelling on Scoot again.  No money was given for back for the meals not provided (ended up buying them again on board as my son was starving)....  Whilst I understand problems happen, Scoot has offered no 'refund" just a voucher towards any future bookings.    I won't be travelling on Scoot.  You can pay and book for something and not have it delivered.  In anyone's language, that is not only dishonest, but just wrong.

wow dream liners from DMK to sin! 
everyone was super excited. To our dismay,  once we stepped into the cabin. food / body odor was overwhelming. babies cries toddler wailing. was wondering if I'm boarding a plane or walking to a child care center. seat was super slim and can't even recline . I'm not saying 180deg here. due to the poor air ventilation & lighting, migraine hit me after 15mins of flight.  plane looked super old and smell dusty. I was sneezing through out...:(( we took this flight 19/03 TZ301.

The first time I â€œenjoyedâ€ such a BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE with Scoot Airlines. Never return to book the flight with this again. I donâ€™t think when you would like to have an relax holiday you book this Scoot.

They suck! I flew with business, plane got cancelled for 1 night due to engineering problem, staff didn't treat you well especially in Gold Coast airport. The next morning, it was delayed for more than 2 hours. They don't give any solution at all, just plain sorry. Un-freaking-believable! It's better to fly with other plane next time.

When you Scoot and pay for your ticket, check that you are not double charge, i pay via Poli and was prompt that it has insufficient time to pay via Westpac and the next screen appear is via Credit Card, as i need to fly out. Input my Credit Card detail which is $10 more for whatever charge they put ut there, and that it, my ticket was confirm and email confirmation was sent to me, and when i login to my westpac account. Was shocked to see that my echoice was charge and credit card too. Call Scoot Hotline immediately , and confirm that credit card was charge but they could not confirm Poli payment was deducted, and was directed to login to Scoot to lodge a report, and was prompt that it will take 10 days for Scoot to investigate, multiple call and email, and into 1 month today, no reply and call from Scoot, when you call Hotline, they say it the account dept, and they even go to the extend to claim that no lodgement was lodge and i press further for info, all detail was review i their CRM. Wonder how many has double bill and give up as westpac ask lot of detail and wants full report to rebut the charge even when they can see it charge on both account from westpac. Suppose save but.

Just flown in from Singapore to Melbourne on Big Yella Fella TZ22. Flew in economy good seat width and pitch, snooze kit purchased for $15 was fine and served the purpose. The Scootees were tireless and did a great job throughout the flight. In fact the only issue on both the Scoot flights was the high level of demanding whining customers. Get a grip people this is a no frills budget airline where you only pay for what you order and don't hassle the Scootees because your expectations don't match the little amount of money that you paid. Saved over $900 on round trip for 3 adults on Scoot, agreeable schedule Melbourne Singapore route. So Scoot you now have my business from your parent airline. Campbell Wilson please pass on my regards to your outstanding flight crew on TZ22 January 14 from the family in row 31 middle seats.

EDITORS COMMENT: Couldn't agree with you more!!
Good experience! On time, nice plane and cheap. Only suggestion would be for staff to wait a second if you want to order food/drink.

Took a flight between HK and S'pore with Scoot on Nov. As an introvert man, I don't think that they have a poor attitude (I only care if it's safe and have no disgusting meals; if they're rude, I won't talk a xxxk with them). Didn't go for web check. No call center involved. No delays. As an LCC, it's usual that F&B should be paid, and I don't find that some criticisms towards this airlines sound. At least not the worst airline I've encountered. The meal (nasi lemak, otak-otak and a can of green tea) is okay. The only unsatisfied part is that I have to ask a crew member to get my immigration card in my flight to S'pore .
EDITORS COMMENT: They are a very good airline for a low cost carrier. IN fact we awarded them our best low cost airline asia pacific award in the last two years.

NEVER fly with scoot. I booked a ticket almost 1.5 years ago (the flight was April 2015, I was physically unable to fly anymore with 3 medical certificates/letters clearly explaining why I could not fly.. contact them again in October 2016 asking them whats going on they said they sent me a voucher. Never got it, I checked ALL my inbox's so I asked them to re send, they did, tried to book a ticket. What do you know it's expired!! I have been emailing them ever since. They say "needs to go to headquarters to be approved" been hearing this since day 1! . it is now December 13th and I'm on the phone telling them to send me a NEW voucher so I can spend my $700 that I paid them on something useful. Now they are telling me the voucher re newal needs to be approved. I am not leaving the phone until this is 100% sorted tonight! This is a joke and I will NEVER fly with scoot (other than getting what I already paid for back) I will also tell EVERYONE I know to NEVER fly with scoot.

In my opinion, Scoot is one of the best low-cost carriers in SE Asia. Little sister to Singapore Airlines, they deliver a diluted version of a five-star airline to the budget-conscious traveller. The seats are just fine, and the legroom is better than on most budget airlines. Definitely my airline of choice in SE Asia.

Our flight left 5 hours late with no notification until check-in, which meant we missed our following long-haul flight and had to re-book everything from scratch.
Total waste of time and money, not to mention the amount of stress they caused. Never travelling with them again.

We booked Melb/Sing some months before we travelled so cost was very cheap  We travelled on 787 planes which were very good
On way up we accepted offer of extra seat for $50 and this was good value
On return trip we bid for upgrade to business class and got this  Again this was very good as flight was during night  Compared to Aust discount airlines Scoot was very good but it may have been because of the 787 planes used  I certainly got the impression Scoot would charge for everything possible   They carefully weighed all cabin baggage to see it complied and I gather this will be standard practice on all Scoot flights 
 I certainly would be happy to use Scoot in the future [provided price is acceptable] mainly because of their use of 787 planes  Compared to the old hand me down planes  used by other Aust discount airlines it was a joy to travel in such high class planes and to me this places Scoot in a premium class compared to other discount airlines and the older equipment used by them

I have not seen such a poor customer service before. I was flying to Singapore from Gold Coast. My friend and I had some food with us. My friend is vegan, and there was nothing for her in their menu. Also, the food they offer generally seemed pretty boring and expensive for us. A stewardess came to us immediately after boarding, and said that we are not allowed to consume our own food on board, we need to buy food from them! She was very unfriendly, did not smile at all, and literally started a discussion with us. We explained that my friend is vegan and that there is nothing suitable on the menu. After a 10-minute discussion she said she will make an exception for us and allow us to eat our food. She also said that apparently it is her job to make us follow such rules. Well, even if that is really true, I don't want to know who creates those rules. I have not seen such cheekiness in my entire life. I am also wondering if her boss has also told her to be so unfriendly with customers. I was shocked by their service and it definitely spoiled my mood. Never again.

We flew from Hong Kong to Perth with connection in Singapore. We chose this flight due to the booking stating that we would not have to recheck in baggage in the connection like some of the other flights available, so when we arrived at Check-In and were asked to pay an additional fee to ensure this we were not very happy. I went through my booking confirmations with eDreams and Scoot but could find no mention of Scoot-Thru. When we attempt to explain this or speak to a supervisor, we were either flat-out ignored or told it was too early for anyone else to be here that could help. We paid the additional charge. After we took off, I asked for a glass of water but apparently with Scoot they do not offer any free drinking water, only sell bottles of water and I would have to wait until the trolley comes past. I understand that on a budget airline drinks and snacks would need to be purchased, but not to offer water on a 5hour flight is ridiculous, and to deny someone water because the trolley had not made it to their row was quite shocking as I was rejected again when I asked for water from the galley (willing to pay). Finally, the seats were cramped with zero neck support or comfort.

EDITORS COMMENT: Most low cost carriers don't provide free water - not something we agree with but they are well within their rights not to. No low cost airline (Jetstar, Scoot, Airasia) on that five hour route offers free water. 
Scoot thoo needs to be made more clear.

BER-SIN-BKK on 08/26/2022
 (booked in April, â‚¬346 return)

 At BER, 5+1 check-in counters were open, it went pretty quickly.
 Boarding began at 09:10 and at 09:55 the aircraft was moving towards the runway.  Start was at 10:16 am.

 The seats in the EC are sufficiently spaced, the internationally customary distance, the backrests of the seats can be tilted backwards and the headrests can be pushed up and down and adjusted on the sides.
 There is no multimedia offering on the seats.

 Immediately after takeoff, the plane is cooled down extremely, you can't switch anything off.

 A can of Coke, 320ml, costs 4 Singapore dollars.  Credit card and cash are accepted, change is given in SGD.  Sometimes, even at night, a cart comes through and drinks and food are sold.  Then the festive lighting goes on everywhere for about 30 minutes.

 The flight to SIN was on time and perfect except for the temperature.
 The SIN-BKK plane has very tight seating, at least 5-10 cm less legroom than on long-haul routes, no headrests, backrests cannot be adjusted, no multimedia offerings.  But not as cold as the first plane.

From Bangkok to Gold Coast via Singapore 10/4/15. Myself my wife and baby arrived at Don Muang Airport after a 5 hour car journey(usually 2.5 Hours) 5 mins late for check in to be greeted by staff (Nok Air/ Scoot) who were laughing at people who missed the flight due to bad traffic (Thai New Year) . When I inquired about procedure for missing a flight we were directed to another desk. Upon arriving, they said that because they just represented Scoot there was nothing they could do to help. Then we were directed to the Nok Scoot bookings office. Once there I explained to staff what had happened and immediately informed that there was no other flights for that day or the next without even checking computer. Then after some discussion he checked the itinerary and found a flight to Singapore the next day for 780 USD for 2.5 people. I asked to see the details and immediately realised it would mean we missed our connecting flight to Gold Coast. When I pointed this out the guy just smiled and laughed and told me I would need to buy another ticket. Ended up booking AirAsia. Travelling with an 18 month old is difficult enough without having smug unhelpful staff rubbing your nose in it! :-(
Flew from Taiwan to Tokyo. Great airline but very early start. Was impressed with leg room and service for a budget airline.
The first time with Scoot and will be the last time. Worst service ever.

Flew home from Hong Kong via Singapore - arrived 2 in the morning and sought out the Scoot desk to purchase a 'scoot on' so that my checked bag would not have to be collected by me but would be forwarded on to Melbourne per my next flight.  They advertise $20 for this service but charged me $40.  Arrived in Melbourne and no bag.  I was flying out the following day - still no bag.  The contact number they gave me is often 'unattended' so calling to catch up and get an update is difficult. No offer of compensation and uncomfortable stay in Melbourne with no toiletries or clean clothes.  Three days later they say they have found my bag - spoke to a contact person and asked that they forward to Devonport airport and have it couriered to my home per the address on the tag.  They leave a message on my phone saying they are sending the bag to Hobart - 10 hour round trip drive from my home and the furthest airport they could select in Tasmania - and that they would not be couriering it to me and that it was my problem to collect it.  Left two messages regarding this to try and stop them sending it to Hobart - no response.Staff rude and unhelpful. Food crap. No entertainment.  

EDITORS COMMENT: The fly through bag option is cheaper is you pre-purchase it online at the time of booking. There is in flight entertainment but you need to bring your own personal device and pay a fee in most cases which is to be expected on a low cost carrier. 
The bag really should have been couriered to your house and we are not sure why it was not.

Before  my return trip last week I would have rated Scoot as 10, great value for money. However after a serious accident in Malaysia & needing to return to Australia urgently I went to Scoot Changi at midday explained the situation & asked if I  could get on a flight back that night Tuesday rather than the one I had booked on Thursday (I knew I would not recover any money back). Their answer yes for $750. The most I have seen for the Gold Coast - Singapore leg has been around $380-400 either way, in fact my total return trip with larger seats, meals, 20kg luggage, lounge in Changi was $520. I said that this seemed unreasonable, & especially so as I know that they resold the seat I had booked. They said the high cost was due to a nearly full flight & due to my urgency to get back to hospital I was forced to pay what they asked. On the flight there were still quite a few empty seats available!

I booked online, and wanted to travel with Scoot Perth - Hong Kong, it wasn't until I got to Singapore I realised I was travelling Tigerair for the Singapore - Hong Kong let.  First "Jellyfish", if I wanted to travel Tigerair, I would have booked Tigerair.
I booked and paid for Meals, and when I boarded my flight Scoot advised, that I had not.  When I got to Hong KOng and looked at my booking, I had paid for meals.
I also paid for seat allocation $19 AUD per sector, but was charged $48.00 per sector.  This I should have picked up when paying, but to be honest, I dropped out of their website, and was so frustrated with the software package that Scoot uses, I was about to give up and not book at all.  I went to Scoot Desk in Singapore to advise that no meal was provided, they said we didn't pay.  I also advised that the seat allocation had been dropped off their system, after I paid extra (as I was travelling with my son, I wanted to sit next to him).  I have now been on the phone holding for 40mins and speaking for over 30 mins to try to sort this mess out.  Scoot is understaffed.  And this definitely wasn't a cheap ticket.  2566 AUD return for 2 persons Perth-HKG-Per

I was promised that I would be rreimbursed the full taxi fare for having to get a taxi home from the airport at midnight after a flight was cancelled. It has been a month since then and despite numerous calls to Scoot, being on hold for up to an hour, an email and online claim, unable had no resolution and no reimbursement. The taxi cost $157.24 and after Scoot originally promising they would reimburse the whole fare, they then tried to tell me I would only get $50 per person on the ticket. Now I'm being told we will only be reimbursed $50 total despite the two guest living in different suburbs.

Travelled Scootbiz Syd-Sin 27/2, Sin-Syd 15/2, don't expect 5 star more like premium economy. The plane was a Boeing 787 that was relatively quiet, the seats well although the base and back were comfortable the 'leg rest' was not well designed. It did not extend out far which in my case allowed my legs to hang perched on the hard edge which was uncomfortable and unusable  in a short time. A fold out ledge would have improved the seat considerably. The meal was adequate much like food hall Asian. the website was very flaky as I was unable to select my meal as was proposed. An OK flight. The flight attendants were always on the move.

My husband & I flew Scoot (aircraft type B772) from Sydney-Singapore on a recent trip to Colombo.  

Our whole experience with Scoot was very positive: it was a very good value for money flight which was on-time, the seats were comfortable & the in-flight service was excellent.  There was even some unusual & fun entertainment in the form of interactive games on board thrown together by the friendly cabin crew.  

We were especially impressed by the flight's chief steward, Geoffrey Goh (I think was his name) we especially appreciated his help in getting us organised to disembark first in order to catch our connecting flight.

Avoid Scoot, don't fly Singapore if the connector airline is Scoot! As a frequent flyer to Asia, I have flown Singapore Airlines ever since 1994, and have been delighted. But, since they pass Scoot Airlines is owned by them, I say, avoid Singapore Airlines at all cost. Scoot Airlines agents (not wearing any name tags)and its call center are shockingly unprofessional, heartless, untrustworthy, sceaming, lacking of common sense or courtesy, and a disgrace to the once proud Singapore brand. My wife was at Clark Airport near Angeles City in the Philippines, trying to take a short flight to Singapore so that she could connect with the flight back home to San Francisco. Scoot Airline personnel would not let her board her flight, without paying 90 dollars for a "mysterious" and spurious cancellation fee. She never cancelled. The agent had issued the tickets, there wasn't any rescheduling, but, they insisted. This was a scam to get her to pay them 90 more than likely. She did not have the money, she had spent all of her money on family in the Philippines. We are both servents of society, I was a teacher for 21-years of troubled high school students, she is a cna. We have three daughters, one being in University, money is tight. She cried, and pleaded, but, they didn't care. Why would she show up at airport if she cancelled? You can't just cancel a roundtrip, you must reschedule, or there would be flags and notifications everywhere. The flight from Singapore was still valid, and they didn't know of any cancellation. Spent two hours on a conference call with our ticketing agent and Scoot call-center. They kept saying there was a charge, but for what, there never was a cancellation. Even the manager couldn't do anything. He said that I had to write an email to the sales department, can't call, and await response! My wife is supposed to be at work. The hell they care! Don't fly Scoot or Singapore Airlines!

Ive flown scoot from the beginning,its a budget airline ,it gets you there
I have no complaints
lets face it, on a scoot flight it does the 3 things I need
The plane takes off
The plane flys
And the plane lands where they said it will land
Its a safe flight
I would recommend this airline to anyone

I flew Scoot return from SYD-SIN in July/August 2012. The seats are not quite a comfortable as Air Asia but the food was as good and the entertainment is better. Both flights departed and arrived on time and the convenience of flying directly into Singapore was worth the slightly less comfortable seating. I flew Air Asia to Singapore in February 2012  and ended up spending six hours in KL's LCCT due to various delays. I'll be flying Scoot to Singapore again in October this year.

I really enjoyed our flight from Singapore to Perth I travelled 14th July 2015. Congratulations on your staff and crew a happy group nothing was too much trouble.  Spotless toilets throughout the journey. Would not hesitate to recommend this airline.

Well done scoot you exceeded my expectations - had a great flight from Melbourne to Singapore today - great value - excellent staff - efficient and quick check in and boarding - I will definately fly Scootbiz again

Please see TripAdvisor for full account of story, 200 word limit impedes my ability to accurately describe how I was treated. 

I was sick on the plane. Tried to move over to a more empty row to quarantine myself from the other passengers and to be closer to the bathroom. The seats on that row cost the same as the seat I paid for (I paid for an upgrade). 1 staff member rudely asked me to move. When I explained I was sick she didnâ€™t believe me and demanded I list all my symptoms in front of the other passengers. I was humiliated. I felt bullied by this staff member and am reluctant to recommend an airline who condones such behaviour.

My worst experience ever.. delayed for 3 hours for a flight from Singapore to Sydney on the 19th Dec 2015. Worst still, the departure room service staff (a male Indian) was very impolite and rude in answering my concerns. What happen to the Singapore Airline reputation? If Scoot airline is managed and chosen by SQ, why such poor service?

Flights from Perth to Singapore and return:  Very smooth (The dreamliner is an amazing aircraft)
Food: Don't bother with the prepurchase - take your own, especially water. Meal drinks are either coke or an iced tea.
Seats: the light switch is annoyingly activated everytime you reposition your arm and the recline function is not easy to use. Take a cushion.
Toilets and carpetry: Not well maintained.
Extra-legroom seats (behind the bulkhead in the middle of the plane): passengers who purchase these have the right to refuse to let anyone past who wants to use the toilets on the other side of the plane. If the service trolley is in use you must wait until you can walk completely up the other aisle to return to your seat.
Cabin Crew: polite and friendly but will try to upsell everything.
Its a budget carrier so you get what you pay for but you fly the Dreamliner.

It was the our first time travelling on Scoot from Perth to Singapore and return. Based on that experience, NEVER AGAIN. I had paid extra to select our seats. It was at the boarding gate just before I went to board that I noticed that our boarding tickets had a different seat number to that which I had selected on my original booking. At no time did anyone from Scoot inform me that my original seat selection had been changed.I have personal reasons for wanting to select the seats that I selected (close to the front of the plane, but given seats at the rear of the plane), so was happy to pay extra for this, otherwise I would have not bothered to select the seat option for the booking.
Also the flight was delayed by 2 hours.
Return fight no better. Boarded plane and was seated only to be told to get off due to plane mechanical issue and wait more than 3 hours for a replacement plane.
We have flown with many other budget airlines and never had problems.
Based on our experience I can NOT RECOMMEND Scoot Airlines.

With our first trip in Asia, we thought we would take advantage of the discounted airlines in the region with Scoot. $500 round trip from Tokyo to Taipei for a family of four, was a steal and at the same time, too good to be true, we found out the hard way. 

Here's the good, the bad, and the ugly:

Good: Service on the plane was decent, attendants treated us with good manners and respect, responded to requests promptly, and was generally very accommodating to the passengers. 

Bad: Plane delayed for 8 hrs at Narita, since Scoot didn't have arrangements with other airlines and we didn't receive the notification email before arriving, we had to sit at the check-in area for 4 hours before being allowed to go through security where we spent an additional 5 hours. Flight was scheduled for 7pm departure but by 6:45pm, the plane was nowhere to be seen, they literally change the departure time at 7pm, very poorly communicated. Meal vouchers were provided, which was a slight plus. 

Ugly: Because Scoot uses one plane to fly through 4 different routes (Brisbane to Tokyo to Taipei to Singapore), delays at any of the locations would cause delays to all rest.

Flew from Edinburgh to London city airport to catch connection to my home in Zurich. Plane type Embraer 190. However, on landing at gate 25, passengers cannot disembark until other planes close by have taken off or landed, causing a delay in getting off the plane.  A passenger then is required to walk the entire length of the airport, through baggage claim and then exit to the non-flight side. Climb stairs and go back in through security and x-ray. the queues are long and there is no concession for connecting passengers. then walk back through the entire length of the airport with the addition of negotiating a maze of shops and restaurants. I therefore got to my gate a couple of minutes late. Despite the fact that i can get on the plane with no issues. The dispatcher refused to let me on the plane, and removed my bag! Acting as if I am a bad school boy and deserves detention, not a paying customer! She even told me that her system told me I had just got off the same aircraft and that I was in the airport passing through security, and that they could see me on cc-tv. I found this unbelievable. I  then again have to walk the entire length of the airport to exit and see customer services after waiting for my bag at baggage collection. Customer services inform m, after discussing with the same dispatcher by phone,  that they consider this to be my fault and therefore will not put me on another flight and will not provide me with a hotel room either. Rules they stateâ€¦.and they claim on their adverts that they wish to serve. I am told I can purchase a new flight and go to enquiries to complain about the queues and to locate a hotel. No help at all, their attitude was also smug as they were clearly delighted to have me stranded. I promptly walked over to Swiss air desk, where the lady quickly sold me a low cost flight, despite the fact that the plane was due to leave in 45 minutes. They then quickly checking in both my bags and escorted me through security so I would pass through quickly. This BA is service!
British Airways partners are horrible and give BA a bad name. All their partners I used in the last month were late. I will stay away from BA since they can not commot to timely schedules.

Travelled  to las vegas on the 2 nd of june not much leg space inthe aisle  seat the stewardess  came round about one hour in the flight with the drinks i got 2 cans of lager the wife got 1 vokda and orange   when we drank them had to go and ask for more drinks to be told they had run short ?why did they not stock up at Heathrow  airport.we had the same dinner  chicken curry going and coming back no other choice it was not very nice had the same entertainment  on the flight back as coming  would  not travel again with b a  as they are  penny pinching .

I travel around Europe a lot for work and on all the comparable airlines a drink and snack are provided free of charge. I however Bought a cup of coffee to be given it in a "filter cup" which made it look dirty with coffee grounds coming out of the air hole. It was so strong it was undrinkable. I asked for extra milk which didn't even change the colour of the coffee it was so strong. I believe that they may want to re think this overpriced undrinkable M & S muck.

Over time I have spent a great deal of money and time on BA flights. Mostly the continental 2h30m flight between London Heathrow, and Budapest Airport. 4 years ago the service was comparatively much better than it is today. Whereas oil prices have been plummeting recently BA flights did not become any cheaper really. And they are operating with a multiplier close to 10 when it comes to booking the last seats on a plane or in the prime flight days(fri-sun). So for a continental flight in the evening return costs Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â£500 booked 2 weeks in advance. This is already quite the price but 4 years ago you would get sandwiches, salads, soft- and alcoholic drinks onboard. Nowadays you get a biscuit or a bag of crisps. Both of which are the excrement of the food industry not healthy in the slightest and the official reason for it this being a short (2h30m) flight. What happened there?

My mother who is 70 traveled on BA on the night of the 5th of December 2015 from Boston Logan airport to Heathrow.  She landed at 8 am.  Despite booking wheelchair services, she had no-one to assist her at the airport.  She missed her connecting flight to Mumbai as it took her longer to reach the check in counter.  Also she was subjected to security check but was at the end of the queue.  No one paid any attention to her or the other passengers who had to catch their connecting flight.  Having now missed her flight, she was given a Ã‚Â£10 coupon for food and drink.  She had to sit in the transit lounge of Terminal 5 on high back chairs.  The flight to Mumbai was at 9pm on the 6th.  I feel that the way British airways ground staff were useless.  The customer services were totally inadequate in providing me any telephone numbers to be able to contact her in Terminal 5. We were totally disgusted with her treatment and vowed that none of us will fly BA on a long haul flight.
A380 was quiet smooth very comfy seats and decent food. Slept better in economy than many airlines in business. Note that the only this BA do wrong is to Codeshare with American Airlines.

Always choose BA from London to Greece and the opposite .
Sometimes my flight has delay

My kids flew from DFW to London-heathrow on unaccompanied minor service.
the service was not so sofisticated as they explained in there website.
1.There was miscommunication at DFW airport.The person issued the boarding pass communicated saying BA member will pick kids from lobby and take them for boarding directly,we were waiting and finally no one showed up,when checked back with BA member ,they said that is not the process, and she issued gate passes to us 30mins before the takeoff.
2.The unaccompanied forms were not sent to the gate desk  .
3.AS per the details mentioned in the website ,they said kids will be provided seating close by to the cabin members,but the seating were in 10th row.
4.When kids reached the Heathrow airport ,kids didnt receive any assistance during baggage claim,kids had to pull the baggage and place in the cart.

Firstly they offered no juice or drinks throughout the 10 hour flight from New Delhi to London(01/06/2016) .They serve dinner but as the child is sleeping they don't serve her .Breakfast in the morning was served very late and since my child was hungry ..All I got was a bag of crisps ,later when she didn't have the breakfast ,they said we don't have anything else to offer .The omelette was too heavy and the croissant was unpalatable .No fruit or juice was served .After requesting nearly thrice for a bar of chocolate (at least )all I got was a rude reply that we offered you milk .If your child can't have milk how can she have a chocolate?Or else buy chocolates when you get down at the airport..I was appalled by their behavior and their indifference ..Also if you ask the flight attendant about the menu they reply "some vegetarian meal with vegetables maybe ..They do not know the menu at all ..My second flight from London to SFO was much better .Yet the Inflight entertainment was not working for a nearly 11 hour flight ...Is it cost cutting at its seasonal best or yet more to come..would not recommend this airlines to anyone.

I travel to the UK several times a year to visit my boyfriend. I've always flown BA, and my only complaints are their extortionate prices and seats which are difficult to sleep in (even when you're 5'0"). The staff have always been friendly and professional. I've always felt safe and calm when flying with BA, and I am not one who typically enjoys air travel. Overnight flights in economy are never particularly comfortable, but it could definitely be worse. The meals provided are good for an airline (I always stick to pastas), but the entertainment choices are sometimes limited (though very British). I've experienced a few delays and one cancellation, but typically we arrive in a timely manner. I just wish the flights were cheaper; it's rare that they fall below $1,000 round trip. But for a nonstop, transatlantic flight, I suppose that's not bad. There are definitely other airlines that do nonstop transatlantic flights for cheaper (Virgin, for one), but if BA is your only option it's certainly not a bad one. Personally I think you get less than you pay for in economy, but if you're not terribly picky and just want to reach your destination safely and decently-fed, BA's great.

EDITORS COMMENT: Thanks for sharing your very balanced and informative review - great to read.

I arrived 10 minutes to closing the check in to my flight to Los Angeles with lay over in London, had forgotten my student visa and was freaking out. I was pulling out everything of my suitcase to find the visa but to no avail. The stewardesse then saved me, held the flight giving me time to fill out the ESTA and when i lost my boardingpass running to make the flight, and my bag broke and everything fell out and i fell hurting my knee, the British Airways staff was the kindest, most helpfull and overbearing crew i have ever met. I can sincerely say that I had not made this flight, which meant everything to me to finish my Masters Degree, if it hadn't been for the Danish and British crew on that Nov 8th flight from Copenhagen to London. I'm deeply grateful for handling and helping me in such a panic state. I was shaking and almost crying in my panic attack, walking onto the plane. The stewardesse immediately saw me and pulled me aside as i was entering the plane 30 min late. She gave me water and demanded i stood by her until i had drinked two cups. She smiled and calmed me down so patiently and kind. Wow, thank you - i don't know your names, but it meant the world to me!!

Flew London City to Glasgow International Airport and back. Mobile check in was a breeze. Seats and leg room was good for my comfort as a 5ft3in. Flight attendants and check in counter staffs were helpful, but not friendly enough to me. Take off and landings were excellent as well. I intend to fly with them back to UK in the summer.

Flew Business from Singapore to Sydney and was most dissappointed with the seat configuration being placed in two centre seats. Service was adequate but the cabin staff didnt go out of there way to provide service.

Was absolutely shocked to find there is no food on any flights under 5 hours, always looked forward to the breakfast. On top of that they've scrapped the unnaccompanied child rule which no makes it harder to see my younger siblings.

Flown this airline for 10 years, now is when I stop. Crap value for money, Mr Cruz is Clueless.

Upgraded to Club Europe on outward journey for a treat. Check in queue at "dedicated Club Europe" desk dreadful. Staff like bouncers with no customer service skills. Heard one say to a young man "you should have got up earlier". Only when we got restless did they open the fence to let us go to an idle check in operator. Then the "priority" security process was nonsense, just as slow as elsewhere. Staff on board excellent.
On return journey I checked in online as usual. Changed our seats to the final row. Got on board to find the row had no window. Flight to full to move elsewhere. Partner a very nervous flyer and had a horrible journey back, felt he was in a coffin. All made worse by 30 min delay on departure and a further 30 min delay on being allowed to land at LHR.
Next day I contacted BA customer services online to ask why there was no indication at all on the aircraft seat plan that row 25 on Airbus 319 had no window. No response at all apart from automated "we're busy but will get back to you asap". A week letter I sent the same response, with original complaint number, again online. No response at all, not even the automated one.
I'm left feeling that BA is now RyanAir.

Dreadful airline that has got worse over the years. Oversells its seats and has no one to deal with this. Loses baggage. Has no hot drinks nor sandwiches on short flights.
Unlikely to ever use again.

Travelling as a disabled passenger with mobility needs and special dietary requirements I was apprehensive.  From the moment I arrived at the airport I was treated with extreme courtesy and help at every point. I particular on the flight from Tampa to Gatwick the cabin staff were exceptional. I would like to comment on the Cabin supervisor Nicola Hooper who went out of her way to ensure I was comfortable and well taken care of.  Such a joy to find traditional service standards are still in place. I know why I never travel with any other airline. It is predictably excellent.

I booked flights with BA from London-Kuala Lumpur-Bandar-Kuala Lumpur-London. These were all booked at the same time and they also took the booking, therefore contract, with Royal Brunei Airlines (RBI) for the KL/Bandar/KL legs.
For whatever reason RBI cancelled one of the flights, and it was only by accident that I found this out, by going on the BA website. I had to change a flight and waste a day in Brunei.
BA have refused all responsibility, even on the lack of communicating the cancelled flight to me. I find this deplorable after booking everything through BA.

I would certainly never book anything direct with BA again, as this lack of service by a major carrier to a customer is despicable.

The British Airways flight staff were absolutely wonderful!  The food was great.  The plane, however, was old and the in-flight entertainment sub-par.  The sound and video quality of the movies were scratchy and fuzzy.  I had to keep adjusting the arm of my chair just to get enough sound to hear the movie.  People should be advised to bring their own entertainment.

flight from US city to Heathrow T5 for transit to Naples; Milan to T5 and back to US city.  BA website for online check-in not working as per standard SOP for many airlines. Fee required to select seats. Aerobridges must hate BA planes.  Besides the US city, none worked in Europe or BA went cheap. Seat planning is atrocious. Was seated with anti-social parents with kids at my front and back on return. Hellish flight, hardly got sleep and attendants did nothing to curb noise levels from this family.  Would not select BA again.

Edinburgh to London Heathrow - Check-in was excellent friendly, efficient & very helpful, was taking Qatar Airways out of LHR the following day & now that they are Oneworld members BA were happy to check bags all the way to Dubai even with overnight at LHR.
On the flight, very clean & well presented A321 - plenty room for this short hop, Cabin Crew again very friendly & efficient - same on my return A320, couldnt have been more pleased - Thanks BA

I flew Business class to and from Europe on American Airlines and British Airways.  The sleeping accommodations on the AA plane were much more private and comfortable than on the return flight on the British Airways plane.  The food on the AA plane was much better.  The food on the BA plane, except the Bangers and mash and the chicken, was abominable, absolutely horrible.  I would not fly BA again if I had to go through Heathrow and my final destination of Vienna.  There were no jetbridges to the planes. I had to walk up numerous steep flights of stairs in the terminal and on the tarmac into the plane carrying a moderately heavy carryon.  I also have knee and foot medical problems and some dizziness after a fall while I was in Europe, so those stairs created a dangerous situation for me and undoubtedly for the elderly patrons who were accessing and egressing the planes.  The ground transportation was crowded and in the era of covid, unsafe.

I took a short flight from Ibiza to London, The staff actually had a sense of humour. The crew on the flight deck were very informative of any changes in our situation including the weather. Full service with a meal and drinks on a 2 hour flight. This was my first flight with this airline.

EDITORS COMMENT: Sounds like a pretty good flight!

We flew from London Gatwick to Alicante in May and the flight on-board the 737-400 was excellent the staff were friendly and helpful and the aircraft was clean and comfortable. We received a lovely free in flight meal rare now due to low cost carriers as well as a free hot drink. It has to have been the best short haul flight I have ever been on.

Delayed flight, long wait in transit for over 12hours with a senior and 6 children, no empathy only to be informed two of us couldnâ€™t board the connecting flight due to no e-visas which wasnâ€™t accounted for at boarding from home country. Stranded in London for 3 days with no bags. Wife and children separated from me and stuck in another country all alone. Extremely rude staff. When filed a claim upon my return all they did was apologize for their rude staff and inconvenience and ask for receipts as proof which I didnâ€™t have due to the chaotic nature of the journey and therefore they denied my claim with no compensation. I donâ€™t understand how they expect 9 passengers to have lived unexpectedly in foreign countries for 3 days without any expenses? Shame on BA because I will never fly with them again. They did nothing to make this matter right.
Very high quality experience. The seats are comfortable, the food is good and usually the trip is smooth. Would recommend
Poor customer experience in Club Europe - no priority boarding, poor food quality and they said that they didnâ€™t have Champagne (as advertised) due to â€œsupply issuesâ€.

Inbound flight to PHL via LHR in Coach and World Traveller Plus was quite ok. The hospitality and the kindness of the staff is widly spreading. One flight attendant hit me with his cabin scooter and did not even excused himself whereas another one was extremely kind in helping me with some issues at my seat.
The outbound flight was quite bad. World Traveller Plus cabin was overbooked (which seems to be the reason for the trouble that I had with reserving seats - see below). Instead of just upgrading the people (business  was only half full) they tried to find some people for using the next flight. Caused delay as no one wanted to use the next one (as this was the last flight out of PHL for that day).
The experience on board was very good this time.
Food is very good in World Traveller Plus.

My biggest problem with BA is customer support: I had problems with getting a reservation of a seat. I tried to select a seat (no bassinet!) that was shown  as free and get an error message. Two times I contacted the customer service hotline but there were not able to help and I got another information every single time. My complaint email was not answered till now (four weeks now).

Over four hour delay which was entirely British Airway's fault and down to engineers being called out and paperwork taking a long time to be signed off. Long distance flight to Qatar.  I have written over eight communications to British Airways Customer Service to claim compensation. It has been almost two months and not a single communication has been acknowledged- whether by online form, email or hard copy letter posted by recorded delivery. Waiting over half an hour on the phone to speak with Customer Relations. This is incredibly poor customer service. I'll be avoiding BA going forwards. - very negative experience.

After booking a quick, half emergency return ticket at the airport, for which I payed about 600 euro's too much, I had to change the date and place of return.
Spent 6-7 hours on the phone with different people all telling me different things. One person said changing is possible, the other person said it was not. One person told me I can cancel the ticket, another told me I can't.

They just threw random information at me all the time and couldn't help me, I was unable to change my ticket in any way I wanted - and it was a very reasonable request, within a 15 day time span.

Bedause I booked it at the British Airway desk at the airport, the ticket was registered as if it was booked by a travel agent. However, I did not get the promised email or information, and could not contact this desk at all.

In short, I just feel scammed. I've been toyed around with and they sucked all the money out of me they could. For the first and last time, as I'm spreading the word joyfully that this airline is one to avoid at all costs.

Unfortunate to have paid a huge amount to travel economy from  Arlanda Stockholm. To T5 Heathrow. You have to pay for a cup of tea and your food. The flight crew were rushed off their feet. Ordered food at start of flight and had to chase it twice and received it when we were nearly home.  There was little chance to buy any duty frees even. It's EasyJet service at extortionate prices and they are not even anywhere as good as EasyJet! Had to provide passport details  along with my credit card details for products under Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â£30.00. Would never use again out of choice. Absolutely awful.

On Wednesday 27 April 2011 a travel agent advised my wife of a fare of $796,
on British Airways, saying that it would be necessary
to book and pay by Friday 29 April.

That evening I looked on the British Airways website and at an online travel
agent's website, and confirmed this information (the fares varied slightly,
which I took to be slightly differing agent's commissions).

On the following day (Thursday 30 April), after we had planned a trip,
this fare appeared to be no longer offered,
but a fare of about $915 was offered instead.
(after checking two travel agents and the BA website,
which again, offered very similar fares).

The discrepancy in amounts was not due to changing availability of seats -
mostly the above information relates to what I was told before we looked
at which dates the required number of seats was available.

That is, they advertised that a fare would be available until Friday,
and then discontinued it basically overnight.

This seems like "bait advertising", which in the case of retail shops in Australia, is illegal, and certainly unethical.  It certainly had that effect - getting me
to come along having planned a purchase, only to tell me the price was more
than I had, based on their advertising, confidently expected.
EDITORS COMMENT: Generally you will find that in the fine print it will say "until set number of seats has sold" or something to that effect. It is frustrating though but every airline does it

I would like to give an extra mention for a young man by the name of Julien Cadoret. He gave above and beyond service and made my journey more enjoyable
Regards
Dee Cullen

Qatar-Bahrain, It was a very short flight, hard to write home about it! but I will be fair to them, they were very friendly and accommodating! It was a total shock as I had horrendous experiences with other European carriers and I do my best to avoid them. Legroom was good, flight on time, and we got a soft drink for a 15 minutes flight, would fly them again due to low price.

I was very disappointed by BA.
First of all, we had a delay of almost one hour which is unacceptable. I'm not absurd, I can accept a delay of 10-15 minutes, but not an hour.
When we were finally ready for take off, the passenger seated in my front, lowered the back of his seat (which it's forbidden) and when I asked the flight attendant to ask the passenger to raise it, he said with a superior attitude "We are not flying yet". The airplane was already on the runway ready to take off.
When was time to serve the food, they said "We have only Chicken Curry". How is possible to have only Chicken Curry? What about the vegetarians and vegans? It's outrageous to serve only chicken curry!
I'm very disappointed and this was the last time when I will fly with BA!

Just returned from flight by British Airways (First Class) from Delhi to London.
Complained to BA about the following: delay in boarding, tv system not working properly and only having one meal and snack for a 9 1/2 hour flight. Could not even supply cheese and biscuits. Airport Lounge used in Delhi ok but not a great variety of meals on offer.On the flight I expected air staff to offer to turn your seat into bed and dim the lights for the flight. This did not happen and on arrival had to wait 20 mins for luggage and when I asked BA staff at Heathrow just said they could not do anything it was the way the plane was packed in Delhi and continued with their conversation. We were lucky enough to fly with Virgin last year and it was tons better.
Wish I had gone with Virgin again. Did complain to BA and had to wait for four days before I got a reply from customer services who basically said will pass your comments on to various departments but no apology. Definitely not worth the money to fly in first class.

EDITORS COMMENT: The baggage thing really is out of the airlines control I agree with that but as for the rest of it I too would have expected those services you mention on a first class flight!

an absolute shambles at Frankfurt airport coupled with a complete indifference from British Airways staff left us in a queue which took longer than the time available to get to the plane. An extremely rude member of staff then proceeded to lie to us about calling all passengers for London City, yet this simply wasn't true. plane took off with just 16 passengers on board. British Airways reluctantly re booked us on a KLM flight the next day which was so much better than the very indifferent British Airways flight.

I was very disappointed that during my 4 hour flight from Athens Greece to London, I was required to buy ALL drinks/snacks an food, as was everyone else on the flight! Not even water was offered! Everyone had to pay high prices for food and drink on board with a credit card! Even the smaller European companies offer free food and drink on their European flights... shame on BA!!

Years ago I swore to never fly British Airways again due to their shocking service, attitude and flight cancellations. I decided to recently give them another go for a flight from Nice to London 11.50am arriving 12.40pm so I could attend a meeting in the afternoon, only to have BA cancel my flight at the last minute because they didn't fill the plane and putting me on another flight at 8pm than night getting in at 10pm!!
What am i meant to do with that! I only have two days in London and my itinerary is tight.
So I advise go Eazy Jet or Wiz as they are of the same standard only much cheaper. save your money and don't fly BA.

My flight with BA from Gibraltar to LHR was cancelled several hours prior to departure. I had a connecting flight booked from LHR to Vancouver the following day, so it was imperative that I got to London. I checked the BA website and couldn't find any other flights with them that would work, so unfortunately I made the mistake of requesting a refund. I managed to find a flight out of Malaga that got me into London just after 10:00 p.m. so I booked that and then called British Airways as I wanted to discuss compensation. That's when they advised me that because I had â€œabandonedâ€ travel with them, they were not prepared to do anything for me. Apparently, I should have called them first, and then they would have made the arrangements. Of course they don't explain that on their website - they just ask if you want a refund and then proceed. When I plead my case with the agent at Malaga airport and then followed up with Customer Relations several times via email, they flat out refused to budge. I ended up incurring costs of Â£700 in airfare, hotel, and meals. This airline has definitely gone downhill.

We fly to the UK from NZ at Christmas and have done so for well over twenty years every year. In the early days we could fly BA all the way from Auckland and return.Now we have to pop over to Sydney to pick up BA (Via Singapore) there. Since those early days we have used a variety of Airlines. We are Qantas frequent flyers. Always liked BA they do things very well and the crew are always great, Hardware getting a bit dated now and I swear we flew late last year in the same 747-400 as we did twenty years ago.. ah the familiar song of the  Rolls Royce  211s was great. To enhance the Sydney to Singapore leg we were upgraded to World Traveller plus so it really did make our holiday get off to a good start. We liked the whole flight experience. Look forward to flying again but with newer aircraft.

I flew to Manchester on Friday 27th January from Heathrow Terminal 5. As usual with BA the flight was in time and the crew were excellent.  What was really disappointing is that we now no longer get a complimentary drink. In effect is BA now a low cost carrier?  If so that is sad as BA for me as always about quality.  Can I urge you to re-think your strategy.

EDITORS COMMENT: Unfortunately they had to do it to remain competitive.
BA is a great airline company. Tha staff onboardare very friendly, and there is great in flight entertainment.

I have to say that it was the first time I fly with BA and for sure it will be the last time! I missed my flight that was at 9 coz I was late for 5min even though I did my boarding at6:30 and was late coz of the weight issues and the stupidity of the employees they made me pay extra which i dont mind if they treated me right and not each employee said a different thing than the other and made me late so when i got to the gate they already have taken my bag of the plane! First time I hear such thing could happen how did they do that just for being late for 5min and without even calling my name or searching for me knowing I did my boarding and then yelking at me and being so rude and not helpful at all and I had to pay 100 pounds to rebook for the next day only to get back on an old dirty plane with no screens and bad service for 5 hours and the most shock was that a women entered the plane before it took off by  5min!!!!! So how did she enter when the day before I was yelled at and pushed of the gate.. I have never ever in my life witnessed such bad rude treatment!!!

I have experienced both Economy and Business Class on British Airways. I enjoyed both experiences. They were very friendly, particularly on Business Class. The food and beverages are as good as any other airline - pretty good. I travelled with my Family so we sat in a row, on Business Class. However, if you're travelling alone, I am pretty sure it be a bit of a trouble. It would be a ten star, as it has very comfy seats, and I had a great experience, but on one of the Business Class flights, my mother spilt tea on her blanket, and they were unable to provide another one, which was a bit of poor service. However, overall, I have had good experiences on both Economy and Business Class.

from Bwi to Barcelona. Lost our luggages. we went to the cruise 8 days without clothing. BA kept saying the luggages will arrive the next day. 8 days went by. No luggages. Ruined our trip. couldn't participate any functions on the ship because we didn't have appropriate clothes. Ship didn't sell any clothes that fits us. Couldn't buy clothes on our ports because we had to participate our excursions from 7am-6 pm(when the ship leave). Lugguages was finally deliver to our resident 8 days after we got home.  No sorry, no compensation from BA. Will never ever fly with them again.

British airways is always late, their website is atrocious, and they won't let you checkin until 24 hours before the flight and then tell you that you must do it at the airlines because it is less than 24 hours.  I have been trying for 6 hours to check in and/or find a real person to speak with.  Finally customer service had such a thick accent I didn't think they were speaking English. Avoid this airline.

The worst flight even in business class the flight between Cairo airport & London Heathrow ( via verse) . The airplane is designed to fly internal Europe only for maximum 2 hours trip and not to be used for more than 5 hours trip . The business class seat was very small, not full flat bed , no screen or any type of entertainment provided for 5 hours trip . I traveled through BA to USA yearly in business class during the last 14 years , but on the last 3 years they started using this small airplane for this medium distance trip which not comfortable at all and doesnâ€™t met the value of money which paid in this business class trip

I flew BA First from LHR to MIA. It was an airbus A380. Row 1 means you are secluded because of the stairs and you are the last person the crew notice as the galley is behind row 4.

On my outbound flight I had a wonderful time watching movies but felt ignored by the crew. There are only 14 seats in first class!

On my return flight, I felt I got a great deal of attention. However, the flat bed was uncomfortable and the cabin was cold. This is not the crews fault but they need warm blankets. It's a function of the system.

Now we get to the food. They ran out of my food option on my outbound flight. I am travelling first. How does that happen?

Apparently it is to do with the tasting menu and  how many people choose it.

On my return flight I was offered dinner and got some beef which was, for me, over cooked.

I wish airlines would be honest and say that your taste buds will change in the controllef air at 30k feet.

Having had a full English Breakfast where the bacon has been made to look like it was fried but wasn't was so irritating.

I will never fly First again because there just wasn't the added value.

If your B.A. flight is delayed, and more importantly youâ€™ll miss your connection due to the delay, donâ€™t expect much help from B.A. staff at Glasgow Airport. If this happens to you, make sure the B.A. Customer Relations staff (who arenâ€™t actually B.A staff!) given the reason for delay, when they would be able to get you on the next connection to get you to your final destination, and if they were unable to get a suitable flight with another airline in writing. Youâ€™ll need this if you ultimately need to claim on your travel insurance. Make sure to do this before leaving the airport. The B.A. website is not easy to navigate to find the correct link for any claim. Their Customer Relations number (0344 493 0787) is also likely to cut out on you and even while talking to someone in Customer Relations (that happened to me on more than one occasion). When you do eventually get to speak to a rep, donâ€™t necessarily believe what they say. If they say your refund claim has been put through there and then, donâ€™t believe them. If you find your refund hasnâ€™t entered your bank account 6 days later, donâ€™t believe the next rep who says itâ€™ll be in your account within 24hrs. The next rep I spoke to, 10 days after making the claim, stated they should have said the money wouldnâ€™t be refunded until at least 10 days later! Shoddy service. If the rep you speak to about refunds informs you that you have to take another phone option in order to claim for anything other than flights, be wary. I was told that due to the time I was on, that this other department wouldnâ€™t open until 09.00hrs the following dayâ€¦wrong! They didnâ€™t open until 13.00-17.00hrs. Also, the rep made no comment (having been made aware of the circumstances) that my claim for loss of hotel and trips costs would not be refunded. Between the number of phone calls I have made, the time spent on the phone and internet, Iâ€™ve effectively cost myself a fair amount of the money Iâ€™m wanting to get refunded! Always remember that legally, you may be entitled (I believe) to up to Â£300 each for any delay over 3hrs (per â€œEC Regulation 261/2004â€). Not that B.A. will tell you. If your claim is rejected, you can ask the Civil Aviation Authority (or the European Consumer Centre in certain non-UK departures) whether it believes you are entitled to compensation. Worth a try. Considering what I asked for is substantially less than that, they still arenâ€™t helpful. Despite having used B.A. before, and have other flights already arranged, B.A. have gone down in my estimation (I now see why Iâ€™ve heard so many negative comments about B.A. over the last couple of years). Unless there is no other option, I would seriously consider using another airline. It couldnâ€™t be any worse.

Only fly BA 40% of my business trips now (do 70 flights a year) as the lack of free food and drink has changed my experience of BA. If they are going to penny pinch, then so am I!  I now use EasyJet and Wizzair from Luton which are much cheaper and he experience is the same. Actually you could say the experience is better as although the Terminal at Luton is a dump at the moment, the planes take off much quicker as it is not as congested as Heathrow. Get rid of Alex Cruz he is ruining a great British brand ! So sad.....

My mother and I really enjoyed flying from Heathrow to Frankfurt and back with British Airways earlier this month! We found the staff very polite and attentive to our needs and they even moved us to better seats as there were some better seats vacant. The price was excellent (though we did admittedly book 6 months in advance), however we would have appreciated a free drink and snack on board, which I believe BA used to offer until recently (now everything has to be bought unless you are travelling in Business Class).

My husband and I travelled from Singapore to London in first class.  The aircraft was clean and crew were very friendly and efficient, nothing seemed too much trouble.  Food & beverage was excellent, flat bed & bedding very comfortable.    One minor issue the coffee machine had broken.  Still had a reasonable cup of coffee.

First flight with new and improved value menu from Marks and Spencers (BAs words not mine) and it was surprisingly empty. Not sure if it is a trend. The newish Airbus 320 configuration includes extra row in the first 11 rows which means to compensate for less legroom, the seat rake has been reduced to uncomfortable. I didn't buy any of their expensive sandwiches or drinks. I bought a bottle of water on board with me. Flying less with BA these days as they have reduced to being an expensive low cost airline. I prefer Easyjet now.

Flew DC-Heathrow on a brand new A380. Checked in online and reserved seats on the upper deck but prior to boarding they put us on lower deck explaining the ones we wanted were broken. Food was decent but for long haul Economy it could have been better. Flight back, Hethrow-DC was a nightmare. Old 777 with filthy seats and floors. Tickets were the cheapest among all airlines but now I know why.

This is the flight I am never going to prefer to take again  or prefer my friends or family to take it. They don't provide wheel chair service properly in London. My parents suffered a lot. Also my kids when they did go to vacation we had a very bad experience as the flight was cancelled and the customer service for rescheduling and seating was very poor. They were not even showing their apologies for the cancellation and no courtesy given for that. I really disappointed with this airlines.
Flight from LGW to MUR

DO NOT British Airways  - I had a business class flight scheduled on Dec 12 2022 â€¦ Manchester > Copenhagen -Bangkok and return flight Dec 27 2022 â€¦ they lost my suitcase and it took 5 weeks for them to find it ... not one response from their lost baggage dept ... absolutely appalling service that ruined my holiday and now they ignore me....
My baggage never arrived despite me completing lost baggage forms at Thai Air Bangkok .. BA (LHR) and SAS (Copenhagen. I arrived back home 28.12.2022 ..

My husband & I recently flew round trip Phoenix/London in business class.  We have never raved about an airline as we do British Airways.
