The staff service and attention to detail was the best we have ever experienced with an airline!  We, especially, want to thank the staff on BA 0288 on 7/21/16 and BA 0289 on 8/8/16 (Ruth, you ROCK!).  The comfort, spatial seating and entertainment was excellent.  We would fly British Airways again in a heart beat!

I flew Amsterdam - Tokyo with a connection in London. My flight from Amsterdam was delayed, causing me to hurry in London to my connecting flight. I requested a special meal, but it was not available on my flight to Tokyo. The meal I had on the way back was burned and dry, not eatable. Everything else was average. Seats are decent, in-flight entertainment is some-what decent and the crew was not friendly but also not rude. I will fly with British Airways again because they're the cheapest, but if you can spent a couple more bucks use a different airline.

Flew Sydney to Rome via LHR and return; B777 to and from Australia A321 LHR to and from Rome. Service was reasonably good, that promises of a newspaper on one flight and paracetamol did not eventuate. Range of food and drinks somewhat restricted. Food to London was very disappointing, but food on the return leg was tasty and satisfying. BUT, business seating is terrible: feels like a coffin in your cubicle - very narrow and nowhere to put anything. BA puts eight seat across, while others put only six, even on larger planes such as the A380. Sorry BA, I used to enjoy business on the 747s, but the B77 experience has put me off completely: the standard is not even as good as other airlines' premium economy offerings.

I have spent the past 9 years travelling between the UK and Thailand, with various airlines. Where BA is concerned, neither the food, hospitality or entertainment can compare with that of  Etihad, Emirates or Qatar, none of which I experienced delays with. The only airline I did endure a delay with was BA. The delay meant that I missed my pre-booked trains and incurred costs of almost 90 pounds. I tried to claim my expenses but BA arrogantly denied responsibility. They also informed me that they were not a member of the ombudsman scheme set up to ensure consumers get a fair deal. This itself suggests that they put profit above customer satisfaction.
Where there is a choice I would strongly recommend flying with one of the other airlines and only using BA as a last resort

Terrible.  Flew first class.  They canceled my initial flight and had to rebook but their computer system was down for a day and a half.  Their website is not easy to navigate.  Difficult to reach a customer service person on the phone while traveling.    The in-flight meal was superb and the cabin crew superb.  They lost my bag on my flight home from London and never sent me an email to advise the status for 6 days.

For those who want the nutshell, we were booked on a British Airways flight from San Francisco to New Delhi with a connection in London Heathrow.  Our flight to London was late so we missed our connection.  We were rebooked with a 90 minute connection through Munich.  This flight was also late.  We were then rebooked with a 60 minute connection through Paris and this flight also took off late.  With each rebooking, I asked for a longer connection and the agent argued and guaranteed there would be no delays.  We refused another connection in Paris and were put on the direct flight the next day.  My husband's suitcase was sent from London to Delhi on a BA flight.  We found this out from the Air France agent when we were in Paris.  When we arrived in Delhi, we spent 5 hours arguing with the BA desk before they released our suitcase.  Someone from another airline informed us that there was a fee to get the suitcase out of storage and the airlines did not want to pay.  The fee was approximately 6 US dollars.  When we found out the real situation we said we would pay the fee.
We will never fly British Airways again and hope you do not either.  For those who want the details, see below:
COMPLETE INCOMPETENCE WILL NEVER FLY AGAIN
My review is very overdue.  I booked a trip from San Francisco to New Delhi in Dec 2012.  The connection was in London Heathrow.  First we missed our connection in Heathrow because our flight from SFO was late.  They put us on a new flight connecting through Munich that had a 90 minute connection.  I asked for a longer connection, but the airline insisted I would be fine.  The flight to Munich was late.  We missed our connection again.  The airline did retrieve my suitcase & put us in a hotel.  They also rebooked us on another BA flight the next morning to Paris, then on an Air France flight to New Delhi.  This time the connection was 60 minutes.  The airline promised there will be no delay.  They said the flight is the first flight in the morning and there will NOT be a delay.  They took us to an outdoor location to catch the shuttle for the hotel.  Well it was snowing in Germany.  We stood there for 30 minutes then realized we were in the wrong location.  Locals were kind enough to direct us to the proper shuttle stop.  We had 2 hours of sleep.  The next morning we boarded the plane.  However, the plane sat on the ground for 60 minutes.  They underestimated how much time was needed to board the luggage.  Then after loading the plane they had to de-ice the plane.  We knew we missed our connection.When we arrived in Paris the Air France informed us my husband's suitcase had been sent to New Delhi from London on a British Airways flight and would be in New Delhi when we arrived.
We refused another connection in Paris and stayed in a hotel that night.  The next day we arrived in New Delhi.  The BA luggage desk said the suitcase is in the warehouse and it will be an hour before someone can bring it out.  We waited the hour.  Someone new was at the desk.  They told us to talk to Air France since we arrived on Air France.  Air France said they cannot help us because the suitcase arrived on a BA flight.  To make matters worse.  Air France and BA were standing at the same table & refusing to talk to each other.  My husband and I were screaming at the fact that they had our luggage but would not relinquish it.  Those around us swore they would never fly BA again.  Finally, a gentleman from a 3rd airline explained that the suitcase was in a government warehouse and you had to pay a fee to get it out.  He said neither airline wanted to pay.  The price was 6 US dollars.  BA said it's not about the money and paid the fee.  Also, the warehouse was located behind the desk & someone was in the room when we initially arrived. Everyone I have told this story too will never fly BA again.  I hope those reading this will also never fly this airline. I am not someone who cuts off an entire business for one bad experience, but I will NEVER fly BA again!

The baggage check in took for ever it was (I am certain)45-50min of standing in the queue. The flight looked good and well maintained 777. In flight entertainment was good and updated to latest movies,documentaries,talk shows 5* for that . The seating space was just about good enough. Be careful of the head set it can come in the way and snap. The air conditioner was not up to the mark it was warm in the cabin. The flight attended's will give you a big smile BUT be careful. The in flight food was so hot that it turned black when in contact with oxygen.In short it was burnt, one can see the burnt food particles once the burnt food is moved looks like a lovely trick .The answer of the flight crew to some one asking for second helping of 150ml coke can is that we need to keep stock for the return flight can't keep serving everyone twice.This was the first time in 12+yr of international travel to hear this excuse.The worst but with a smile.... flight was on time.

Who is telling the truth? This is an update to my recent review of BA â€˜Not fit for purposeâ€™. In it I described the incident where a cabin crew member spilled wine in my lap. On return home I made a modest claim for the both my Chinos and Shirt, which were ruined. Response from BAâ€”â€”â€” â€œNot accepted because no cabin crew member entered the incident in the flight log!!!!!â€ So, I am a liar, eh? This nastiness after buying a flight ticket for almost Â£1700. Would us Britishers not believe that our national carrier would act honourably? Totally disgraceful.

My experience with British Airways a few years back was very poor. However, they seem to have improved extremely well both with the interior comfort with the airline but also with passenger service. Recently flew from the UK to and from Europe on three occasions in Business Class and have absolutely no complaints at all.

We flew BA business from Helsinki to London on an A320, one of the longer European flights and so perhaps one of the few where the upgrade may be justifiable.  The meal was very pleasant, and a step up from nothing in Economy!  As with many European airlines, the seats themselves are no different, rather you get the extra legroom and they just don't fill the middle seat in the 3-3 layout.  So the extra comfort level is only marginal

I used BA for fifty flights in Europe last year and enjoyed my free snacks and drinks. Now, there is nothing free, just cabin crew blocking the aisle when you need to go to the loo as they are too busy taking money.  I have found Wizz Air from Luton to do a lot of my flights to Europe now. Just as good but cheaper.  BA- you have killed off your brand reputation in less than 6 months. You were a National carrier for the people of the UK. Isn't a 20% operating margin good enough for you. So sad....

This is the first time travelling with british airways with my husbans and 3 kids. my only bad experience was the meals. My kids didnt like the food. They didnt eat anything. Even me and my husband hardly ate anything its better if u make maybe fish and potatoes and a box of snacks for kids or maybe rice and salmon. Just some small advice.. it doesnt cost that much. Other than that everything is amazing i highly recommend it. When i took BMI last year the food was amazing. Im looking forward to my summer holiday with british airways so they can make better food. the only mistake i made is i got my tickets from the expedia website but on my next summer holiday im gonna get it from british airways

I recently flew British airways from Hong Kong to London BA 0026 on 25 th June 2013.  When booking my ticket I was offered to upgrade to world traveller plus from world traveller for this flight, which I accepted and paid for.
After boarding the flight and eating my meal I tried to recline the seat back to sleep, as it was a night flight.  However the seat did not recline at all.  Two males crew members tried to move the seat back as well but it was broken.  I asked to be moved back to economy to a seat that reclined, however, the flight was full and they were unable to do that.
British Airways have refused to refund to me the cost of the upgrade despite the fact that the seat was faulty.

The business class seating layout is just not functional or comfortable. Other passengers have to climb over your legs once your seat is in Lay flat position, often waking you up or bumping you. Meal services is done over you for passengers next to you which is also irritating, especially if you want to have the dividing screen up. My  main meal was served warm instead of hot which was very disappointing.

Very good company, yesterday when I was coming back from Bangkok to London I missed my flight, because I feel asleep on the airport during my healthy conditions (sleepless night before and food poison). They made me big favour and booked next available flight (next day) free of charge. Never happen to me with other different airways. I also would like to mention that Im not British. Big thank you to British Airways.

My husband and I flew from London to Johannesburg on the 18th November and had the most wonderful service from the crew! I was 31 weeks pregnant and Elaine who was in charge or the cabin bent over backwards to accommodate us with a special request. Thank you Elaine for everything, you really were outstanding! I look forward to traveling with BA again in the near future!

Would not recommend. Awful food and beverage service - only served water with main meal on 9 hour flight. No beer available at all by time I asked perhaps 2 hours into flight and they ran out of wine after I had one glass after finally having a drink after the meal.

Seats were dirty and had food stains

Tv screen was broken and literally hanging off the back of seat so managed to get moved by the only nice member of staff I came across.

Would avoid BA if flying to USA (London Heathrow to vegas)

I just returned from a European trip.  The flight was from London to Philadelphia.  Great staff and nice meals; however, the airplane seats were very small and crampy.  To spend 7.5 hours with someone almost laying in your lap is a bit much.  I've flown other airlines and this was a first for me.  I would not recommend nor consider this airline for international flights.

I flew British Airways from Denver to London, then Mumbai to London to Denver.  Seats are cramped and uncomfortable - while the spacing would be ok for a domestic flight under 3 hours, it was miserable.  Crew was friendly and professional, food was good.

After arriving at London Heathrow from Phnom Penh via Doha (taking 22 hours at 11.30am) for a connecting flight BA1332 to Newcastle on 02 May 2014. British Airways refused to board us due to some computer ticketing glitch, insisting we had to contact our travel agent in Phnom Penh (by which time it was after 10,00 pm there) refusing to accept our printed itinerary booking or the copy of the payment and Visa vouchers showing we had fully paid for the booking with them.  BA also insisted that they would not have our baggage, despite being checked through to NCL as denoted by the baggage labels, making us return to T5 for a fruitless effort back to Qatar Airways, when all the time it was on their stack at T5.  The QA office, however gave us a print out to say  that in fact we were booked on a later BA flight to NCL, but once again, BA ground staff.....eventually.... refused to board us. Some unnamed person, at the end of a telephone, simply informed the BA counter staff "there is nothing we can do!".  We left LHR by bus 6 hours after first landing there, and arrived in Newcastle 25 hours late after two bus journeys and an overnight stay.

BA has replied twice to us so far, but has still not explained what went wrong, who was to blame, or how any traveller can make sure it does not happen again.  As I am from the UK, with access to my bank account, and a UK sim card for the phone, at least I knew how to get to my destination - how would BA and LHR deal with a foreign visitor?  No-one offered any help whatsoever.  The first reply from the Civil Aviation Authority suggests that what happened to us does not fit in with the "refused boarding" regulations!

Mean people, middle seats for long haul business, tiny seats, poor wines, poor food.  Why would anyone fly them?  They are like what American airlines were like 30 years ago.  AVOID at all costs!  I fly to Africa via IAD to avoid.

A national disgrace.

2 confirmed business class flights were cancelled, 1 without notice upon arrival at the airport, the other with zero notice until I tried to check in online 24 hrs prior.

Very unreliable, with average service on board and very average lounge.

They also decided to bump my business ticket to economy upon rebooking me for a next flight.

The last thing you want on a long European trip is an unreliable airline with zero empathy. Fly with someone else, BA should be your very last choice.

It's always horrible to have to fly economy class and British Airways is not different. That is the sad standard.
But what is totally inacceptable is the fact that BA sold me a flight connection that they already knew even before I started my trip I couldn't make the connecting flight.
I had to reach a connecting flight at LHR and even though the plane landed on time I was already denied to board my next flight before even having gone through security check. There never was going to be enough time to catch the connecting flight and thus we were rebooked to a later one. Even though this caused a delay of "only" two hours (I don't know about you, but time is very precious to me and is should be to the airlines as well, by force if necessary) it is completely inacceptable. Because if I would have known this while booking my flights perhaps I would have decided to go for a different one with a different airline in the first place.

Have flown Club Europe many times, but have seen a decline in standards over the last year or two. The food now offered was terrible on a flight from Palma to Heathrow. An unedible greasy mess called a hot chicken sandwich. The new service of one crew member taking orders for food and drink, and returning to the galley after each order is slow, why ditch the trolley? Now wine is served from a bottle, but trying to get a second glass, is one long wait. The whole experience was depressingly poor. Cheap food, slow service, less room, really has got a lot worse. No longer a premium service.

Flew with BA to and from Moscow over Easter 2017. The plane was old, seats cover reminded of unclean grey carpet. On the way to Moscow had seat next to emergency exit so had some leg space though the screen for entertainment as well as table were getting stuck so had to choose between watching film and having food resulting with the food provided placed on my lap and cup of coffee on the floor. The food itself was miserable - stone-cold cheese and onion sandwich without alternatives whereas the crew had hot lunches with meat as I noticed while queuing for toilet (and there were only two for a fully booked economy class).
On the way back to London had a seat in the middle of the salon with so little leg space that I literally could not even cross my legs as my knees were stuck into the seat in front. Seats were not reclining either. The food was even worse than on the inbound flight - stone-cold cheese and onion sandwich was replaced with stone-cold cheese and onion small ban and hot drinks were only served once over 4 four hours flight. Do not fly BA. It employs tactics of EasyJet albeit the latter is superior in comfort and customer service.

I feel the standard of BA is slipping. Staff appear to know less and are less willing to do what they consider the bare minimum in their remit. For family travel I have had superior experience on other airlines especially considering the extra paid for business class flights.

Oh BA wtf you have turned yourself into a Ryan air without the cheap prices! I have flown for 18 years to Aberdeen from LHR...you now charge for seat allocation...fine except before you brought this in i was always pre allocated a window or aisle seat...since you brought this in i now am always pre allocated a middle seat! Really! I suspect you pre allocate everyone now into middle seats even when theres not enough to make us pay our Â£6 to move....pathetic...national carrier you are a national disgrace the only reason i fly with you is because i want to fly from Heathrow....not Luton or Stanstead....god how i wish easyjet flew to Aberdeen from Heathrow....would i ever use BA for my regular lnghaul to Australia oh god no no no way .....crappy crappy nasty without the crappy nasty cheap prices as a national carrier you are an embarassment!

I fly with the Oneworlders to London at least 3-4 times a month. BA used to be worth it, not anymore. You dont pay ur people well, you get untrained and/or unhappy staff and u feel it. And more than once in Heathrow on the train to B or C I had to ask crew that I really dont want to hear why they will be miserable later... talk bad about BA in LHR in Uniform surrounded by passengers... wow overall: badly trained, bad mood, arrogant .. no thanks... did I say I was saphire?

Comfortable flight from LHR to SFO. Cabin crew were attentive and friendly, and happy to fetch additonal refreshments during the flight. Food was fairly good, although it was all unhealthy carbs and sugar, no fresh fruit or vegetables whatsoever. Plenty of entertainment options for all tastes. Overall, I was pleased with my experience.

We flew World Traveller Plus a few years ago, Melbourne to London. What we got for the extra cost was negligible, maybe a bit more leg room. The special lumbar cushions did not work and we were right in front of the toilets, so could not recline very well and had to put up with constant flushing noises.  The staff were cold and unhelpful. On the return leg that had a layover in Bangkok, they came thru the cabin without warning and sprayed everyone with some kind of disinfectant, that sent us into coughing fits.

First class LHR to Kuala Lumpur on the much vaunted 787. Service way below expectations.  I could not avail of the massage in their  lounge in Terminal 5. Tried to reserve this 3 weeks in advance but this was " fully booked". I was advised to get a walk in slot on the day but the only slot they had was too close to departure time. I only got  15 minutes on a massage chair . Check-in in their dedicated lounge was crowded and boarding chaotic and no sense of feeling like it was first class. Inflight cabin was ok but there was no sense of luxury. Cabin crew ok but not overly friendly and very very slow to anticipate passengers' needs. This despite having 3 cabin crew looking after only 8 first class passengers. Only one toilet  and no different from toilets in a low cost carrier. Entertainment on board was diabolical. No Wifi.  Food very average. On arrival the stewardess could not be bothered to help when I asked about Fast track.  Return trip also very average. The best service was in the first class lounge in KLIA and that was a Malaysia Airlines lounge not BA. Service inferior compared to first class with Air France.

I fly the 777-300ER four times a year, commuting back and from LHR to Rio. The airplanes seats are hard, uncomfortable ( for being a business class seat ).
The meal tastes horrid, and the salad was completely dried out and rotten.
Only good thing was that the beverages were free.
The inflight entertainment is ok ( a big upgrade from the old 777-200ER ).

The staff was mad, and they had places us all around in the plane...

The airplane became VERY hot during flight, I did not bother to ask the cabin crew to ask the pilots to turn the temperature down, because the cabin crew would respon saying it's illegal to talk with the pilots...

And of course not to mention, not a single european flight that won't be delayed!
British airways provided us with excellent service. The cabin crew and pilots were friendly and we had no problems.
British airways is very good, clean aircraft, seats comfy and friendly crew, not to mention the amazing entertainment screens.

I have flown BA many time, my most recent experience being London to Los Angeles.  We were made to feel very welcome, the seats a very comfortable, and the IFE was excellent with a good choice.  Food was comparable to other experiences and better than others we have flown on.  I would recommend BA to family & friends without hesitation.

We took a flight from Milano via London to Bangkok. The staff in Milano, ok. The lounge serves a nice breakfast in the morning. The flight to London uneventful. The lounges in London are good but too full. It is a problem to find a seat sometimes. We were on an 20 year old B777s from London to Bangkok round trip. The crew was superb on both legs. The legroom is ok and the service is good. The entertainment program is old fashion. The screens are old and the choice is very limited. But when compared to economy on other european carriers it was over average.

In May 2016 I booked a World Travellers Plus ticket from London to Johannesburg and return for my wife.
This was changed a few days later to return from Cape Town rather than Johannesburg and I was advised there would be an additional charge and I agreed that this charge should be taken from the Debit card, which I had paid the initial ticket for.
We checked the BA website and all the details were adjusted and marked as confirmed.
At the end of August 2016 I received an email asking me to contact BA, which I did.
I was asked if I had adjusted the return ticket from Johannesburg to Cape Town that I confirmed I did and I asked if there were any problem with the ticket as my wife was travelling on her own and the customer services agent confirmed everything was in order and I was not asked for an additional payment for the flight change.
I could not understand the purpose and raised the issue when I had another email from BA asking for experience with the BA Contact Centre.
I never received a reply.
On 22 September I booked the outgoing flight with out any difficulty and my wife checked in at Heathrow without being asked for any additional pay

We took a Miami to London flight (209) two weeks ago, in Business class, on the way to Amsterdam. If you are tall, the seats are terrible. Check "seat guru". The pitch is 72 inches (6' 0") and the width is 20". So if you are 6' tall and you push your head against the top end, you will be able to lie flat. If you try to lie on your side with a seat width of 20 inches, you need to be a contortionist. Even if you are not tall, try lying sideways in these seats!
   Compare this to Iberia flights from Miami to Madrid (you can connect to Amsterdam from there also). The typical configuration is pitch 78" and width 26". Guess which one I am flying next time.

The most horrible airline ever.  Service and hospitality is very poor.  Flights get canceled all the time.  Our flight got canceled in Rome and they left the Passengers by themselves since British Airline does not exist in Rome. We had a nightmare on the way of home. Never ever book with this Airline since you will regret it.

BA has gone to the dogs. It used to be an airline of choice. Not now. In the last 12 weeks, 4 international return flights 3 have been disrupted, 3 cancelled or missed connections as a result of delays. The last of which involved 2 cancelled flights, resulting in a night in Gatwick on the way AND the way back. On the return cancellation after sitting on the tarmac for 3hrs, BA refused to facilitate hotel rooms and told the plane load of passengers that everyone was on their own, both in rebooking alternatives, and in finding accommodation. I have never been treated so badly, this at a time when the delay cost me the ability to see my mother before she died. Avoid at all costs if possible.

the last time i flew with ba will be my last time with them, i flew from bangkok to london several years ago in a 747 which appeared to be either new or recently fitted with new seats with video screens in the back,at the time i had only heard about such things and was looking forward to the flight until i shoehorned myself into the seat and realised i was in for an uncomfortable, to say the least,12 hours the legroom was like an average minibus and the seat reclined about as far as a transit van drivers seat,i managed to sleep for about 30 minutes max even though the flight left at 12.35 am and was tired as hell.the staff were useless and spent most of the time asleep. i could go on forever but their's not enough space...i now fly with any far eastern or middle eastern airline and the difference in service and comfort is immense,even on a lesser known carrier like oman they can't do enough for you and feature on board wi fi and mobile phone connection..  finally got that off my chest.

My flight on British Airways BA0106 flight got delayed and then my connection got cancelled.

We contacted the BA call center multiple times to make changes to the flight. The call center suggested that we cancel the flight for a full refund, then claim compensation for the delay and difference in airfare cost and other non refundable bookings due to the delay and cancellation of our flight.
British Airways responded to the claim after a month with no compensation at all, even though we paid additional $600 on new bookings and additional charges.

The refund of the cancelled flight took more than a month with multiple calls to follow up almost every week. I was promised to get refund on the first call but later I found out it was not processed properly. Every-time I call the agent ask questions about why flight was canceled etc which is annoying when my understanding everything was under process for payment. After multiple calls I was refunded partially and not the full amount which is even bizarre from a company of this level. I had to make more calls to get the remaining balance refunded. The whole experience was terrible and damaging.

The rewards program is deceptive with very few available seats.  The website tends to be down 305 of the time I try to book a rewards flight.
I called customer service to see if they could book it and unfortunately their system was down as well.  They asked me to call back in an hour or two.  I called back in 45 minutes and the same customer service agent berated me for not waiting the hour that he had stated.  I replied so you know when it is coming back up?  He replied no I don't but wait another hour anyway

British Airways have very bad customer service. I flew with them early this year with my infant and i was told at the point of purchase of my baby's ticket that he was entitled to a 23kg bag,a stroller and a car seat. I however got to the airport and i was made to pay 200$ for my baby's bag or they wouldn't carry it. I tried to argue this based on what i was told by their customer service rep over the phone and they totally didn't hear me out. I had a lay over in Heathrow and still complained at the BA counter and i was told that i was only misinformed,that my baby ain't entitled to any bag. I was so mad! What kinda of misinformation is that. I would therefore not be flying this airline again and would try and deter anyone trying to fly with them as i see they are not reliable. What if i didnt have a spare 200$ to pay on my travel date, would my luggage have been trashed?

Flew BA283 from LHR to LAX on Saturday, 13th June in economy, upstairs at the back of the plane, which was the A380.
We found this to be not only our best BA flight ever, but also our best on any airline.
The aircraft was new, clean and incredibly quiet. Being upstairs with a 2:4:2 configuration, in a window and aisle seat, we had more room than ever in economy. The locker beside the seat is really handy and adds to the room available and sense of space.
What sets this flight apart was the crew, who were all mature, kind, helpful and lovely people, who worked incredibly hard and made us feel special and valued customers, even though we were only travelling economy.
Over recent years I have had cause to complain to BA for poor service, but this flight went a very long way to restoring my faith in the airline.

Connecting flight  did not wait for us to reach the gate, but took off without us, even though front desk was alerted that handicapped parties are on their way.  Had to wait another 4 hours for another flight.  Customer Service indicated they were unable to help.
Flew JNB to PLZ return on BA.  Both legs were great.  One of the nicest airlines in the South African domestic market

Flew on a BA A320 from London to Rome. It was a fairly new plane, but still seemed a bit worn out. Our luggage was meant to be going straight from the plane we were on to this flight, but when we checked with BA to make sure our bags were on the plane, they "had no record of the bags".

Also went on a BA Embraer 190 from Zurich to London. The seats in this plane were more comfortable and seemed newer.

I flew with BA from Heathrow to Madrid and Heathrow to Reykjavik return. On all occasions the service was good,  the pilots were very informative, cabin crew very obliging. I can see that BA is trying to improve their overall service. Each journey was comfortable. I will definitely fly with them again.

I had the pleasure of flying in the Boeing787,a superb aircraft and flight.However the seat pitch in Economy is ridiculous for a twelve hour flight.When the passenger in front of me reclined his seat there was literally no space to manoeuvre.I am not overweight but I am 6ft-2ins tall and the point I am making is that most short haul flights would have been as "comfortable".I fly every six weeks and I was disappointed.All other aspects of the flight were good.

Flew Business Class from London to Hong Kong on one of BA's new A380's. Service was friendly and of a High standard as usual. The BA lounges in Heathrow are also very impressive.
Food served was very good, with a good selection. Alcohol selection also very good.
Flight ran to schedule.
My only slight negative is that I'm not a fan of the  Reverse Seat layout that BA seem to favour in Business Class, it is more cramped than Emirates Business class in the same aircraft.
But overall very impressed and would recommend.

When travelling to the states, our first BA flight from Cork Airport to London Heathrow was delayed, meaning that we would miss our connecting flight to Baltimore. However, after going to the BA helpdesk, we were offered a later flight with Virgin Airways to Baltimore, free of charge, which was very helpful. Im so grateful for the help amd pur bags arrived on time in Baltimore too. Good experience overall.

Sarcasm is the lowest form of wit', is a saying attributed to Oscar Wilde. In this review of my recent experience on British Airways Club Class from Heathrow to Bangkok return, I am tempted to use those words to accurately describe events. First...the reason for my booking. It was in response to the folk who contacted me to ask why I had not included BA in a detailed comparison review I did, which compared the quality of Business Class cabins on five major airlines that flew the same route. They had a point. So, tickets booked, I arrived at LHR terminal 5 to check-in for my flight to Bangkok. Previously, I had made a request to BA's Public Relations department to conduct a short, informal interview with the day's Duty Manager. Such interviews requested of ALL the other airlines were granted, during which I gained much information. But...BA said, NO! However, at check-in, I asked if I could meet with the day's duty manager whilst in the lounge. 'No problem', I was told, 'we'll arrange it so please identify yourself at the Club Class lounge desk'. Did anyone arrive?...you've guessed it - NO. When querying the non arrival at that lounge desk, I was told that the meeting would take place in the departure hall. Did it? - NO. So, onto the aircraft, a 17 year old Boeing 777. One look around the cabin and my expectations fell . The layout of the 'lay flat' seats was such that passengers were forced to climb over each others legs to reach an aisle. It was at that point that my first thoughts of 'sarcasm and wit' came to mind. Were BA 'taking the Mickey' out of the business class passengers? I mused before a more hilarious thought hit me, Maybe Disney's Mickey had designed the seating arrangement and, tongue in cheek, presented it to Willie Walsh, who made the decision to implement it!!! Hmm, yes, my use of sarcasm...justified or not? Take off was 45 minutes behind schedule but that was to be expected...no big deal. Seat belt sign off...drinks offered and food items on the over exaggerated menu selected. OK I thought, I'll sip my preferred tipple and have a scroll through the on board entertainment system to choose what to view during the 12 plus hour flight. Well, that would have been so, if the screen unit would stay in one place...but it wouldn't...it was broken. Emergency DIY by one of the bearded cabin crew (all but one male was so adorned) as he forced a teaspoon between a gap in the framework. Voila, as the French would say, it held. Now the only problem was squinting to focus images on the tiny, outdated screen. At 30,000 feet or so, conversation was all but impossible if using one's normal voice as every cupboard door and fixture on the aircraft rattled continuously. At around that point, the cabin crew served the chosen meals. More sarcasm, I'm afraid. I'd ordered beef and beef it was. The stainless steel knives wouldn't work...'tough' doesn't describe the meat. Sawn into half-inch thick slices by a cobbler would have yielded soles for boots. Left on the plate, I 'passed' on a dessert and asked for Cheddar Cheese, crackers and a cup of coffee. It was easy to snap a piece off a cracker, but to do the same to the quarter inch thick slice of cheese came as a surprise...as was being served lukewarm coffee. No sarcasm or wit needed here â€“ just disappointment. Now...here comes another scene taken from a Fred Carno film script starring Charlie Chaplin. For a cabin crew member to serve food or drink to a passenger not seated at an aisle, he/she had to reach over the aisle passenger, then a plastic divider to present the tray/dish/item, meaning that person had to balance it before putting it onto their own sliding table. Good eh?...well done 'Mickey'. It was during this time, that I received unasked-for red wine...right into my lap! Oops! A rush to gather paper tissues and the impossible task of trying to mop-up the liquid. The passing of uncomfortable hours did eventually help my Chinos and shirt to dry but left behind the telltale tide marks edged in pink. The seat itself? The narrowest I've ever had to sit on and IN TWO SECTIONS! To rest ones feet, a separate piece of equipment had to be unlocked and risen to a chosen height. Then by the use of a row of hard to see buttons, the other half could be moved to finally make one piece. OK, well, putting that complicated lot together then raised the question, 'was it comfortable?' Maybe so if every passenger was less than six feet tall and as slender as a Vogue model. So the answer has to be NO. Sleep on was not possible (for me anyway) so I passed the time reading and playing Solitaire on my mini tablet...interrupted occasionally by glancing at the TV screen to monitor the aircraft's progress. The wheels finally touched down at Bangkok airport and we all disembarked. * En-route to the city hotel by taxi, I was wrangling with the events on the flight and now, in full daylight saw the results of the wine spill incident and reminded myself to email BA's UK office and inform them what had happened - and the cost of replacement. As of today (almost a month later) all I have received is an acknowledgement and an incident number. I'll wait a while longer before I trigger the sarcasm bit. Some days prior to my return flight I had a fall â€“ a bad one as I crashed onto a marble floor, my left hip bone taking the brunt. From that moment, I was in severe pain and could only walk a few paces with the aid of a walking stick. 'What was my 13 plus hour flight to the UK going to be like?' I kind of fretted. I emailed BA immediately to advise them of the incident, asking for special assistance at Bangkok airport, throughout the flight at Heathrow, where a car would be waiting to collect me. Guess what?...no reply, not even an acknowledgment. Anxious, I emailed again the next day...and the next day...still no reply. I was concerned, not knowing was worrying. Explaining to the hotel management, it too was concerned and made numerous telephone calls on my behalf to BA's Bangkok office....No response. Nevertheless, a taxi was arranged. The driver deposited me at the nearest drop off point to reach the BA check-in. Very kind and thoughtful. Surprise, surprise, when I limped to the Club Class desk, the Thai girl manning it immediately beckoned a wheelchair porter standing nearby and welcomed me with the words, â€œSawadee ka, Mister Fisher, I received the message about you from your hotel. Please, everything is arranged for you.â€ How nice eh? Luggage tagged, wheelchair occupied, I was pushed at a steady pace through immigration etc, where all the Thai staff were gracious and helpful, and onwards to the lounge which BA uses for its Club Class passengers. Relieved and relaxed I imbibed a whisky, ate a fresh salad and read a newspaper. At the arranged the porter appeared, helped me into the wheelchair and off we went to board the aircraft. Word had been sent ahead, as when having my boarding pass examined, the porter was given the authority to take me straight to the aircraft door. There, awaiting, was the BA Thai duty manager, a delightful girl with a charming smile. A few Bahts into the porter's hand prompted a wide smile and a genuine Wai and I was helped to my seat on row one. When seated, the Thai manager came to me and we began a conversation. It centred on the total lack of concern by BA's UK Customer Service. She was certainly deeply embarrassed that I had not been dealt with properly. I was the only passenger on board and I did notice the BA cabin crew glancing in our direction and talking among themselves. Boarding complete, the captain announced a timely departure and a probable earlier than scheduled arrival at Heathrow. At cruising altitude, the senior cabin crew supervisor came to me. It became clear that she now had been appraised of my problem by the Thai duty manager because she expressed her concern, asking me to call for assistance at any time during the flight. The flight. Same old 777, same rattles, uncomfortable seat, small, rickety entertainment screen, mediocre food, galley running out of the snacks clearly advertised as being available at the touch of a button. I found it impossible to lay without pain but that was not the fault of BA, but a softer, wider seat would have helped. Throughout this daytime flight, the cabin crew concerned did acknowledge each of my needs and were kind and careful. Heathrow at around 1730 hrs and the scramble to disembark began. I was beckoned to leave my seat as a wheelchair was ready and waiting so I did, and managed to get myself and my luggage to the aircraft's exit...BUT...no wheelchair...someone else had commandeered it. That left me in the middle of a scrum of passengers trying to get to the ramp first. I had no option but to limp up that quite long ramp, where at its end, stood an empty electric buggy. Fred Carno comes to mind again, as when three of us needing help gathered there and waited. Finally, a man of Asian origin arrived and he set off along the mile long passageway to the immigration desks. The buggy was allowed though a special gate and the immigration officer soon had us cleared to proceed to the baggage collection carousel. That was it - end of special assistance. We three were on our own, As our luggage came into view we helped each other load it onto our trolleys, said our goodbyes and hobbled away. That is my narrative as to flying British Airways club class. I've nothing but praise for those kind Thai people who ensured I received as much help as needed. BA staff and senior management however, only attract my disdain. Uncaring, dismissive, rude and snobbish. The CEO's office, refutes the appalling and negative reviews by passengers, stating that BA was flying more passengers than ever. My reply to that, Mr Cruz, is what Eric Morecambe would have said, 'RUGGISH'. The olympic games ranks medals - Gold, Silver and Bronze. My ranking for British Airways, is TIN.
Flew in the route Lisbon-London and everything was great!

The seats were not that comfortable.  I flew business and had to pay to select a seat a few months out. Like paying for a business seat wasn't enough.  You can only select your seats 24 before the flight for free.  The lounge at Heaththrow is old and run down.  Food selection was bad.  The employees failed to announce my flight.  So I asked about it at 3:30 when I noticed something on the screens and was told they were already boarding "I should hurry up)  of course you have to take the train to the terminal when I got there everyone was boarding.  Don't feel I got my moneys worth for flying business.  Also the movies from LA to London were the same ones shown on the return flight.  They should change the movies.  The food on the fight and the staff were good.  I could have done without the crying baby who managed to cry every 30 minutes for 10 hours.  Needless to say I did not sleep.  Also the air in the cabin kept going from hot to cold.

Flew to Mumbai via LHR T5 on a 777. I would usually travel Business on this route but was shocked to see that BA wanted GBP 2K for an economy ticket, so economy it was. I did however pre-pay GBP 40 for Window seat selection at an emergency exit to get the extra leg room and window (I get nervous without a window). When I reached my seat, there was no window and my legs were impeded by the emergency door slide. When I asked to be moved to an actual window seat, which I had paid for, the steward refused saying the flight was totally full. He lied, there was open window seats in Plus and Business (I am a BA frequent flyer). Same story on the return sector. As a very experienced BA traveller, I can tell you that Business is not all it is cracked up to be. The food is NOT restaurant quality, it is about as good as economy only served on plates with drinks in glasses, the 'Champagne' is cheap and nasty; sleeper seats are claustrophobically narrow - don't sit in the isle as your elbow will take a hammering from the trolleys, and the staff love to pass your food tray through the privacy curtain. Best value is WT Plus, seats comfortable, food about the same. First, okay but very expensive.

BA is safe, and the a/c are well maintained. Bus class seats bizarre. Food is down to British standard. Cabin crew attitude to 'colonials' is very poor. When will the Brits realise they don't 'rule the waves' any more? Heathrow arrival is plain nasty, like they don't want you to come. So I won't any more. Much nicer people in Ireland, France and Italy, and you can get there on nice airlines like Aer Lingus and Cathay. Pity British Midlands was taken over by BA.

I travelled from JFK(New York)-Mumbai and back to New York. My overall experience was good but not the best. JFK to Mumbai journey was very good and travel time was very less compared to other airlines. However, while returning my layovers were in London and Manchester. Layover time was so less to transfer planes on a huge airport like London(LHR). So obviously I missed my plane from London to Manchester. I was running whole time during layover still couldn't catch the plane. Although BA providef direct plane from London to JFK. Food is average being Indian Vegetarian. In flight entertainment sucks except few good english movies. Staff was friendly and plane was clean.

Las Vegas to Heathrow case 17700704 , World Traveller Plus, 9 hour 30 minutes NO screen, hand control broken, foot rest broken, sun blind came out in my hand, very grubby, no wifi either way, aircraft 19 years old, 1 year left in service, paid extra to pick our seats Â£45 each way. They insulted me with Â£100 e-voucher off my next flight WITH THEM to be used within the next year. Got in touch which took 45 minutes on hold and they refused to give my Â£100 back in cash. I've paid 2018 prices for a 20 year old service.

I am commenting about the onboard experience on BA domestic UK and short-haul EU flights where the onboard experience has been taken over by Marks & Spencer.

Yes, since e1, 2017, BA no longer has ANY customer service on these flights.  Rather, the flight attendants have become M&S surrogates trying to SELL you water for L1.20 rather than providing complementary drinks and a tiny bag of pretzels.  Now, you get exactly ZILCH complimentary.

Really, BA, have you no shame.  Has it become so clear to you that the customer be damned and all that is in it for you is money?  Nothing, nada, nichts. 

I am going to react by posting this comment and from now on, buying snacks and water at the airport and bringing it on board.  I will not be coerced into paying for the basic needs of air travel, namely, a glass of water and a pretzel, just because you see the need to line the pockets of the executives.

Hopefully, the blowback from this decision will be severe enough that BA will reconsider.  Time will tell.

I have flown this airline a number of times, and they are consistently high quality in many areas.  The number one thing is safety, takeoffs and landings were always well-controlled with no issues - ever.  While in flight overseas, occasional bumps would be dealt with through announcements, flight attendants checking to make sure passengers were wearing seat belts, which is not easy to do in Business or First Class.  On occasion, I was bumped up to First due to frequent flier status, unexpected but awesome.  Would recommend without hesitation.

Flew BA Premium Economy from Muscat to Heathrow. Old 777 aircraft in poor interior condition. No IFE working in mine nor my fellow passenger seat area. Cabin crew were great but don't have the resources to provide good customer service. Flew economy on the way back but delays caused due to broken "baggage loader" in Edinburgh and broken "air bridge" in Heathrow meant we didn't have sufficient time to use the airport lounge. Very poor food service on the flight to Muscat. Cabin crew informed me that "they aren't supposed to give out snacks to economy passengers" I am a Silver card holder and have just spent my Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â£2400 on Qatar Airways business class Muscat-Edinburgh return. Good bye BA.

We booked flights through British Airways from Manchester to Sydney and Melbourne to Manchester. Four of the six flights were with BA and the long-haul flights with BA were far better than those with Cathay Pacific (Hong Kong to Sydney) or Qantas (Melbourne to Hong Kong). The staff were very helpful on these flights and accommodated dietary requirements that were not pre bookable for economy passengers. The steward managed to get food from another section of the plane for me. The other airlines did not do this. The airline could do more to avoid foods that have high allergy occurrences, and vary the vegetables and fruit on offer. A list of ingredients would also be useful. The selection of TV and films was much improved on last year's range.

TLV-LHR-GIG, Good service, second time flying them, no complaints at all, crew on the Brazil bound flight very friendly but none spoke Portuguese which is a must on flights to Brazil, planes were 777's the first one old but the second one brand new and comfortable. My sole complaint would be about the AVOD system, they have new movies there but very limited selection, if they want to compete with the Gulf carriers they gotta step it up.

This is about the flight we didn't take, due to the C19 virus.
Three of us were booked in F-class from Santiago, Chile to Heathrow for June. As soon as BA gave me notice of cancellation I called for a refund. The kind lady answered on the second ring, took my information and said a full refund would be made within 2-3 weeks. The entire call took five minutes. Then, on the very next day, it was credited to my credit card. Talk about first-class service. We take this flight fairly often and, hoping BA returns to Chile look forward to doing so in the future. For me BA gets Five Stars.

British Airways cancelled our return flight and with less than 48 hours notice, and managed to lose our luggage (eventually found days later) on the return leg we did eventually take. These issues were ridiculous enough, but I believe British Airways still owes us compensation under the Canada Transportation Act, and the customer service experience they've provided in pursuing these claims has been another level of insulting.

I filed the above noted claims over 60 days ago and not received so much as a reply from their mysterious "Customer Relations" department, who Customs Service keeps telling me nobody can contact directly, not even Customer Service agents themselves. Time after time I've been told their timeframe for handling cases is 3 - 6 weeks, but we're well past that, with nary a care from the company. Customer Service keeps telling me they'll escalate it and I'll hear back from Customer Relations within 7 days or something to that effect. It's been "escalates" 3 times now, and I've not heard back. They claim that a manager will call me back within a day to discuss my complaint, and it never happens.

This flight was a pleasant change from those I have experienced with British Airways in the last couple of years. On this flight service standards have lifted materially. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The quality of the food and beverages had similarly lifted. What had not changed was the standard and the (lack of) comfort of the seat. The Club Europe seat remains a standard economy seat with a blocked off middle seat. It is cramped and most uncomfortable and represents poor value for the significant premium paid. You get minimal benefit from travelling Club Europe.

Flew LHR to Bucharest today.
All went very well. On time, friendly staff, nice food.

I travelled lot of times ba in past I noticed :
1 . Dreamliner seats are comparatively smaller than previous models
2 . Media box in bottom of the economy seat is frustrating for long haul flights
3. Food is where BA has cut down aggressively , for breakfast earlier we used to get sandwiches with some other fillers ,now muffins or energy bar (are you kidding me !! )
4. Earlier tooth brush and paste was provided now they don't have it anymore
5. earplugs instead of headphones on a noisy flight ( earlier they used to give headphones )

Seems to me BA wants to enjoy more profits hence cutting down on services .

Will prefer Emirates or some other carriers

They are by far the WORST airline I have ever dealt with, even for value for money. And I have flown internationally on COUNTLESS airlines (including Turkish Airways, Emirates, Thai Airways, Singapore Airlines, Japan Airlines, El Al, Qantas, Tiger, Jetstar, the list goes on and onâ€¦).  They have all been amazing.  Even the worse of these ones have been WAY better than British Airways.  Their customer service didn't honour a refund I was entitled to let alone try to offer me flight credit as a compromise.  They inadvertently told me to piss off.  You will highly regret even choosing to fly with British Airways.

1.We arrived late to LHR,did not leave on time from DC.  We lost our flight in LHR to LIN at 7:20a and we were told to wait until 2pm and we got 10 pounds to spend. In Italy my family waited from 10 to 3pm and had to travel between airports LIN to MXP (68.1 km).  2.Lost luggage. We did not have luggage for our entire 7 days tours in Italy. I spent my tours vacation time exchanged several emails with the BA and the delivery company because the receiver address had a typo. 3.Finally, our return flight to DC was delayed almost 1 hour waiting seated the airplane just because the Capitan decided it was an emergency to wait for the family that needed to get their taxes refund to get their luggage from the airplane.
I filed a complaint after my trip and we got less of what we spend just in our flight (1),  evoucher for our luggages, $70 coupon and 50 euros on personal items for the 8 days-  our luggages were delivered 5 days after arrived.

Paid approx Â£1100 for a return LHR-LAS V/ 747-400. The trip felt like a memorial flight for the 90's. Uncomfortable seats, average food and service. Oxygen masks fell down during a fight between passengers three rows behind me, due to excessive amouns of alcohol served by the staff. All in all a great example of how not to operate an airline!

I was disappointed with this airline for 1 the cabin staff splashed hot water on my grandaughter and another passenger. The staff are not as friendly as other airlines eg: Qatar. I will not use you again. Thank you

I have flown with BA for decades and everything about the experience has been steadily declining.  Recently they have cynically used their customer history data about me to assign me my least favourite seat of choice, forcing me to pay for a seat that I used to be able to select as part of the price of my ticket. But worse than that, their punctuality has been consistently terrible. They somehow manage to run flight after flight that is late enough to ruin my trip home to see my kids or my working day, but just not quite late enough for compensation to kick in.
I'm done with BA. There comes a point at which you can only take so many insults heaped on your head with numbing regularity and a complete refusal to deal with complaints.
BA is the new Ryanair.

Return ticket from Heathrow to Bangkok (honeymoon) asked if we could upgrade to premium, told yes but an extra Â£220 each. This was no problem yet the ground staff stated there was no point on the 777 as very little difference. How wrong they were. The seating difference was more spacious and x2 rows instead of x3.

The 777 was old and held an atmosphere of early-mid 90's. I was staring dissapointingly at the A380's and more modern fleets of Emirates etc as we took off.

Seats uncomfortable, the wife suffered back pain there and back (excuse the pun).

Food was pretty good to be fair.

Wont be flying BA longhaul again, shorthaul not such an issue.

Absolutely disappointing experience. Flight was delayed by more than 2 hours but ground staff must unfriendly and unwilling to help arrange transport options even though plane touched down after midnight with no public transport options available. Reason was claimed to be weather but both Aberdeen and London experienced good weather, with no other flights being delayed in both locations. Concocted reason to fool passengers. Would not recommend this airline previous two flights have been delayed for at least an hour each.
The customer service was really good and i enjoyed my flight. I will definetely fly with British Airways again!

A recent BA Flight, Business Class, as a second leg of a flight into the UK.

Whoever designed the business class configuration ought to be taken out and spoken severely too.  It is an abomination.  Our first leg was in QATAR Q Suites.  Imagine our shock when we sat down in BA business class only to find you are staring straight at your fellow passenger.  Whose idea was this?  It is appalling. Also, comfort level was - well can you give a minus score. Never go BA if you are a business class traveler.

Avoid carrier if at all possible. They belong to "One World"-- they will book your flight with multiple carriers and take zero responsibility for anything that goes wrong. American Airlines changed our itinerary and gave us each 3 boarding passes with seat assignments. We tried to board the second flight and are told we didn't have tickets. American said they didn't have our tickets and British Airways closed three hours previously. I contacted BA. They claim no fault on their part.

British Airways - the best company! Helpful staff, cozy flight conditions, this is not all! Traveled with a friend to Barbados were we find ourselfs in one of the worst situations: on the way back we missed our plane, ours way  consisted of two parts - we have missed not one but 2 flights! Employees of the company British Airways free rebooked us for new flights, calmed us and helped to cope with the situation! I thank them very much! Would recommend!

Unbelievably Poor Service from British Airways

I recently travelled from Munich to London with British Airways, and it turned into an absolute nightmare. Our troubles began with their malfunctioning app. Despite checking in successfully, I was unable to retrieve our boarding passes.

Upon arrival at the airport, we discovered that there were no self-service kiosks, and the check-in desks were completely unattended. After seeking help from the information desk, we were directed to a staff member who clearly did not want to assist us. Her dismissive attitude was infuriating, and despite showing her the app indicating we were checked in, she simply told us to call customer service and walked away without providing any assistance.

After being put on hold for 25 minutes and being sent to several different staff members who couldnâ€™t help us, we finally reached someone on the phone who was kind but ultimately powerless to resolve our issue. By this point, our flight was delayed, and we had wasted two hours just trying to print our boarding passes.

When I followed up with a complaint, British Airways basically dismissed my concerns and told me to use the app next timeâ€”ignoring the fact that it was the app's failure that caused all these problems in the first place!

This experience cost us a staggering Â£682.43 in additional expenses, including new flights, hotel stays, taxi fares, and fines. Missing work and explaining this absurd situation to my employer was incredibly embarrassing.

British Airways clearly needs to improve its customer service and technology. If their app and website are going to fail, they must provide adequate support at the airport. I will never fly with them again, and I urge others to consider alternative airlines.

Flew Santiago to London Heathrow return. Both 14+ hour non-stops on a 787-9. I flew first class which was a cozy cabin of eight passengers/2-3 flt attendents. The outbound from Chile was perfect in every way. When I got to the airplane door, the flt attd insisted on carrying my carry-on to my seat. Only negative is minor, just that they improve on the traditional British meals. I'm half English but have moved on...lol Return from London wasn't quite as good, mainly due to an indifferent flight crew. The Concorde Lounge in T5 is really nice and since it was a late night flight I slept for about eight hours. All in all, a really great experience from check-in to arrival to leaving the airports. We're (3 of us) taking a family vacation next month and we'll fly the same route/flights. One way in first and the other in Club World. Maybe some day BA will enter the 21st Century and offer a modern business class experience. Listening, Willie?

We have just flown Australia/Europe and had one leg (SYD-SIN) code share on BA 777-200. It was the best flight of our trip - lovely crew, great food, noticeably quiet plane and generous seats and legroom. Perhaps we were lucky our flight didn't go near Heathrow so no luggage problems!

From bad to worse, little is now good about B A, especially their back office staff, service on the flight is o k, but I assume they are dealing with so many customer complaints, they cannot handle the volume.

Other airlines have moved forward, B A are going backwards sadly.

Certainly not up to the higher end business class airlines.
Even United is considerably better.
Stupidest design of business class seats in any airline, in that almost all of the seats require you to crawl over someone to get out.

1st class service 1st class flight but i find it difficult to except the additional charge of Ã‚Â£77 each , each-way to reserve my seats after paying for business class although this service is free 24 hours before the flight but in reality most seats had gone 3 days before the flight there were 4 of us traveling together so an extra Ã‚Â£600 plus to reserve seats after paying for business class was a bitter pill to swallow to put this all into context there was one couple traveling in business class who had not paid to prebook seats had to stand in the toilet area and wait till everybody had boarded then the 2 remaining seats were there's.It is a pity BA have ruined an excellent service with shear greed in attempting to extract every last penny from there premium paying customers in effect BA will now not be my preferred carrier.

Totally amazing flight with family and friends, on way to Kenya for a wedding but was also celebrating my 50th birthday
I have to say the cabin crew were fantastic .. Smiling throughout the long flight. Especially one certain member of staff that we hope we get the pleasure of flying with again. A massive thank you to Jeroen  Meulebrouck .

Over-priced. Seats narrow an hard. Food crap. Entertainment only fair. Service negligible and perfunctory. Toilets on board ended up filthy.  Baggage lost almost every time I fly via Heathrow. NEVER flying BA again.

BA changed a flight time months ahead which was very inconvenient. When I rang the so called Executive Club they agreed to change the ticket for the additional cost of the ticket with no extra charges. Whilst the online itinerary changed when I arrived at the airport I was told I didn't have a ticket. They told me my payment had not gone through but hadn't informed me. They insisted on charging all associated fees even though it was agreed that would not be the Case. i complained to Customer services who wouldn't remove the charges, gave me lots of platitudes of how wonderful their complaint system is and how seriously they take them but failed to explain their actions or do anything about it. APPALLING CUSTOMER service. and I will do my best never to fly with them again.

I have been flying with British Airways for several years now.  Before that I was flying SWISS Air.   The change was due to business in London.  I have witnessed a major decline is services on flight and more importantly on utilizing "Avios" (frequent mileage).  For the last 5 years I have been unable to utilize frequent mileage for anything, even upgrading.  I have at this point in time over 150 000 "Avios", and I cannot use them.  I just got off the phone with one of BA's representative (Amreen-D5), who was unable to give me ANY day in the summer of 2015 from April -August that I could purchase a Premium Economy Ticket and upgrade to Business with "Avios".  This is absolutely ridiculous.  For those of you that you may hope that you will join the club and be able to use your "Avios" with British Airways, GOOD LUCK!!!

Unimpressed, particularly with food.  I recommended this Airline to two of my friends as the previous flight I had with British, (mind you some years earlier), had been most impressive.  However, on this occasion the flight to Singapore had staff who seemed totally disinterested and when we asked for a light snack, were shortly told there was nothing!  Our return journey back to Sydney provided us with more friendly staff however a glossed over apology was offered for the flight being 2 hours late.  The food was dreadful and, as my friend put it, they give prisoners better food. British have just lost 3 future potential customers.
!

Business class long overdue a refit. Loose seats, wobbly monitors and broken foot stools, and that awful nose to toe configuration. BA has been skimping on its profitable customers for years. I gave up on flying the profitable long haul after my March flight this year from Boston.

Booked a first class round trip flights from Orlando to Venice through Gatwick.  On way over bags were lost and not received for 5 days.  On return home bags lost again.  British Airways offered no compensation in foreign country other than buy what is NEEDED and submit receipts to get processed for return payment.  When you live where they lose your bags you are offered NOTHING and cannot go out and buy anything you may NEED as they do not compensate you at all.  Flight on way to Gatwick was so hot and flight crews response was that they could do nothing as it was set at 23 degrees centigrade and that is their temperature.  Food in first class should was disgusting to the point the tomato in a salad was rotten.  When you called baggage assistance from a foreign country you were on hold for 30 minutes waiting for someone to answer if they did.  If this is what you get for first class I am not sure what you would get in coach but this is an airline that should be avoided!

Flew economy class  to Mauritius from London. Plane was very new , staff were excellent and so was the food. Even had proper steel cutlery. It felt like business class compared to other airlines economy class.

Very bad service with delayed luggage. For some reason the person at london heathrow send my suitcase under someone else's name and to a different destination. I was flying from london to montreal and my suitcase was sent to Dublin. First guy I talked on the phone, after a week of no news at all, he told me that the suitcase was found but was left there at the airport and no further action was taken... Were they waiting for me to ask them to send it or something??... In theory, he sent an email asking the airport to send my suitcase to montreal. But after another week of no further news and website still saying suitcase is missing, I decided to call them again to find out that my suitcase, was still in Dublin. A second email, was sent to get my suitcase send it to me. A couple of days after and of course, with no news at all from them, I decided to call them back again. This time my suitcase wasn't in dublin, it was sent to london heathrow and they lost it again at that airport... Great!! This guy, asked me to call them back, monday morning , london time, so I did. I called back again on monday morning, and after being about 10 minutes waiting for the guy to connect to his london team, he asked me to go to the website to add description of the items in my suitcase, when I had done that same day I placed the delayed luggage report. Don't they have all this info in file?. After telling him that I did that, first day, he then asked me to call them back in 48h again... I'm tired of going behind them like if it was my fault they lost my suitcase. No compensation was mentioned to me, even that I had to buy clothes and some other items that I already had in my suitcase. Lucky enough, this happened in my final destination and at the end of my trip, otherwise they would make my vacation quiet miserable. I understand, there is a huge number of suitcases traveling around everyday but that's no reason to let you wondering and waiting forever to get what's yours. I think this whole experience would have been much more satisfying if they showed some empathy and instead of making me wait and call them all the time, I would have get a call or email from them every once in a while following up with me. After this awful experience with their missing luggage department, I hardly doubt I will use british airways again.

I have become one of the latest victims of British Airways as they lost my suitcase on August 3, 2014. I was traveling on a business trip from Boston to Newcastle, UK, through London Heathrow (Terminal 5). Since then I have filed a lost baggage report and a claim report trying to recover my losses. I have heard nothing from British Airways for over a month now.

777 flight from Mexico to Gatwick. Paid for 3 club class seats, on arrival in the 777 we were struck by the smell of vomit. We brought this to the attention of the cabin staff, who called cleaners back on but they were unable to deal with it. Over the next 9 hours we were treated to various sprays and covering with blankets over the floor, which did nothing to alleviate the problem. We were unable to eat or drink properly as we were all feeling unwell due to the smell. We were offered a single seat compensation by the stewardess circa Ã‚Â£400 e-voucher, which I thought was appalling considering I had paid for 3 club class seats all of which were affected but was informed this was the maximum they are allowed to offer in flight. On return I took up the matter with BA customer services, who have since lowered the offer to Ã‚Â£300 e-voucher. It has also taken them weeks to come back to me via e-mail. BA customer service is poor, there does not seem to be any real offer of compensation or any standard or understanding of common policy. Why were we offered more by the cabin staff? Probably because they could see and smell the situation first hand and realised how appalling the situation really was, whilst those who sit and are removed from the front line have no grasp of the damage they do to the business as a whole by adopting their don't care attitude. Needless to say, BA have lost a loyal long term customer to other airlines - such is the state of British management who are content to ruin their own business.
Flew round Trip from Philadelphia To Heathrow,London...I cannot Fault British Airways,Excellent Service,Flight Attendants Awsome.I Have And always Will Fly BA!.

Poor Business class services, food, drinks, and entertainment content. No free wifi, and crowded noisy below standard, filthy bathrooms. Old airplanes even the A380 is designed in strange with seats looking to the back of the airplane, with uncomfortable seats. The 777 was somehow better. The ground services is horrible, with no gates numbers showing untill the boarding time, so be ready to run to catch your flight.

Flown BA A380 LHR-HKG and back - excellent excellent excellent.
BA 777 twice from LHR-BOM and back - excellent food, service and IFE.

My first choice of airline is always always always BA.

Had high hopes for my first flight with BA to Japan but was sadly disappointed. The food was good, the in flight entertainment was average, the cabin crew weren't the friendliest and in one case was extremely rude. Overall not the best experience.

LHW3 to Denver in First Class:- Check-in â€“ slower than economy and staff disinterested providing no apology for time taken to check in with no premium security or lounge info provided. Staff member was truly awful and her colleague appeared little better Security â€“ dedicated for premium passengers and was quick Lounge â€“ quiet and a nice experience with plenty of food and drink available. Spa - a complete joke. Filling out the form took almost as long as the 10 min disinterested massage Boarding â€“ slightly disorganised at gate with everyone cramming to get through doors and down to plane Onboard â€“ staff were excellent, very welcoming and attentive Food and drink â€“ no shortage of either. Whilst dine when you want is advertised it was not really offered and from what I could make out everyone ate at the same time Seat â€“ comfortable and bed was very good unless I would imagine you are on the large size. Turn down was a nice touch but others did miss out on their size pjâ€™s because they ran out In flight entertainment â€“ awful (think betamax rather than blueray). Very limited number of very average films available Arrival â€“ allowed off the plane first and then a long walk to immigration. Denver immigration was very quick and efficient as was luggage collection. Looking back though the queue was getting longer as the rest of the plane arrived. Get off and walk quickly! Return Check in â€“ excellent and very friendly (T3 could learn a lot!) Security â€“ premium passengers can skirt round a lot of the queue but then join the masses the closer you get to the machines Lounge â€“ very average with first and business all in together. Got a seat at the bar where the service was good Boarding â€“ quick and efficient and First were allowed to board first Onboard â€“ again staff were excellent (3 crew for 8 passengers was great) Food and drink â€“ similar to way out with plenty of food and drink Arrival â€“ T3 immigration was quick and efficient as was bag collection All in all BA First is an experience but at times it moved from first class to average class. First class should be first in everything not some. If I had been paying cash I would have been disappointed.

Stuck in Houston Hobby Airport and I am trying to get home asap.  My mother fell and broke her hip.  Southwest will not help.  They want 301.00 to get an earlier flight. I came to the airport early to try to get a earlier flight,  now stuck here in the only restaurant until 7:50 PM.  This airline has no heart.
Love SW they don't mess around with an hour to board the attitude is get on let's go get off..Perfect!

For everyday people traveling for vacation or personal reason, this is the top airline.  They are affordable, friendly, and comfortable.  No first or business class.  Just a flight on a nice, updated, clean aircraft.  My average flight is about 1-3 hours, but I would fly with Southwest on an international flight.  If you are looking First Class and Business Class they aren't the airline, but if you can make do with WIFI and your own forms of entertainment they are the best airline.  No matter what the reason for my travel, I will choose SW if they offer travel to my destination.

I am a rapid rewards member and called in with issues to my reservation. I usually only fly southwest but after my conversation with one of the Supervisors "Laqueda" she has made it very clear my business does not matter. She went in to say it is all my fault and was completely condescending as she was saying it and never even apologized for the issues I was having. I have always paid a little more to fly southwest but because of how they handle they're customers, I would stay far away from this airline.

Southwest is having increasingly more difficulty being on time. And they are not putting in the same effort to fix their on going tardiness. I am switching to another airline for primary business travel as I simply cannot continue to be late for meetings. If more of us take our business elsewhere Southwest will be cured of their cavalier attitude.
EDITORS COMMENT: Good idea!
The flight attendants were passive aggressive. Horrible experience.  The seat saving thing should be addressed.

I always had flights delayed.  I don't like that.  They blame it always on something else other than their incompetence.  I would rather fly Delta.   They have more flights,  more reliable and nicer customer service.

People complain about some silly stuff. To the lady complaining about flying with kids and not being able to sit with them - Southwest offers family boarding between Groups A and B, which leaves plenty of seats together to sit. We have also never had a problem with asking a flight attendant to assist, and they ask everyone seated to change seats to offer a family seats together; itâ€™s too easy. Southwest has been great for me. I have a slight fear of flying, so it makes me feel a lot better knowing that Southwest has more strict standards for hiring pilots, and in their 40+ years of flying, they have 0 fatalities. It is also super amazing that they offer 2 free checked bags, unlike all the other major airlines, AND they donâ€™t charge you any fees for cancelling flights, or changing flights. Now, yes, if you cancel, you donâ€™t get refunded, but your money goes into your account to use towards your next purchase... but thatâ€™s still awesome. Despite my fear of flying, I do still fly 6-10 times a year, and if Southwest flies there, I choose them 10 times out of 10.

Overall good experience with staff and crew at Southwest.  They helped us take our elderly and sick father on one last vacation.  Coming home we got delayed flying into Baltimore and the baggage desk there was TERRIBLE.   They were incredibly slow, Kept us waiting without explanation and Tiana was downright hostile to us about our luggage.  Angry people shouldn't be working in customer service areas.  Shame on you Southwest!

I booked a flight in May 2015 for June. I was told I could not use my 'travel funds' from a cancelled trip they because expired on June 3 (1 year from the purchase date for a flight in 9/2014). So if I purchase tickets prior to June 3 it should be fine right? NO! I have to travel by June 3, which was not possible for us & stupid since the original dates booked were in September.
