I tried to gift the funds but that didn't work either, ONLY the funds in my name could be applied to my trip. So basically there was no way to utilize the travel funds at this point and customer service was HORRIBLE. I contacted them via them the 1-800 number and was told I need to call Customer Relations. I tried multiple times to times to contact them (>20 calls) only to get a busy signal for 2 days. When they finally answered after a 15 minute hold for a 'expired travel funds' line, I was told (by a manager) June 3 was a 'hard date' and there was nothing she could do, or for transferring travel funds (both based on a policy by a Federal Dept....). The time I want to travel is 3 weeks after 6/3. It's nonsense they can't find any resolution, and lost a customer, credit line, and purchase/$$$ because of it!

I have been flying Southwest Airlines for the last 3 years. I have a neurological condition which requires me to use a wheelchair at the airport. I told them and they pre boarded me and my daughter. They also have excellent customer service. Clean airplanes . Great fares. I would not change it.
I have flown Southwest for last 3 years. 79 times last year. Good value for what you get.

Haven't been on SW in a number of years as I live overseas.  My flights were BUR to OAK to BOI and return.  All four flights pushed back and arrived early.  I paid the extra $25 for auto check-in which got me in the first 35-40 to board.  The usual friendly and professional service from all ground and flight staff.  It's better than ever in my opinion and this from someone who used to fly 50+ flight segments a year on Southwest.   Still the best....
EDITORS COMMENT: Great to hear such positive feedback.

Great experience aboard southwest flight 323 from fll to aus..first off I fly southwest alot and cannot complain about any  prior Flights..but this flight was the best by far..2 main reasons flight attendants Pierce,hae young Wagner.and usry,Jane..after a week in the Caribbean and about to face reality again,the last thing I wanted was to  sit on a crowded plane for 3 hours.. we flew on Superbowl SundayAnd thought if we got some score updates we wud be happy.. the only device my friend and I had were our cell phones..but to our surprise Mrs.usry pulled out her lrg iPad and said u guys can watch the game on a bigger screen..my friend & I again want to says thx Mrs.usry u made a 3 hr flight feel like 30 mins..and last but not least ms.Pierce,hae young.. you topped off a great flight with your  great sense of humor  that kept us laughing and smiling while being professional at the same time..with 30 yrs with southwest I hope the airline  realizes what they have in you under their wing.. my friend and I hope that we come across you both someday in a future flight until then fly safe be happy and enjoy life...

My fiance and I got an offer to fly private to NYC but still needed our return flight back o Texas. So we "no-showed" because we only had an option to cancel both flights and not just the 1st flight. So they then cancelled our return flight as well and kept $1,200. They were then semi-rude on the phone. This policy is a joke and I have done this 2 other times for a past United flight and they did not do this. No wonder Southwest stock is half as much as United stock. Terrible & greedy company.

Southwest and love field handled the bad weather on December 26th very very poorly, in over 30 years of business travel this was the worst I have ever seen.  Bad weather happens, its how its handled that counts.

Southwest Airlines is the most family friendly airline. I appreciate the separate family boarding that gave myself and my husband time to settle our daughter in. The flight attendents on my family's flight from DCA to Austin (and back) were kind and considerate. Overall, I felt the entire crew were understanding  of how nerve racking getting on a flight with a toddler can be. Thank you, Southwest! See you on our next flight!

Stay away from Southwest Airlines!
I own & run a travel agency and we work with several airlines world wide. I am sorry to say, but we never have we experienced such bad service as we have from Southwest.
I booked a flight to fly on Dec 2nd from San Diego to Seattle, and return on Sept 5th. Unfortunately I had to postpone my departure one day. Since I had purchased a low price ticket I bought a new one-way ticket for Dec 3rd from SW, and was planning to use the return flight which I originally purchased, which is normal for most airlines. As expected, I received a cancellation notice from SW since I did not show up from my original departure on Dec 2nd. But here comes the shocker, SW cancelled also my return flight, which I was planning to use. Even if I also had booked a new departure with them, so I had a round trip flight. So, I called their customer service to have them fix it, and got NO help. I was told the money and flight is lost since I did not show up for my original departure. Not satisfied with this response, I also sent a complaint by mail to SW to give them a chance to redeem themselves. Got the same answer, the flight & the money is lost.
EDITORS COMMENT: Most airlines we come in contact with cancel the whole ticket so we are not surprised with what Southwest did. We don't agree with this practice though and would like to see it stopped.

We were like cattle being driven onto the plane.  We were packed into such small spaces that the rats could never get off the ship in case of emergency.   We left from Boston and arrived in St Louis, MO.
When I called SWA to ask about choosing seats, I was told that travelers board together and will sit together.  Early Bird Boarding was never mentioned.  Without Early Bird Boarding you are last to board and stand absolutely no chance of sitting with your companion, nor of finding a place for your carry-on anywhere near your seat.
I WILL NEVER FLY ON SWA AGAIN. I'D GLADLY PAY HUNDREDS OF DOLLAR MORE TO AVOID SOUTHWEST AIRLINES.

They have lost all customer service. Rude staff across all departments.  Beware and good luck if you fly Southwest anymore.  You might have your vacation unexpectedly cancelled like ours.  And they don't care what happens to you anymore.  They've forgotten that their customers are real people.

Southwest is a great low cost airline, their WannaGetAway fares are hard to beat. I myself, like their boarding system. Sit where you want if you are in Group A or even B. They allow the largest carry on bag size along with one other airline. No fee ticket change, two free checked luggage and have one year to use a ticket if you cancel flight. I don't need frills or perks on domestic flights under 4 hours. The idea to fly is to get from one place to another and Southwest does a great job. To their BOSS, get some seats that are more comfortable.

I fly southwest at least once a year. Only airline I don't get anxiety on.Almost every time I fly with them it's a smooth flight. The customer service is always on point. The gate agents , flight attendants , and pilots all have a sense of humor. NO baggage fees, everyone is treated equally. Free drinks (non- alcoholic) and snacks (peanuts and pretzels ). Your flight will 99.9 percent of the time arrive early unless your flight is delayed, but even at times we still arrived on time if not few minutes after original schedule. With that being said if you want to save money & have an enjoyable flight southwest is your airline !

Always fly to/from New Orleans to Orlando and always enjoy the flight. Depending on the flight crew, 90% of the times they are happy and make the flight enjoyable. Seats could be a little more comfortable. Happy they do not charge for check in luggage.

For anyone flying with children over the age of 5, DON'T FLY SOUTHWEST. It's open seating so if there are no seats together by the time you board, your kid's sitting by themselves. The answer I got when I called was, that's the way it is, that's the way it's always been, and you have to pay extra if you want to board first to ensure you can sit with your child.

To Whom IT May Concern:
Thank you for giving me a free Leinenhugel Summer Shandy, when asked to pay with my SW credit card, she said she would be back but never asked again.  That was very nice, possibly it was an oversight but I doubt it due to the need to keep stock records.  Best Regards - It was confirmation 413XLB on Sunday May 28th from Tampa to Raleigh Durham.  Much appreciated.  Sincerely, Patricia Waitkevich

Does well for low cost flight but lacks one attribute - customer conciliation for non-delivery.  I frequently took flights St Louis to San Antonio for 1 yr, due to change in work I cancelled last flight.  Funds are relocated to Travel funds which expire in one year - thats it "nada, zero, not even a thank you". Southwest you can at least give me some points for future use!
Also, the seats are getting tighter and not so comfortable at all.

On 11/09/17 Iï¸ traveled from St. Louis to Raleigh, North Carolina with my mother. Southwest rocked it from beginning to end! Baggage check in outside was so easy and the guys were so helpful! The ladies in screening were so nice and helpful to my mother who had to go to a separate area. When Iï¸ finished in screening the screener was holding her hand and walked her over to me! Thanks ladies! The lady at boarding also allowed us to board early because of moms disability! You made it an easy experience for someone that was a bit nervous traveling with my mother. Thank you so much.

I flew Los Angeles to Las Vegas return, The fares were cheap, the flights were full, experienced their flight attendants sense of humor and was served a drink on each sector. Would I fly with them again - yes

Beware to those of you who think you are "loyal" Southwest fliers! Take it from the lady who flew SW for years & recently got burned by them. They pride themselves on their customer service, but let me tell you it is a front. I booked a flight with my 18,000 points (yes that's right POINTS because I WAS a LOYAL customer) & I went through the entire process per usual. I happen to log onto my SW account yesterday (2 months after I booked my flight) & noticed my points said zero when last time I looked I still had some points. When I called, they decided to inform me that a system error occurred & they allowed me to book an upcoming flight with points that would expire before the flight & there's nothing they can do about it even though it's THEIR system error and now I am out 20,000+ points. They went on to blame me for not knowing the expiration date and not knowing that you can't book flights with expired points (never did I receive an email or ANYTHING informing me of this). Their point system/customer service is a hoax. They continued to tell me theyre working to get this problem fixed but they would offer me the same fare price as when I booked it. Guess what it's the same price

Cabin crew were on the ball,no extra charges for food, bags etc, what you pay is the final amount.
Yes you cannot reserve a seat, but they tell you that so dont complain if you have to split up.
Seats were wider than most discount airlines, leather & comfortably padded unlike some full service airlines with the new style slim seats(slim padding)
Crew were funny & made a short 1 hour flight fun.

Best airline out there.  After having bad experiences with Allegiant, Spirit, and American, I decided to pay a bit extra to go with Southwest.  After realizing it, it actually saved me money.  2 checked bags and 1 carry on included in the price!  Plus, the nicest staff on planes and I have never had a Southwest flight delayed.  Also, their customer service and booking agents are very knowledgeable and know what they are talking about, unlike the other above mentioned airlines.

I have had so many bad experiences with other airlines.  Southwest is family and military-friendly.  Their baggage policy is unmatched.  Their pilots always come out and say hello to my kids while we are boarding and/or getting off the plane.  The free movies and shows have saved me on long flights with 4 kids. Check-in is so easy.  Everyone I have come in contact with who works there has been so kind and helpful.  I had to contact customer service twice and they were so helpful and fixed my situation right away.  We will always fly Southwest whenever possible!

Ok, been flying multiple airlines and I ALWAYS check Southwest Airlines first.    East of boarding, changing tickets, and use of refundable points/dollars when I reschedule has been phenomenal.    I sometimes have to fly other airlines, especially if Southwest does not offer a direct flight there but I usually have to medicate when I do.   I have never met friendlier staff either.    I wish they flew intercontinental.

For all of you that have submitted poor reviews for this airline, "boo-hoo". Sorry you feel the way you do, BUT, I must disagree with you all. I have flown with Southwest Airlines over the years, whether I was flying to Las Vegas, San Diego, or Tucson. I have never had a bad experience with them. The only negative thing I would say is that they do not have the best "leg room". But with 2 bags checked in for FREE; and 1 carryon at no cost, that is pretty darn GOOD, considering that the "other" guys charge you for ever 1 bag checked in. And their fares are lower too.

I would recommend Southwest Airlines and here is why.  They a real no frills airline because first 2 bags and your carry-on fly free and they don't charge for soft drinks and if you use wifi on the plane it' s 5 bucks and the crew is friendly.
Southwest Airlines is awesome. Never fly American Airline's when you have Southwest. Their flight attendants are the nicest people ever, they have great services, and the flights are very cheap.
I have flown Southwest for years.  I will always choose them, over other carriers if price is close.

This once great airline has swiftly declined into mediocrity during the COVID crisis evidently.  Great customer service and public relations is horrible.  Wait times for phone calls are 60-90 minutes, the CSRs are rude and uncaring, and the early check in is a scam.  I purchased an early check in, 36 hours rather than 24 hours, to ensure a better chance of a seat at the front of the plane. instead, you cannot verify it even occurred, and cannot see any validation until the 24 hour window.  I am a long time and loyal flyer of Southwest, but no more!

I've flown Southwest from my Midwestern abode to both east and west coasts in the last year. I'm always amazed at how courteous most of the gate agents are. I only had one with a slight attitude which is pretty darn good given the stress of the job. Seat room is decent; not the most comfortable perch ever but it works for a few hours. Free snacks and drinks are very nice too. Once you figure out the boarding process you can usually get a decent seat. Overall, it's a good value and I enjoy flying with Southwest.
Traveled on Dec 25th. Flight was full, customer service was great, flight staff was nice and friendly.

I made flight reservations 6/6/14 for my daughter and I for 11/27/14 from. Due to a family emergency, I had to cancel the flight and request a travel credit in the original amount of $586 in 09/14. When I spoke to the Southwest Airlines Customer Service rep to ask what my options were for reusing the travel credit I was told that as long as I made my flight reservations before 6/6/15, I could reuse the travel credit. I asked if the new flight would have to be scheduled before 6/6/15, and she said no, as long as I made my reservation before 6/6/15 I could apply the travel credit to the new flight since I have to pay for the flights at the time of reservation. I'm now trying to book new flights on 6/16/15 and Southwest Airlines is refusing to accept my travel credit of $586 towards the new flights since they expire on 6/6/15. This is exactly the opposite of what I was told by their Customer Service rep in September when I asked about cancelling the original flight. I've now lost $586 dollars. I feel like I've been robbed by Southwest Airlines.

Always have a great experience when flying with Southwest. The entire crew are very professional and accommodating. This is my very first choice when flying domestic, or to their island destinations. Keep up the great work!

Got to say I have not traveled with any other airlines than Southwest. Their rates are amazing cheap and the service is great! I usually fly from LAX to LAS a couple times a year and its been amazing everytime. Last trip I had to make a last minute purcahse to from back from LAS to LAX and I sat right in the front (open space) and due to being a late night flight and being with my fiance, I asked the staff member for a shot of Jack Daniels and he brought them with small heart straws and watched we got everything we needed before we landed in Los Angeles.

I've flown southwest from mke to las twice. Then, I also flew from mke to sac. Flight was reasonably priced for the trips and staffs were GREAT! I had a few hour delays here and there but not too bad. They offer great service onboard and gave free drinks.

Sadly, Southwest practices are unethical and I won't be flying with this airline again. The day I booked, I specifically shopped for a nonstop flight on various airlines. I could have booked a connecting flight for much less. However, we are traveling to my daughter's wedding with many bags of decorations, wedding clothes, etc., and we also wanted to avoid rechecking bags at a connection for an international flight, so we chose to pay more for a nonstop. Now that Southwest is losing money for grounding the Max 8, they changed our flight to a connecting flight without any compensation and refusing to change our flight to a nonstop out of a different airport. We are losing the money we could have had if we had bought a connecting fare in the first place and if take the option of canceling, we lose money on the fare increase since booking. So Southwest wins this round. But we will not be flying Southwest again due to this bait and switch unethical way of doing business.

Due to the terrible storms that recently took place in Dallas, Texas, I was unable to travel to California for two days. The flights the following days, of course, were full, and I had to cancel my trip. I was traveling on American Airlines to California first, and then Southwest from Burbank to San Jose Airport. Because I could not get to California in time to catch my Southwest Flight, I had to cancel it. It was canceled two days before I was to leave. I then received an email at the time the flight was supposed to take off in Burbank that said I had not canceled the flight and that I would lose all my money because I had not canceled it before the time of the departure. The huge storms in Dallas was not my fault, and Southwest should have at least credited my account for a future flight. They refused to do this. I won't be flying them anymore. There service has become increasingly worse during recent years, and there pricing policies (e.g., the business seats scam we all know about) are byzantine. Time for them to go under and disappear for all our sakes.

Very worst I have ever been treated was on Southwest in BWI It was between flights, I needed a wheelchair It was not available we were late to the gate the agent was extremely rude. I was in loading bridge I made a comment to my husband â€œ why does she have to be so
bâ€”â€”â€”hy â€œ , she heard the comment and forbid me to fly on the flight. I do not feel that my comment would somehow put anyone in danger. The agent did not like my comment she decided to use her power to punish me. I will NEVER forget this as long as I live. This was caused by her using the power of the FAA giving airline employees the right to treat passengers any way they want. I try to avoid flying on them the employees have become increasingly rude on the ground. The flight attendants are not as bad but Southwest was always suppose to be the â€œfun airlineâ€. This could not be further from the truth. It would be so nice to have a seat assignment.

I fly Southwest several times a year. I love them and I hate them all in the same flight. They are not the cheapest flight anymore. But they are far and away the best freguant flyer program. I hate lining up before boarding. I love that i can change a flight without a charge, every a rewards flight. I hate that I can not upgrade, anything. I hate ho entertanment or real food on board. I hate the seats, I hate the only place to get a flight is thier webb site, no expedia or such. Come to think of it, I hate a lot more than I love, but I do love there rewards program.

The staff for my flight was exceptionally helpful and patient with my family.  I was travelling with my wife and 4 children; the oldest children were barely 2 years old (2 sets of twins).   We had a flight with 3 stops between El Paso, TX and Raleigh, NC, the staff did everything they could to help us manage the trip.  During each stop they went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed and helped entertain the children all while ensuring the flight kept its schedule.  While the children did have moments of discomfort with the pressure in their ears, I must say they acted wonderfully throughout the course of the entire trip.  I must give credit to the flight staff; this is in no small part due to their efforts and understanding.

I understand hiring diversity but the key employees need to have a better attitude. Started with the SMart Mouth Denise in Chicago at the self baggage check in threatening us that she will make sure we miss our flight because she has a chip on her shoulder and a 11yr old is having issues with the self bagging sticker.. what and A-hole she was. Then the wifi on the plane to LAS was out on the plane. Then the flight home Traveling home with the kids we had turbulence so we didn't have the normal time to prepare to land the FA goes lets hurry up move chair up and slide your bag under seat further. I said I have to kids and I can only do so many commands at once and the Ass FA said Im just gonna stand here cause this is my job .. I said Good glad to see you doing your job. I saw all the other FA's working and only seen you at the end.  I worked at Midway Airlines for 10 years. Southwest is going down hill now that Herb has passed. Attitudes need adjusted.

As if the indignation of partial self-serve ticketing weren't enough Southwest continues its joke of service with no reserve seating,  a cattle-call style boarding, no meal flights and two of two late flights. While air flight has become lost unpalatable in recent years Southwest made me consider never flying again. What a joke.

Cannot complain about pricing or baggage. Very affordable and easy to understand about protocols, as this was my first flight ever. Seats could be more spacious, but nothing that would hinder me from flying this airline again

I always fly Southwest when i can.  most recent trip Cle-Msp.  Their friendly, they care the service is great!  I had an issue with intermeittant Internet on one leg and they promptly refunded the money.  Wish they had none stops to LAX, they never would have to fly United.

On our last trip with SW. our luggage arrived at our destination open and with half the items in the luggage missing. I have submitted a claim but no resolution yet. On our way back home our luggage was damaged. They gave me a credit for another flight with this company. A week later my husband received an alert on his credit report of a collector negative charge from this agency. We have never received a bill, call nothing to indicate we are in debt. But our credit report reflects a collection. I would stay clear from this company. Only headaches to come with them.

I have flown on Southwest many times throughout the U.S.  They are a simple low-cost carrier with no frills.  The best thing about them is that your first checked bag is free and they take-off and land on time.  Also, they have an excellent safety record.

Low cost, fast gate to gate without delays.  So if you're flying less than 2 hours FLY SOUTHWEST.  It will cut your gate to gate time versus United by over an hour.  They don't waste time, but it's a poor customer experience.  Time is worth it for me on the short haul but could not take a 3+ hour flight with them.

Southwest Airlines denied my young children from boarding a plane 12 minutes before departure. They were re-booked on another flight which gave them a long layover that was not planned. I called customer service and asked if they could be compensated with meal vouchers because my hungry children, ages 9, 9, and 4 would need to eat. They refused because they claimed my family was late for the flight. They arrived at the airport at 2:30am for a 5:00am flight and were detained in security because my 9 year old daughter packed her rock collection. They arrived at the gate at 4:53am for a flight that left at 5:05am. Southwest's policy is to close the gate 10 minutes before departure, which means they should have been allowed to board. I asked to speak to a manager and was told managers do not take phone calls, but I was welcome to speak to a coordinator. The coordinator refused to offer any compensation and blamed my family for being late for the flight. Then she, her name was Dawn, hung up on me. Totally unreasonable. Zero customer service. No compassion for travelers. Never, ever fly this airline.

Worst experience travelling ever! Our plain was to depart at 2:30 they sent us an alert at 9:45 that it was delayed till 4:30, then again at 11:30 that it was now delayed till 5:30, lastly we were sent at 2:10 our 2:30 flight was on schedule. We obviously missed that flight and called a representative to complain and figure what we needed to do. They told us we could take their 3:45 departure and there was space available on that flight.

When we were checking our bags in, there were only 2 Southwest employees working which made it take an hour to move 20 people. Once we get to the rep there he told us the 3:45 flight was full and he doesn't know why they would have told us that. We  where now stuck waiting for the next flight which wasn't until 7.

Southwest will be a NO FLY for all of my family and friends from now on.

The people complaining about southwest probably don't have that much expensive with the airline industry. I have flown a lot. Every time I fly, I try to get southwest. The baggage system is so good. The flight attendants are nice or seem to be. And you pick where you sit that is nice. There is no charge to sit where ever you want. And it feels good to know southwest has never crashed a plane and less than 10 have died flying with southwest. But it feels like a bus with wings. Over the best airline in the US but I wish they would fly to Hawaii.

When traveling this past week with my 2 year old, I needed to bring my  stroller in order to have transportation for her at our layover and our destination. Not only did Southwest "misplace" my stroller for several days  but upon delivery where I was staying in Rochester, NY it arrived damaged and missing parts. The sun shade was torn, there was a slice through the foam that pads the arm handle, something occurred that makes it difficult to now fold up and two cup holders were completely missing. When I reported it to the man that delivered it, he said he could do nothing. Therefore I went to baggage claim on September 28th at Rochester Airport to report the incident and they said they would do NOTHING for the damages and I should have signed a form indicating damages were not covered. I never signed a form for this, nor knew this was the case. I am a longtime southwest customer, as is my entire family, and I am completely disappointed with the lack of customer service and inconvenience that it put on my trip as a mother traveling alone with a child. My only stroller, which also was expensive, is now destroyed due to the lack of care and misplacement that was done by Southwest.

Flight was great. Departed and arrived right on time. Everything went smoothly until we received our luggage. There were 6 passagers and there was something broken on all of our luggage. There were broken zippers, missing wheels, ripped baggage, and plastic missing. I can't believe how mishandled our bags were.

All of my relatives and friends had told me I was in for a bad experience travelling by air in the United States....especially on the low cost airlines. Well, my experience was quite the opposite. Everyone on Southwest was friendly and helpful. I flew LAS-SAT, SAT-MCO and MCO-MCI and had no compliants. I dis pay the little bit extra for Early Bird check-in and would recommend that service.

Flight delayed. Southwest rescheduled connecting flight even though we made the connection in time, so they would not allow us onboard purchased flight. We waited 8 hours for our connecting flight, arriving at 2am. Southwest sent our luggage to a different city, so we had to stay and claim lost luggage. Then the refused to deliver our lost luggage the next day. We had to drive 2 hours to get the luggage.

Absolutely worst flight Iâ€™ve had in 15 years! I will never again use this Company even if itâ€™s the absolute last resort. I was a very loyal customer of SouthWest. Rapid Rewards, Credit Card, and 100% flew Southwest every trip I took. Not Anymore! After a week long of meetings in FL im flying back to Arizona which is where I live. We had a layover in Atlanta. After flying 7 1/2 hours today my bag doesnâ€™t show up. This is where it all starts. From dealing with the associate by the terminal to dealing with the associate in the Baggage Office. Listen, I understand bags get lost everyday but as a company you should take ownership and help the customer. Not only was she short but did not apologize once. After i explained to her my medication, truck keys, etc. are in my bag itâ€™s not â€œWeâ€™ll call youâ€ easy!!! No offer of delivering my back, no credit of any kind nothing. Now Iâ€™m taking a $52 Uber ride home while I pay another day at economy parking, no medication, and oh yea work tomorrow morning at 8 am. The airport is 1 hour away from where I live.

We absolutely love southwest! It was a senstive time and we were flying for a funeral and we unfortunately left an important iten on the plane. We realized it a bit too late and the plane had gone on to its next destination. The staff at the airport was checking to see if it was turned in to no avail. Well, i recognized one of the flight attendents from the plane we were just on and sheepishly asked if there was something he knew we could do! Well, this young man went above and beyond and found our item, found where it was going, told the crew to put our name on it, and explained what we would need to do to get it back!! He was absolutely incredible and im impressed southwest has that calliber of employee.  Thank you daury!!!

SouthWest just cemented its role as my much-preferred domestic air carrier. A winter storm kept our 30-minute flight from Oakland to Reno from landing... after returning to OAK to refuel we made it on the 2nd attempt. Not SouthWest's fault, and I was grateful they still got us to RNO same day, so when the provided me with an email apology and a free travel voucher via email the next morning, I was delighted. Can anyone imagine United, American or Delta doing that? I expect they'd have deplaned us in OAK, blamed the weather and left us to fight (and pay for) our way over the Sierras. SouthWest is also much easier to book and board, does not charge for flight changes or checked bags, has the best on-time rating, and has more legroom than the legacy carriers. Thanks SouthWest! For a broader perspective on just how bad American air travel is, see the chart at https://www.1843magazine.com/travel/what-the-numbers-say/come-fly-with-me
People are nice but you're still treated like cattle. Southwest also added more seats so goodbye leg room, 6 foot tall people will be very cramped.

The staff for my flight was exceptionally helpful and patient with my family.  I was travelling with my wife and 4 children; the oldest children were barely 2 years old (2 sets of twins).   We had a flight with 3 stops between El Paso, TX and Raleigh, NC, the staff did everything they could to help us manage the trip.  During each stop they went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed and helped entertain the children all while ensuring the flight kept its schedule.  While the children did have moments of discomfort with the pressure in their ears, I must say they acted wonderfully throughout the course of the entire trip.  I must give credit to the flight staff; this is in no small part due to their efforts and understanding.

Great experience.  Flying out of Cabo San Lucas Mexico on 2/14/17 on flight was delayed because of storms in Houston.  Service agent rebooked us as well as our friends on plane that was already boarding in order to get us home.  Ran with us to get us thru security and get our bags on the flight.  The agent Alejandra Solucionnes was awesome!!

I had a horrible experience here at southwest Atlanta first our flight was delayed which is understandable due to the weather but we have been delayed all day and not told any information and everytime we check the app it's a delay of push back and standing at her gate and has no idea about her flight or when or where she is suppose to go ! It's unacceptable and no has even came over to the people's flights who got delayed and offered anything free hotel just a renewed ticket ! The staff is extremely nice and doing their job it's just the way the situation was handled and especially if your flying by yourself .

I had a flight with Southwest Airlines and the customer service was the worst Iâ€™ve ever experience. I will definitely not be flying with that airline again and will be discourage  everyone i know to not fly with that airline again.

Southwest is one of the only airlines that still cares.  United and American seem like they are trying to get our of the passenger carrying business.  Southwest is ALWAYS my first choice.  Best price, service, website, and policies.

Used to be amazing! Now, why even bother??? Used to be cheaper than the rest, especially with bags. Now, you can buy much more affordable tickets, add the price of checked bags and still be less than southwest. We fly an average of 5 times a year (always on southwest) and this is our 4th time this year being ridiculously delayed. If itâ€™s possible to even catch our connection, we will be running. And stressed to the max. To be even more annoying, every flight weâ€™ve done this year, weâ€™ve seen blokes holding seats for their family they were too cheap to buy preboard tickets for. Why is this allowed? They also let people with their grown ass kids get on with the kids under 6. You charge people extra then donâ€™t even stick to your own rules! And the worst, we chose this flight to spend the least amount of time in the airport possible, now weâ€™re just sitting sitting sitting... FOR FIVE HOURS.

I flew twice with Southwest Airlines in 2012 and they are by far the best low cost airlines I've ever flown on. For the 4th of July celebration in America, I flew from Albuquerque to El Paso to celebrate the holiday with friends. The flight left on time, a quiet but comfortable flight and likewise with my return flight to Albuquerque.
In October of 2012, I flew from Albuquerque to San Francisco via Los Angeles. The flight crew were very friendly and overall was a pleasant flight. The stopover in Los Angeles was also quick, making the trip shorter than expected.
The flight back to Albuquerque stopped over in Las Vegas. There was a slight delay departing San Francisco (SFO) due to problems with passengers documents but the flight crew kept passengers onboard entertained, making jokes and talking about Las Vegas. The connection in Las Vegas was short as well as the flight to Albuquerque.
I think it's fantastic that Southwest offer complimentary drinks and snacks, as well as two free checked in bags, low cost airlines here in Australia would never offer this service. The flights are quite cheap, supply your own computer, iPad or iPod as a source of entertainment for longer flights and you are set for a great trip!

I flew to Omaha from Reno in October and from Reno to Seattle in December.  The new seats make for an uncomfortable flight.  The seat pitch is dramatically less (distance between your seat and the seat in front of you). The seats are thinner and harder with less thigh support.  Their staff remain good, although not as friendly as in the past.  The frequent flyer program now is undecipherable, I get an e mail with my "points" each month and have no idea as to how many I need for a free ticket.  Overall, my impression is that Southwest is now completely run by the bean counters.  They have added another row of seats and they obviously don't care how uncomfortable the passengers are, and then the airlines wonder why people are so grumpy and miserable when they fly.

Every experience I've had with Southwest was horrible. The most frustrating and annoying feature about their flight is the first come first serve seating, so if we are traveling as a couple or group, we early are able to sit together after the first half is seated. The seats are small and cramped already and to have to be squeeze in between two strangers is a pain. We are never flying Southwest again until they get rid of this policy!

SO DISAPPOINTED. They have no way to handle weather and blame the customer. I boarded an April 7th flight from Austin to Orlando early Sunday morning connecting through Houston. Shortly after we landed they announced a weather delay for the whole airport. Within 30 minutes Southwest cancelled 75% of its flights, even though other airlines did not. Meanwhile the weather radar right on their screen is showing the weather lightening its intensity. Over the next 2 hours on the phone and at the desk they claimed no ability to help. So, having a training I had to be at Monday morning at 8AM. I rented a car and drove 14 hours. Now for the cherry on top of this accountability disaster. I called today to make double sure my return flight was still on, and I received credit for the unfulfilled leg of the journey. Good news I still have a return flight. Bad news, since I boarded in Austin to Houston I am considered to have taken the flight. No refund, no credit, no bloody acknowledgement they could not fulfill their end.

Be careful when renting a car through Southwest.  They offer special deals on rental cars but we found the cost to be more than if we had rented directly with Enterprise.  We were charged $10.00 per day for the extra driver which when booked directly through Enterprise (as the wife) would have been no charge.  So for seven days, that was an additional $70.00. Also, there was a large upcharge as we kept the car for additional days.
The total bill came to over $1000.00 for 7 days! Not even a full size car.   Definitely a special deal - but not for us.

I just have to say, I love Southwest. When I made a number of mistakes in timing as well as luggage management, Southwest took my problem and gave it a quick, painless solution. I cannot say how much this set the tone for my husband's and my weekend. Thank you so much for your amazing customer service and flexible flight adjustments.

June 19, 2017 I flew out of Memphis and after a Chicago lay over, on to Las Vegas on flight 183. This was the best flight I have ever been on. The whole crew was wonderful! They kept us laughing and were very attentive. The flight was comfortable with a smooth landing. From now on if I can't fly Southwest I will drive. I recommend Southwest and give them the highest rating.

By far the best company I've ever dealt with in my life. I've flown maybe 200 flights and every time I'm not allowed to fly southwest I find something to complain about with other airlines.  These guys have a business model that needs to be followed by all. Customer service is INSANE.. you get an actual person to talk to within seconds every time. And I've never met a bad flight attendant. Every single one of them are great genuine people. Can never say enough great things about them. RECOMMENDED HIGHLY

On today, sept 22. 2016, Flight 532 St. Louis to Dallas. I just got off this flight and I had to let you know what happened earlier. On board we had an ocd mentally ill person gentlemen who was obsessed with being a flight attendant and was interfering with letting the crew do their job. This passenger should have been accompanied by family . I know Taylor and Joann were  2 names, And a very professional blond. Joann managed to calm this gentleman down and even let him participate in things like giving peanuts out. I can tell that had this not been handled so well this poor mentally ill gentleman could have lost it. They went above and beyond their duties to make sure he was acknowledged constantly and we were protected. It was similar to a negotiater. I was so impressed by your crew that I had to stop and write. Thank you south west. You probably touched someone's life that will never forget this and at the same time protected all others from things getting out of hand. Great job.
Great crew!  I can never say enough about the professionalism and attention to customer care that Southwest displays.  Makes every trip a pleasure.

Customer service  was  very understanding and helpful in a situation where we had  to change flights for a family emergency a day early. They were able to get us where we needed to be very quickly and very affordably. Kudos to all involved . We will continue to fly Southwest in the future .
Started flying this past fall. Was upgraded to A-list in 2 months( 8,000 miles) while united requires 30,000 every year! Definitely understand loyalty programs better  than United, Delta or American.
The staff told me my connection was on time to find out when I got to my layover it was canceled. The staff was not helpful at all.

I was in a flight just two plus hours from another flight that would get me in about that much earlier.  Both flights were not much more than half full.  They wanted $225 to get me on the earlier flight.  Just crazy!  They admitted that some agents will do it but they did not want to?  I just did the same with Delta last week.  No more do I fly Southwest.

I have flown frequently on Southwest since their early days at Love Field TX. They are a low cost, friendly carrier with an excellent frequent flyer program. However their new aircraft and newly renovated ones are too uncomfortable for flights over two hours.  I complained to them about seat room and they said its now 31 inches. They did not admit that it is 17 inches with seats fully reclined. I flew BWI to San Diego and it was pure agony. I still fly them about once a month or so but switched to United economy plus on an upcoming cross country flight.  More expensive but I can still stand by 6'1 frame upright after their flight.

This is my favourite US carrier. I recently flew on their 737-800 and 737 Max jets. The flights I took were LAX-LAS // LAS-SEA // PHX - LAX. You get what you pay for. They leave all other carriers in the US for service and inclusions. I LOVE that you don't have to pay for your luggage (just make sure you are under weight as they are very strict). The boarding process is always simple and easy and you get a drink and peanuts/prestzels when you board. The crew always seem happy to be there as do all the staff. Southwest will ALWAYS be my first choice when travelling within America.

I had booked this trip from Denver to Las Vegas five months ago. I had booked this as a surprise for my best friend as a bachelorette/Birthday party. This was a $700.00 surprise. We were on flight 799 from Denver to Vegas at 5:25AM. Landed in Vegas at about 6am Vegas time. We go to get our baggage and only one bag arrived. We submitted a report at 6:40am for the lost bag. Throughout the morning as we waited for a "15 minute " call back, no one called us, no one updated me, and no one can tell me where the bag is! We are now sitting in Vegas and the person/reason for being here HAS NONE OF HER THINGS! Not only does she not have her things,her fiancÃ© hid a surprise card with money in it. There is roughly $600 dollars of makeup, brand new clothing and other valuables in her bag. It is now 9:30am the NEXT DAY and they still can't find my friends bag nor did they call me... I called them AGAIN to get no new information. I'm need more compensation then a measly $50 "travel voucher" that I can't even use unless I SPEND MORE MONEY ON A FLIGHT! This has been the absolute WORST experience. When we were getting on the plane to come home they offered someone a $600 travel voucher for their next flight if they changed flights because they oversold it. We are now back from our trip and they still canâ€™t find the bag. We are not even allowed to start the process of reimbursement until after 5 days. You may call me at (509) 869 8539 or email me at charleyperry33@gmail.com

Beware the Anytime fare that promises early bird check in but does not actually provide it. 
We talked to 3 customer service agents live, and spent an hour on the phone.  They literally could not provide what was clearly advertised & sold to me. 
After the hour on the phone we were advised to pay the $50 upgrade fees and they gave us $100 vouchers for the trouble.

Route was LAX - BWI - LAX over the Memorial Day weekend. I was new to Southwest, so learned about the boarding process as I went. LAX - BWI was fine because I had B05 (ticket was a gift), and there was no pushing or shoving. Coming back I did not check in until five minutes after the 24-hour start time (trouble finding site), so got B56. I arrived at BWI three hours before departure  so I could purchase a lower number, and bought A05 for $40. It turned out to be a connecting flight, though, and there were multiple preboarders. I found a window seat in 4th row, with a woman sitting in the aisle. At first she wouldn't let me take the seat until she confirmed I was alone b/c she "didn't want to sit next to someone." I sat in my seat, and she left her massive purse on the middle seat through two crew announcements to stop blocking seats. Finally she was forced to let someone sit there b/c theflight was full. If not for that she would have gotten away with claiming two seats for the price of one. My reminder that we're not allowed to do that was met with hostility.

Southwest needs to be a lot more alert to seat hogging. Boarding ended up being stressful, and I won't be flying SW again.

Great airline! They just saved the day for me and my little sister! When Frontier couldn't do their jobs Southwest was there to get it done!
I have flown with them numerous times and never really had a problem! I will continue to be a loyal customer!

If there was a way to give a - star ... they would get a few.
The service received on Southwest airlines is the worse I have encounter! I flew this airlines many times in the past and stopped due to the service, tried again this week... AND THEY HAVE NOT CHANGED!
The gate agents are rude, the customer service contact is non existent. The only people you can reach via the phone are reservation people and they have been instructed not to take complaints as NO ONE AT SOUTHWEST HEADQUARTERS WILL CALL YOU BACK... their statement not mine.
IF SOUTHWEST IS GIVING AWAY FREE FLIGHTS... TAKE A CAR! IT IS NOT WORTH THE AGGRAVATION TO FLY WITH SOUTHWEST!

If by any chance anyone at Southwest reads these... it is not the delays, it is not the planes... it is the people that make a business good or bad and it is the policies concerning the care of the customer. You need to train your people and review the policies of how to treat people that are missing connections, and set up a customer service line that is for just that... customer service.
Southwest airlines was great, love free checked bags and carry on. Staff was awesome. Just disappointed that our flight was changed and we were not compensated in any way.

SERVICE??!!!!  March24 Arriving at BWI at 855am. Asked that gate attendant if I was at right gate for my connection.  No one else present...she looked at my boarding pass for one second and said check the board and pointed to the screen.  I checked - it was on time - so I sat down.  When preboarding started for a flight to Connecticut I asked why...  They said my plane was two terminals away so I ran.  The door was closed. I had to wait 6 hours for the next flight
If she had taken a minute to help...!!!!!  I will never use southwest again if I can avoid them.

Southwest sent me an email very late last night stating that they have changed my upcoming flight by 2.5 hours. No reason was given. They also did not call me to discuss the consequences of this change to me.. I wrote to their customer service and they replied that previously they would call the affected customer to discuss alternatives. Now they only state that I can cancel and get a refund "If I do not like their change". I asked for early boarding on the affected flight and their reply to that was absolutely no.

We fly Southwest 6-8  times a year and they are exceptional.  Service is great and the past three flights have arrived AHEAD of schedule.  Changing or cancelling flights is a simple, painless process.  They are head and shoulders above other airlines we have flown.
Be aware that you must pay extra in order to sit near your loved ones, otherwise you are stuck in a middle seat betweeen strangers

What a wonderful time I always have when I fly Southwest. I won't travel on any other airline, unless I'm not paying. They have a lifetime customer with me! If you haven't tried them yet, by all means, do...I doubt you'll regret it!

I recently flew on your airline with my family of 5. On the flight, directly across from us was a young lady with her cat.  My 6 year old son started sneezing unconcontrollably... UNCONTROLLABLY.  the poor boy could not breathe between  sneezes. I wasn't sure what to do so I asked the flight attendant to move us.  She said. ... No. She said there was NOTHING she could do. She didn't move us and she was not concerned with helping us at all. I finally switched seats with him to help a bit as I had a window seat.  I am very disappointed in the airline- which we travel with all the time.  It seems unreal that a child with a cat allergy must sit next to cat an entire flight and suffer.

EDITORS COMMENT: Really? We had no idea a cat could fly on a plane with their owner. Bizarre!

Simply put, SWA is overrated. The biggest complaint is the boarding process.  It is advertised as this entirely democratic, first-come-first served system. The reality is quite different. Despite going on their website exactly 24 hours ahead of departure, we ended up in about the middle of the line. Priority is now given to those willing to pay a fee or who are enrolled in their credit card or whatever. The three of us almost ended up not getting to sit together.  Thankfully, on the remaining legs of the trip, the kind gate agents let us priority board despite the fact that our child is over six. I will not name the routes to protect them. Otherwise, it was okay. SWA is not bad, it simply is not the leader it used to be.
Excellent flight to and from Vegas, look forward to doing it again next year!

There is a lot to say about this airline.
It was my first time flying on Southwest. I went round-trip from Newark, NJ to Houston, TX in April 2014 and I could not believe how attentive these staff were. I was asleep on my flight to Houston and they got me a can of soda out of nowhere once I woke up! I have flown a lot on long flights like these and the staff usually do nothing on airlines like United, but the crew on Southwest went a lot farther. Some things I did not like were the uncomfortable seats (but most airlines have the same seats anyway) and the delay we got on my flight to Newark, which the flight attendants apologized at the end of the flight. That is something I don't see on an airline. I would highly recommend Southwest to anyone.
